Reviews.Title: “Special little hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: FishandRose
Reviews.Content: We were greeted before we even stepped in the door by Ann and throughout our 4 day stay we felt like we were "home". Our room was large with a separate writing desk and two arm chairs and although we did not have a view it was extremely quiet. The wine and cheese every evening was a surprise especially when our glasses were continually topped up and there was a nice selection of cheese and fruit and crackers. The morning breakfast included an assortment of muffins, bagels, pastries, cold cereal, fruit and even hard boiled eggs. When we mentioned that it was our 40th anniversary a complimentary bottle of Bubbly,champagne flutes and a lovely congratulatory letter was waiting for us when we returned later that afternoon. Even the housekeepers were calling us by name whenever they saw us. This little inn made our trip to San Francisco even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Everything's Just Right”
Reviews.Author: FlashDad
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is my home town, and I recently went back there for a high school reunion. I decided to stay at the Inn at Union Square because of the high ratings it received on Trip Advisor. I had stayed at the Hyatt around the corner on previous visits, and my stays were always very pleasant. This time around I'd thought I'd see why this obviously smaller, much simpler hotel was getting such high ratings. The answer, I think, was mentioned by one of the other guests during my stay..."I love this hotel. They think of everything." I would say that just about sums it up. The complimentary breakfast is generous and VERY good. The "parlour" where the breakfast buffet is laid out is very tiny, with room for 4-6 people to eat. So every morning I loaded up one of the trays the hotel provides and took my breakfast back to my room, where I could catch up on CNN while I ate at my leisure. The complimentary wine service in the evening is pleasant, and the cheese and crackers they serve with the wine are REALLY tasty. My room at the back of the hotel was super quiet, and although I am a light sleeper, I slept really well. My taste in decor runs to clean, contemporary lines, however I found the slightly overstuffed and colorful furnishings here to be "just right" for the personality of the hotel. The bathroom is simple, but I took several long showers and never ran out of hot water. The staff was very friendly (including the irrepressible Ann, who is to "bubbly" what the Eiffel Tower is to landmarks.) The location is central to most San Francisco points-of-interest, and if you want to play tourist, there's a Cable Car stop a half a block from the front door. One thing in closing. A previous reviewer complained that the lobby is very tiny. I will agree there was no room for an indoor waterfall. But unless you are planning to hold your Junior Prom in the lobby of this hotel, you will find it--along with everything else--to be cozy, charming and welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, I didn't want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: WaterLily13
Reviews.Content: I loved The Inn at Union Square and felt like I had my own apartment in the heart of San Francisco. The location was excellent. I was upgraded to a suite and my room 501 was just perfect. The Suite contains three separate rooms: lounge, bathroom and bedroom. All rooms were small but this is a boutique hotel and I loved it all the more. The Queen sized bed was extremely comfortable and it was very hard to get out of it each day. The room faced Post Street and being able to open the window was wonderful for a little fresh Spring breeze through the rooms, especially at dusk when the tunes of the trumpet player wafted in from Union Square. A continental breakfast is included in the room price. The Inn also offers complimentary daily evening wine and cheese, which is a really generous addition and is very much appreciated after a long day of sightseeing and walking. The staff were professional, friendly and efficient and were very helpful for orientation and sightseeing. This is the only place to stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Salt Lake City, Utah, United States
Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, but not as good as 20 yrs ago”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to staying at this hotel for years, since I so loved it 20 years ago, when I stayed there fairly often. It is still nice, but has lost a lot of the charm that it had before. Decor is not as charming. Lobby is very plain; can't order breakfast anymore, although it has a pretty nice continental one. Room was pretty stuffy, no air and little ventilation. Had to have staff pry open windows All in all, pretty much vanilla, although nice.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn will not disappoint”
Reviews.Author: brassyg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for the first three of a 5 night stay in California, April 14, 15, 16th. We planned for three nights in San Francisco, and then an additional 2 in Sonoma. I cannot say enough about this hotel, all positive. It felt intimate as if you were staying in someone's home. It was very clean. The innkeeper Wayne, not only helped us to pick great restaurants in San Francisco, but he recommended our now favorite winery in Sonoma County! Thank you Wayne for the complimentary wine tasting (Passalacqua)!! This hotel not only helped you with any and all recommendations for things to do around San Fran, but they made your stay so comfortable. Wine and cheese/crackers, fruit, soft drinks, and sparkling water were available nightly at the evening reception on floors 3 and 5 from 530-7 pm. The wine they served was great quality....no 2 dollar bottles here. You are able to get as many refills as you like. Breakfast offered a very nice selection of pastries, cereals, hardboiled eggs, toast, bagels, fresh milk, awesome Peet's coffee, and all types of Peet's teas. Orange juice, I could go on, I am sure I am forgetting something. The amenities include aveda bathing/hair products. We stayed on the 6th floor which can get a tad stuffy, because these older buildings do not have central air, but the windows open, and allow for the most peaceful sounds of the cable cars and city....truly, this was my favorite part. (And FYI, in San Fran, the weather is so nice, you truly don't need to pump the air conditioner...it was 80 degrees on day we were there, and opening the window, and using a nice fan that the front desk supplied for us, we were perfectly comfortable). I am planning to post some pictures as soon as I get a moment, but I wanted to get this review up and running for those thinking of staying at the Inn soon....you on't regret this stay. OH! And how can I forget, you are a minutes walk from union square....better shopping than NYC in my opinion, and I have shopped NYC many times! :) I will return with pictures soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: araks
Reviews.Content: Caring staff, great location. You can't go wrong staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cathyt93
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after a lot of research on Trip advisor and have to say, I was very glad I did. My husband is not very keen on hotels and this one looked a good choice for him, and it was. It felt like we were staying in someones house really, as it is very intimate and cozy. I took the advice of a previous review and stayed in room 607 which was fab as it was very quiet. Can't find fault at all with the hotel. Is very clean and I loved the breakfast which is served at the end of floors 3 and 5. Again, it didn't feel like being in a hotel as it was help yourself and you could take a tray into you room if you wanted to. We barely saw any staff at all. Early evening you get wine, cheese and nibbles, and 9pm, cookies. I loved all of this and thought it a great touch. Free tea and coffee as well all added to the feeling that you were not in a hotel at all. The front desk staff were all fantastic and so helpful. A big thanks to the fabulous Anne, who should really be given her own tv show! So friendly and helpful! Also to Omar, who saved my life as I had forgotten my travel adaptor and he had a ready spare! A fantastic stay, great location and a lovely, unique hotel. Will definitely recommend it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: amnagaafar
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this lovely hotel was made exceptional by the welcoming staff, especially Anne. It was always so nice to return to our room and be greeted with genuine friendliness. A wonderful location, great breakfast, and true hospitality. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel”
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a total of five nights. Each day, the hotel provided a small continental breakfast and hosted provided wine and cheese in the evening. They also provided free bottled water and a daily newspaper. So, a+ on the amenities. The hotel is located about 1/2 block from Union Square, and we thought it was a good location for first time visitorsto SF. The "hop on/hop off" bus stopped directly across the street from the hotel. We saw few other quests while we were there, so I think the occupancy rate may be low. The lobby is the smallest hotel lobby we have ever seen. They took the photo of the lobby used on their web site by moving out the two chairs they have, and shooting the photo of the mirror opposite the desk. Our only complaint is that they were inflexible with giving us late checkout time on our final day. We asked to check out at 1:45 P.M.(usual time is noon).

Reviews.Title: “Great place in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ktkorner
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at The Inn at Union Square. The rooms were nicely appointed and comfortable and the staff was outstanding. They have a small reception area on several floors where we met up with other guests for breakfast and/or wine and cheese in the evening. We got (and gave) advice on things to do during these times, which made our stay there even more enjoyable. Location was great. We did not bother with renting a car - would actually have been a needless expense. Took BART from the airport and walked a few blocks to The Inn. Bought a three day muni pass for the cable cars and all municipal buses which were easy to access from The Inn. It was simple to get where ever we wanted to go. Lots of good restaurants in the area too, especially iThai just a few blocks up at 720 Post Street. This was very convenient on our first night when we didn't feel like venturing too far on a rainy night. We would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends. Got a nice discount because of the time of year, but even full price is probably better than a large hotel where you would be one of many anonymous guests. The staff here really seems to care about your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Who could ask for more?”
Reviews.Author: freedomfiftyfive
Reviews.Content: We're big fans and frequent users of Tripadvisor, but have never actually written a review about any of the places we've found using the site. This little hotel and it's wonderful staff, however, are well worth the effort and are so very deserving all the praise they've been receiving! We spent three nights, beginning March 26. Perfect location. Warm reception upon arrival, and our room (507) was lovely. Enjoyed the wine and cheese available at the end of the hall in the evenings, a very nice touch. Great dinner recommendations... (the excellent Italian restaurant up the road is called 'Fino'.) Umbrellas magically appeared for us one very rainy evening. Even a hug from Ann when we were leaving! Thanks to all. Great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: Davey2206
Reviews.Content: This little Inn is in the perfect location for any traveller. The staff were very friendly, extremely helpful and nothing was a problem. I loved the wine & cheese on level 3 & 5 at the end of a busy day - an excellent unwind and a fabulous way to meet other travellers and exchange hints! I would highly recommend this little Inn !

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the value”
Reviews.Author: GoogilyEyes
Reviews.Content: We stayed there in late January 2012. The reservation was made through our company travel bureau. When we looked it up on trip advisor we saw that it had good reviews and were very content. The inn provided a car service to pick us up from the airport, when we arrived they were very friendly and helpful. They gave great suggestions for restaurants. Omar suggested and made the reservation for a great Italian place up the road that we went to, I can't recall name (ugh), anyhoo it was awesome. You can't beat the location in the heart of Union Square. Rooms are small, bathroom is small but very, very nice. Housekeeping was great always left water bottle and chocolates (a good thing). A small continental breakfast buffet was layed out every morning on 2 separate floors along with wine and cheese for cocktail hour (5-7). It's a small quaint hotel in a great location, we recommended colleagues to stay and they loved it. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel in the Heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: ABinChicago
Reviews.Content: The service at this boutique hotel was outstanding. We were warmly greeted upon check-in, received a complimentary bottle of wine at turndown and our rate included breakfast and an evening wine & cheese reception daily. On our first evening, Silver Oak was the featured winery. The rooms are small but this hotel offers great amenities for the price. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!!”
Reviews.Author: jephodge
Reviews.Content: This was a truly a perfect hotel for our weekend visit to San Francisco. Great location to transportation and sights. The staff was more than helpful, Anna on first phone call, Kendrick and Omar at the front desk and Wayne, the innkeeper, who gave us the best dinner recommendations--FABULOUS. Wine and wonderful snacks in the evening and comforting continental breakfast in the morning. A definite do again, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “where to stay in san fran”
Reviews.Author: MontrealCanuck065
Reviews.Content: lovely little boutique hotel surrounded by good restaurants and close to all the shops and cable car departures. very friendly and helpful staff. rooms clean,comfortable and quiet.nice continental breakfast and lots of nice little extras like wine and cheese every day between 5 and 7, bottled water and chocolates in room every day. we even had a wine tasting during the friday happy hour. i would recommend to all and would certainly stay there on my futur visits to san fransisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Loll73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here late October 2011, great location , helpful staff and enjoyed the nice little free extras . Definately recommend

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding inn”
Reviews.Author: winst0n4
Reviews.Content: It's hard not to use superlatives for this wonderful inn. Located only a few feet from Union Square, the inn provides accommodation and service far above the norm. The rooms are ample, but also very well decorated -- ours was both practical, in terms of size, space and furnishing, but also elegant, so it was a pleasure to return and simply gaze at the walls, while listening to the little fountain outside. Very good wine and cheese are provided every evening, coffee is always available, and the pastries in the continental breakfast are very good. Finally, the staff were intelligent, obliging and efficient. We would certainly go again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in a centrally located, lovely, initimate hotel at an incredible price!”
Reviews.Author: Deb1955_12
Reviews.Content: The reason I booked this small boutique hotel was location, reviews and it was literally half the price of our conference hotel. But they got everything right! My colleague and I were pleasantly delighted with our week long stay at this small boutique hotel; our rooms were lovely with great attention to detail, clean and quiet. The atmosphere and decor is European mixed with New England. The location is in the heart of the city, ideal for wonderful restaurants, shopping and galleries and within walking distance to the large conference hotels without the burden of staying in one. But it is the customer service that really makes the experience and this staff is absolutely outstanding; it really makes a difference when they anticipate your needs before you do and then add a few extra special surprises! From the minute I contacted Ann to make my reservation I knew it would be a great experience; she is an incredible ambassador for the hotel and indeed San Francisco. She greeted us at arrival remembering my name and the previous conversations. No matter what we asked, she responded with a smile, quickly made great recommendations, booked dinner reservations, transportation, and then she placed a bottle of wine in our room when we were working too late to enjoy the wine receptions. We genuinely thought she was the hotel owner until we met the owner one evening who also was very gracious and charming just like his hotel. In fact all of the staff we met during the week were great; it was clear it wasn't just a job, they genuinely wanted us to have a wonderful experience-what a nice change! As part of the stay they offered a lovely continental breakfast, wine and cheese reception and tea in the evening and there was an abundance to be enjoyed at all three times. We met guests from all around the world and a short drive away, some on business, others pleasure, but many were repeat customers. Regardless of whether travelling alone, in a couple or with friends, I would highly recommend this boutique hotel, but as single women, this experience was truly appreciated. We both said we'd be back only next time on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Ymseduria
Reviews.Content: My favorite hotel, period! (or exclamation mark, that is). Have stayed here on a couple of occasions, and have always been satisfied. Cute little boutique hotel in downtown SF. The location is great, just a stone's throw from Union Square. Staff is very friendly, and they genuinely seem to like working there. Rooms are small, but nicely decorated, and they have great amenities from Aveda. The bed is comfortable. Their complimentary evening wine reception is great, with a good variety of cheeses and nuts.There is also coffee and tea served all day, and chocolate chip cookies at night. Continental breakfast is also included. Wifi is free. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cmish
Reviews.Content: This is a small, above-average hotel in a very convenient downtown location. It is not a luxury property but we found the hotel very quiet and pleasant and we would stay there again. The breakfast was served daily (2 cold cereals, cold hard boiled eggs, bagels, selection of danish rolls, cinnamon rolls, oranges, apples, bananas, almond croissants, milk, OJ, caf and decaf coffee, a selection of teas). February 26, they had someone call in sick so the front desk manager was trying to cover the breakfasts on the 2nd and 5th floors while delivering newspapers and being available at the desk. He did the best that he could. I believe it was only a problem for guests in a hurry to leave who could not wait for him to catch up. The eating areas where food is served are quite small, but you can use their trays to take food to identical sitting areas on the other floors so it was not necessary to eat in one's room. One evening, the "wine reception" was in a suite and featured pouring by a particular Sonoma winery. However, the other evenings the wine and cheese was served in the same two locations where breakfast is served. Few guests seemed to find or take advantage of it, but the wines were acceptable and the cheeses were very nice. There is tea available in those small lounge areas at all hours. Cookies appear late in the evening. The included wi-fi was fast enough for my smart phone. However, it is rather annoying to be required to log back in manually every time I wished to use it (even though I set the phone to remember and log in automatically).

Reviews.Title: “Diappointing”
Reviews.Author: susiemcbride92124
Reviews.Content: I knew it was a small hotel but geeezzzz....the lobby is the size of a large bathroom....only one person works there. Our room was also very small, but comfortable. They promise you breakfast each day....we only got it once. It was very nice the first day...lots of small, but nice choices...muffins, bagels, scones OJ, cereal, hard boiled eggs....only one table in another very small area. The second morning was a disaster....only decaf coffee and one tiny croissant was available....what the heck? I called the front desk and was told someone called in sick. I felt terrible for the guy working....he was very nice and seemed embarrassed. They also had a nice wine setup the first night too....descent looking wine and several cheeses and crackers. The best thing I can say is the location is awesome and it was the quietest hotel I've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good hotel. Quiet.”
Reviews.Author: petarandreev
Reviews.Content: We did not have any special deal, but simply reserved a room on the hotel website. It was not as expensive as I thought it would be for downtown San Francisco and I was pleasantly surprised by the care and attention shown by the entire staff from front desk, to bellman, to housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay, made me feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: GauriMohile
Reviews.Content: Me an my husband stayed here for 3 weeks and I felt so much at home! Lovely helpful staff. Very clean, free WiFi, lovely location what else do you need! It was hard to leave the place... I shall be back! Best Wishes to The Inn at Union Square and each of the Staff Members! Regards Gauri Gupte

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to explore San Fran”
Reviews.Author: Jill P
Reviews.Content: The Inn was the perfect place to stay for our long weekend. The room was nice and cozy. The breakfast in the morning was a great way to start the day whether you want to grab a tray and enjoy a romantic breakfast in bed or getting something to take as you head out to explore. The early evening wine and cheese was the perfect way to start the evening and especially nice if you have late dinner plans and want a little snack. Nestled right in the midst of union square, we walked to Chinatown, North Shore, and to the Wharf. Wonderful relaxing, romantic weekend. Would be my first choice to stay in SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Thought this hotel the best!”
Reviews.Author: annspan
Reviews.Content: We stayed as a family with a few rooms and thought this hotel was the best. It is very centrally situated right at Union Square which is a great place from which to explore all areas of San Francisco. Great shopping right at the door. The staff were very helpful regarding the sights we should see and with restaurant recommendations as well. Walking distance from China Town, the Wharf etc. The rooms were spacious and well appointed. The beds very comfortable. The bathrooms were quite good with nice designer Aveda products to use. We felt very at home at this little boutique inn, enjoyed chatting to the other guests at the happy hour drinks in the evening as well. Breakfast was continental and with a good range of options, all we needed. Will stay here in this charming hotel when again in san francisco.

Reviews.Title: “The great reviews were right!!!”
Reviews.Author: gator-gator
Reviews.Content: O.K. all you guys were right on. This place ruled!! Made us feel right at home and the evening wine was just the right touch. Thanks inn at union square for adding to our enjoyable san fran weekend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with First Class Touches”
Reviews.Author: seattle33
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my one night stay here during the first week of February. We had a room on the 5th floor, which is one of the floors where breakfast and the wine and cheese is served. Our room was second in from the elevator. The room was spotless and clean. It was quiet on this floor despite what other reviewers have said. We did look out on the wall of the next door building but we already knew this was going to be the case. We had enough light in the morning as we were higher up. It was not noisy and I am a light sleeper.The room had an overhead fan I think and kept the room at a good temperature. The king size bed was extremely comfortable. The room was a perfectly adequate size with enough room for a wardrobe, desk and armchair. The bathroom was spacious enough, just a shower no bath and stocked with Aveda products. All the staff who helped us were polite, friendly and helpful. We arrived way before check in and were able to leave our bags while we explored SF. The building is old and narrow but this wasn't a problem, even for my husband who is six foot and over 200 pounds. The extra touches like wine and cheese, turn down service with chocolates and water just added to the great experience. We arrived just as the wine and cheese was laid out and had our pick of complimentary wine, soda, water and cheese and other nibbly bits. The breakfast was beautifully presented with an array of pastries, juice and breads. I'm very picky about where I stay and I was most impressed with this hotel, I think it absolutely deserves the TripAdvisor rating. I personally don't like the downtown area of SF but if you are going shopping, the hotel is right there. Chinatown is an easy walk and the trolley, BART and buses are all really nearby too.

Reviews.Title: “Cute little hideaway 100 meters from Union Square!”
Reviews.Author: victoriousgreek
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a charming, quiet and conveniently located boutique hotel then look no further. I just got back from my trip to San Francisco. My parents had been recommending this hotel to me for a couple of years now and finally I got my chance to stay at The Inn at Union Square. The wine and cheese in the evening was a great in between snack after lunch and right before dinner. And in the morning the same buffet table gets transformed into a breakfast nook. My boyfriend and I definitely took advantage of the included breakfast and snacks in the afternoon. The complimentary WiFi worked great, the shower was warm and the TV was a flat screen so it had a great picture. I didn't need the iron and ironing board on this trip but as someone who usually likes to press her clothes just knowing it was there was a plus. The staff was so friendly and it's literally 100 meters from Union Square where some of the best shopping can be had! What more could you need?

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: ricik
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in December. Everything ran smoothly although we had to accomodate our 10 year old son in a couch in this boutique hotel (these rooms are supposed to receive two people). Employees in particular Ann (she was terrific) were always willing to help out. Cozy, friendly and well located. If you´re going to san Francisco, this would be the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Ana S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 3 nights on 25th January 2012. When we arrived we were given room 404 which was beautiful inside but the windows did face a wall as it was a side room. I asked to be moved and Oliva moved us to room 501 which was at the front of the building. The room had a small lounge area with tv, a bathrrom and bedroom with tv. The room was absolutely spotless and spacious. The staff were absolutely wonderful. Helpful but unobtrusive. They made us feel so welcome and couldn't do enough for us. Breakfast is a very casual affair taken on the landing. We didn't think we would bother with it but glad we did. Breakfast was self service. There was tea, coffee, cold boiled eggs, fresh fruit, cereals, extremely fresh pastries, bagels, cheese and juices. It was a really nice start to the day. The location of the Inn couldn't be better. Right on union square with Macy's, Bloomingdales and Saks nearby. The trollies to fishermans wharf were about a 5 minute walk away. I would highly recommend staying at the Inn.....we will definitely be going back. Mrs Sacco

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: ocall0
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the Inn while attending a conference at the Moscone West site. The Inn is very conveniently located for downtown (right off union square), BART, just up the street from Powel Station, and the Powel Street Cable Car. The staff were superb. Every single person from the reception to the cleaning staff were friendly and welcoming. I didn't have an iron in my room... but it arrive literally a minute after I called the front desk. Otherwise my King room was excellent, VERY quiet. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom spotless. I particularly enjoyed the breakfast buffet and wine receptions (both served in small area on third and sixth floors so although tiny, conveniently set up to allow you to take tray back to your room). I saved about $100 per night staying here instead of at hotel recommended by my conference so I was very happy. I will certainly stay here again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: snooba
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here over Christmas and New Year on the recommendation of some friends, and we couldn't have made a better choice. We arrived in San Francisco and spent two nights in the inn, then took off for a short trip along the coast, then came back and spent another few nights at the inn before heading off again, this time to Russian River. We ended our trip in San Francisco and again stayed at the Inn on Union Square. Each time we came to the inn (3 times in total) we had a different room, and each time the room was clean, relatively quiet (just the sound of air conditioning or generators from other buildings in some rooms) and comfortable. Most of the rooms are at the back of the hotel with a view over the backs of other buildings, but we didn't mind, because we realised that if we'd had a view over Union Square it would have been too noisy. We paid for a regular Queen Room, but were upgraded to a Junior Suite at no extra charge without even asking for it. The staff were always friendly and helpful and made us feel most welcome. Omar at reception was particularly helpful, and it was he we saw most, as he was on duty over Christmas and New Year. He even sent a bottle of sparkling wine to our room when we returned from one of our trips to welcome us back. Wayne, the innkeeper, was also very friendly and helpful, and between them he and Omar provided us with lots of good tips on which restaurants and bars to visit. Anne, also on reception, went out of her way to be helpful too. The breakfast was served in the dining area on each floor, and there was a lot to choose from - bagels, pastries, cereals, fruit, etc, and although there was no minibar or fridge in the room, we were able to use the fridge in the dining area and make ourselves coffee or tea at any time of night or day. There was even a bowl of fruit there and a jar of home made cookies you could help yourself to any time. The cheese and wine reception every evening was also great fun. If we felt like socialising we could stay and mingle with Wayne and other guests, if not we could take some cheese and wine to our room. We were even encouraged to invite our friends along too, which was very generous. We'll definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and come back next time we visit San Francisco. The Inn at Union Square is a little gem!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: SHARON S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week between Christmas & New Years. Everything was perfect. The inn keeper and the front desk people couldn't have been more freindly and helpfully.

Reviews.Title: “Location/Location/Location/Service/Service/Service”
Reviews.Author: sssssfffff
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel 1/2 block from Union Square. The Good: 1st - Wayne the innkeeper is excellent at making every guest feel welcome & cared for! Every night 5:30 - 7pm, Wayne hosts a wine & cheese reception; this time, a winery came & poured their wines; a masseuse from local spa was on hand at the tasting for comp. 5 min. massages for guests -amazing!; every a.m. continental bfst in lounge area at end of each floor; top notch coffee/tea (complimentary) - better than any other hotel; Hop-on/off tour bus has a stop right at front door; 4 stops to the wharf. The Not As Good: 1) common in SF, must valet park; but unlimited in/out; get the parking package up front; 2) a bit older/more historic hotel so carpet in room a tiny bit warn/rooms smaller (i'm extremely picky); however spent most time out touring; std rooms don't have views.

Reviews.Title: “Steps to Union Square...really! :)”
Reviews.Author: travelerlpl
Reviews.Content: I went solo to Union Square for the Christmas Holiday. I reviewed alot of hotels on trip advisor to find one that would suit me since I was by myself. This little boutique hotel offered the amenities I was looking for. I reserved a queen room (although I knew that the room is very small), but the price fit what I wanted to spend. When I arrived at the hotel, I was offered an upgrade to junior queen suite that also had a little sitting area. The room was nice appointed, although it was a little worn, but clean. View from room was not good (walls of other buildings and heating/air ventilation system or something in the middle of the buildings). Not a problem though...I was there for the Union Square Holiday lights! Wine reception offered at 5:30 was very pleasant with cheeses, fruits and crackers right at the end of my hallway in a sitting area. Breakfast was also served there with coffee, juices, scones, muffins, hard boiled eggs, fruits, yogurt and other little danishes. Very nice! They also had trays there so you can bring it all back to your room to enjoy. I felt very comfortable there and people were friendly also. If you are looking for something grand, this is not....it's a small, cozy hotel with a few nice perks to also include bottled water, newspaper and chocolates with turndown service!

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome to San Fran!”
Reviews.Author: trishm51
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel with great staff and ambience. A few minor drawbacks- I had paid for and confirmed 2 days prior to my arrival we had a deluxe King room. Upon check in I was told we had a Queen which is cheaper. The clerk on was not the one I had corresponded with online but he immediately changed my room to my initial booking. The building is old but very quaint. Our room was 507 which is nice because although the view of a back building was not great it was away from the noisy Union square and therefore lovely and quiet at night. Our heat was not working when we checked in and the room was very cold. We went downstairs to leave and were told by front desk about the problem without mentioning it to them and were told they would have a portable heater placed in our room immediately and it would be fixed the next day. The heater worked well enough but it was 2 days before the heating system was repaired. The wine and cheese every night was lovely and a great way to meet the other guests and our host Wayne. He is a wealth of information on everything you need or want to know about the city. The complimentary continental breakfast was adequate and the free internet and use of business center was another nice perk. Anne is lovely and runs on high octane I think. Omar was also a great help throughout our 5 day stay. The rooms are clean and smallish but well maintained. The location is perfect and if I am ever back to this city I will definitely stay here again,Thanks for the warm welcome!

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: Di5227
Reviews.Content: OMG this place is fantastic. We are used to staying in 4 & 5 star hotels so I was a little worried about the boutique nature of this hotel but I was wrong. The welcome from Ann on reception and the fantastic advice about restaurants etc from Wayne not to mention meeting other guests at the very generous wine and cheese happy hour each night really made our stay. There were 3 of us and we stayed in the Penthouse Suite which was roomy and cozy with 2 tvs and 2 toilets. There is no better location. We walked to North Beach for fantastic ITalian food at Ristorante Ideale and to Chinatown which are both an easy and interesting 15 minute stroll. We were sorry to leave The Inn and will stay there again on our next visit to San Fran. Thanks Wayne and Ann for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: travelinggringo
Reviews.Content: I visit the Bay Area a few times a year and I chose this hotel for a New Years getaway. Pros and Cons: Pros: Close to transit, shopping and great restaurants Staff was very kind and helpful (Found a firm pillow for me! Thank you!) Bed was very comfortable Continental Breakfast & Wine and Cheese Reception was lovely and came in handy Small, intimate hotel Rooms were a nice size for this type of hotel Our room was fairly quiet Cons: No view Elevator dated and slow TV was slow and not really responsive (remote to tv issue?) and no sleep timer Small bathroom - not much space The pros outweigh the cons. Would I stay there again? Maybe if the price was right. I would probably try another hotel that was slightly larger with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, and Location”
Reviews.Author: DaleRachmeler
Reviews.Content: This small but excellent hotel (service, comfort and location) is a really very well run establishment catering to all types of people. Its location on (100 ft from) Union Square in downtown San Francisco cannot be beat. Since it is long and narrow and squeezes into the surrounding buildings, it is virtually noise proof the farther you go back on each floor. We had a deluxe double and so the room was spacious and well equipped. Beautiful bathroom and they use Aveda products which is a plus considering the quality of this line of cosmetics. The internet is fast and wireless and complementary. The staff at the reception are exceptionally friendly and can guide you anywhere you want to go. Use the valet parking as the time and expense of finding parking in the heart of SF is painful. Garages fill up fast and are numerous but lugging your bags to and fro can easily be avoided using their valet service (for a fee of course). We know the city very well and were spending only two nights as our friends were still on vacation. You cannot go wrong here. It was simply a delight to go out shopping on the mega shopping day (26 Dec) and only have to walk 3 minutes to one of Macy's flagship stores on Union Square. One of the very nice things is the complementary breakfast that is served in the small lobbies on the third and fifth floors. Wonderful pastries, Peet's coffee, a wide variety of fruit and organic cereals. Also don't forget that each evening this is wine and cheese tasting and a very pleasant way to meet the guests staying there. As others have already said a gem and we would certainly stay there again. One caveat, don't eat at the Mortons Steak House next door, a real rip off despite its previous reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hidden Gem in the Heart of the City!”
Reviews.Author: FussyGrl
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square is a hidden gem. I've probably walked by it about 25 times and never noticed it before. But it's worth finding. It's right off of Union Square (on Post St. and Powell, basically), yet it's a peaceful oasis. The rooms are quiet (with perhaps the exception of the -01 rooms on each floor, which overlook Post) because they face onto a gap between buildings. That means there isn't a great view, but personally, I'd rather have a quiet room just steps from the city center. Breakfast is included, as is wireless internet access. I have to give a shout out to the incredible staff. They are all very nice and helpful--and it seems like they are truly that way, not just faking it. Ann checked me in, and she set a great tone for the rest of my stay. I would recommend staying on floors 4 or 6 if you want it really quiet, because breakfast and wine are served on floors 3 and 5.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem.”
Reviews.Author: ALFRED99
Reviews.Content: This was a three night stop-over for myself and my wife on the way to Hawaii in October and was our third visit to San Francisco.We particularly wanted to stay near Union Square (This Hotel is actually at 440 Post Street about fifty to a hundred yards from Union Square) and so the location was ideal. Plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby along with Macey`s and other high end stores and close to the trolley stops. Hotel has about thirty rooms and ours on the third floor was quiet, clean and spacious. No view but that was irrelevant to us as the peace and tranqulity of the location was more important. Comfortable bed, Good bathroom, excellent shower and lot of little personal touches.Complimentary Breakfast was delightful with very good choices although sadly we could not make the wine tastings because of other committments. The staff were superb and really did want to serve you and be helpful. Our special thanks to Olivia, Ann(e) and David who were all very kind, well informed and helpful to us, especially in organising our internet flight check in and the $50 cab to the airport. If this is the right San Francisco location for you and you like small and friendly the Inn at Union Square is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “More like apartments then hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: rollachick
Reviews.Content: I got what I thought was a great rate through http://booking.com. Little did I know that there were going to be another $120 of taxes which hadn't been included. That made this deal 'not a good deal' at all. The rooms as mentioned were on the small side. I would've preferred one 'large' room over two small rooms as we did not use the 2nd room at all. The view was non-existent and we looked out at a brick wall in both rooms. One morning, there was pounding outside the window which was loud enough to rattle and continue to wake us from slumber. We enjoyed the free breakfast and the night service of two bottles of water and chocolates. A few things to point out though: * Maid service was inconsistent. One night, she left our new toiletries on the bathroom counter but not 'in' the spots they should have been in. Another night, she set our bottles of water on the night stand. The next night, she put them in the sitting room we never sat in. * TV - The TV had Comcast digital boxes which was great. I love being able to look up what is on the TV and what channel I can flip to quickly. The downside was there was no 'sleep' function on the TV itself. This comes in so handy when you want to fall asleep but not wake to a infomercial running at 4am to a Shake Weight. *Entry Way - After a certain hour (I'm unsure when as it wasn't posted), you needed your room key to open the front door to the hotel lobby. We figured this out after we were locked out the first night and had to be let in. It's not a big deal as I'm guessing it's one way to keep the hotel secure but was a bit strange to have to have your room key out to get to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy spot downtown”
Reviews.Author: wigleyem
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked this room through a deal site, but after all the fees and taxes, it wasn't as good of a deal as we initially had thought. This made it pricier than we expected, but probably on par with other hotels in the city. The location was good, sitting just around the corner from Union Square Park. The room itself was cozy and cute. It was actually two separate rooms; a bedroom and a sitting room. There was a TV in both rooms and it felt much like a small apartment. Temperature controls were easy to use and the bed was comfortable. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfast each morning. Our personal preference was for the fruit, juice, and muffins. They also had maid service twice a day, which was nice, leaving free bottles of water during the evening service. All in the all, this was a comfortable stay. It wasn't super swank or fancy, but nice for the price. If you're looking for a place to stay downtown, I'd recommend you take a look at the Inn at Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably fine property”
Reviews.Author: TravelingExec53
Reviews.Content: When I am in San Francisco I prefer the Inn at Union Square to any other hotel, including ones that cost ten times as much. Friendly staff, big home-like rooms, all the details tended to (robes, sewing kits, highest quality fruit and tea available all day, excellent breakfasts and wines included--stuff that has disappeared even from high end hotels) at amazingly reasonable prices in an excellent location. Don't be put off by the fact that only the door is visible from the street; this is a little gem worth finding. Definitely an old world feel. The service is truly amazing; attentive but unobtrusive. It is also one of the best values for money for a hotel anywhere, one of the rare places where every surprise is a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: Golda42
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Inn Friday around 4:00 P.M. and was impressed with the semi-private entrance. Once inside Ken at the Front desk was quick to welcome us by name. Almost as he knew who we were. (very nice touch). While checking in Wayne (hotel director) meet us and began some small talk. Wayne is a very nice man. Wayne even walked us up the room #607 and gave the quick tour. The personal touch in San Francisco, 50 yards from thousands of people watching the tree lighting was just amazing. The Inn even provided my wife with a bottle of Champagne for her birthday. The fireplace was loaded with a gunny sack full of wood which we later used. The room was clean and quiet. The amenities were quality and felt upscale. The bed was comfortable. After freshening up we walked down to the 3rd floor for complementary Wine, Cheese,Crackers,nuts and fruits. The Wine choices were Red and White and my wife found it delicious. After the enjoyable conversation with some fellow guests and Wayne we departed to Union Square for a walk around. Around 8:30 we arrived at the Inn and was offered fresh backed chocolate chip cookies and coffee. Forwarding to the morning the continental breakfast had a wide variety of fruits, danishes, cereal, and juices with coffee. Unfortunately we had to cut the stay a day short as we had a family member with a medical emergency. Ken checked us out around 3:00 and did not charge us for the evening stay. We have nothing but raves for the staff and the facility. Oh yes, we will be back. T&G P

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler32
Reviews.Content: My wife and I only had one overnight in SF, and stayed at the Inn at Union Square. Everyone was very friendly, they had wine and cheese at 5:30, the room was very spacious with a comfortable bed, and the location is really perfect. The room included continental breakfast on two different floors and was very nice as well. Highly recommend this inn. There are many restaurants nearby, so this had everything we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “what a great inn-we hope to return”
Reviews.Author: brinkKenora
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at this wonderful, little inn in the heart of san francisco in the spring of 2011 and were most impressed. The location, the inn itself, the staff, in particular anne and omar, made our holiday one of the best we have had. The continental breakfast, the wine and cheese reception every evening, made our stay at the Inn a delight. The little touches like the evening plate of cookies in the lounge, the availablity of umbrellas and the evening turn-down service, complete with a chocolate made the stay even more pleasant. Should we be lucky enough to return to this wonderful city, we would definitely stay again at the Inn at Union Square-it was all we had hoped for, and more; a real gem of an Inn; we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: CDee15
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 2 nights at the Inn at Union Square and had a fantastic stay. We had excellent service - from the front desk staff to housekeeping to the car attendants! Can't say enough about how welcome and secure they made us feel. The breakfast and evening appetizer were great - breakfast had lots of healthy options and more than enough to choose from. Time and money-saver. Our room was a corner room, not a huge room, but it had everything we needed and was super clean. The location of the hotel is IDEAL. Right at yor doorstep is shopping, shopping, shopping!! Lots of great restaurant and theatre options too. And if you're willing to hoof it a little, you can walk to some of the common tourist sites, too. Again, great overall hotel! No complaints at all. We would defintely stay there again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn”
Reviews.Author: Maxie1777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple recently spent 2 nights at this terrific Inn. It had many special touches, such as umbrellas in the guests rooms and chocolates left with the nightly turn-down. Wayne, the Innkeeper, was very helpful & friendly and it is in a great location, right next door to Morton's Steak House. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Mauibaby507
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the Inn at Union Square. We had previously stayed at the St. Francis and the Fairmont, but we like this hotel much better. It is a small, boutique hotel and you feel the difference from the time you check in until you leave. This is an old line hotel built in the early 1900's and although it is well maintained, if you are looking for sleek and modern, this hotel is not for you. If you like a small, intimate feel, you will love this hotel. When we got to our room, they called to make sure we were happy. In this case, the room we got was not as nice as the one we had last time, so we asked if there was another room available. There was one and they changed us right away. They called again to be sure it was what we wanted. They also called before we left to see if we needed transportation to the airport. They provide a really nice cold breakfast buffet in the morning and a wine, cheese, fruit and crackers snack at 5:30 in the afternoon.. What more could you ask for! Prices for the hotel vary a lot so keep checking until you get a rate that seems fair. We got an Expedia package and the price was very good. This is the only hotel for us in SF!

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back”
Reviews.Author: alohatripper
Reviews.Content: Nov 9-12, 2011 Try to find a well-located hotel offering a different experience apart from a big chain. This place is it. It is across the street from the iconic St. Francis Hotel. On Post it is 1/2 block to Union Square and the cable car, in addition to the restos and shops that help to define San Francisco. When I made the reservation, there was a controversy about the parking. I understood that the web rate included parking but was never verified by the confirmation report. In the end I got parking at a subsidized rate but upgraded free to a Q suite on the top floor. Being on the top floor didn't mean a view however. I am a bit "sticker-shocked" at the tariffs of the better hotels in SF. This place is still fairly reasonable for what you get: very large room with a wood-burning fireplace, a decent-sized bathroom with a tub, flat-screen TV, safe, comfortable bed, tranquility, and cleanliness. Breakfast is included. It is continental but fresh and plentiful. Coffee is 24/7 and not from a machine. Oranges are offered too. I have to commend the service staff from Wayne, the Innkeeper, Omar, Anne, Oliva, and particularly the night staffperson, David. All are fine reps of this establishment. I had to depart early and David could not do enough to insure that we were provided with all the amenities and service. We left with a feeling that this place does everything right.

Reviews.Title: “Everything but luxury -- and I mean that as a compliment”
Reviews.Author: Koermendi
Reviews.Content: Location, very good; rooms neither cramped nor cavernous and furnishings comfortable (a desk chair in which one can actually sit and work -- ample hot water -- perfectly clean -- Goldilocks bed, neither too hard nor too soft but just right); parcels received for me before my arrival and kept safe; WiFi gratis; and when I asked to purchase a stamp for a letter I was told that that too was gratis. Good coffee, yogurt, dry cereal, fresh fruit, and a reasonable selection of baked goods and conserves set out of a morning. Wine, fresh fruit, crackers / biscuits, and a very adequate cheese tray set out of an early evening. Friendly staff. I shall stay here again with pleasure. Why "everything but luxury"? Well... if you want gold-plated shower taps, go elsewhere. This hotel supplied me with everything that I needed and surprised me with a few little pampering touches like that cheese tray. It didn't skimp on what it provided (toiletries, continental-breakfast items, wine worth drinking). But it also didn't splash out on things that I didn't need or want, like acres of lobby space, and that strike me as driving up, to no purpose, the cost of a hotel stay. Excellent value for money here.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn = 5 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Mari S
Reviews.Content: Hands down, the most unique, charming, friendly and cozy hotel that you can stay at in San Francisco. Let me start by saying that I have been a repeat guest at The Inn for the past 6 years. My first visit to The Inn was in January 2005, and I have been back every year since. If you are a first time visitor to San Francisco, or even if this is your 10th visit, let me explain why the Inn is the best pick for your trip to SF. SERVICE/STAFF: 5 stars. The front desk staff are professional, friendly, knowledgeble and accommodating. Because this hotel is a much smaller hotel, the staff here are personable and provide top customer service. Ken, Omar, Ann and Joe at the front desk have been there for years and are excellent at what they do. Wayne, the Innkeeper, provides wonderful hospitality and is extremely friendly. He will often be around during the evenings to meet and chat with the guests during wine hour. I can tell that the staff at The Inn really have passion in what they do, as I can see they always aim to make their guests happy and comfortable. HOTEL/ROOM: 5 stars As you should know if you don't already, this is a small, boutique hotel. Those of you who love to stick to large Hilton/Sheraton/Hyatt/Marriott brand chains and go for cookie cutter rooms, please be aware you will not find that here. However, you will find a very elegant, cozy and comfortable room waiting for you at The Inn. Yes, their hotel is small and yes, their rooms are a bit on the smaller side. But so what? Unless you plan on carting your entire bedroom with you on vacation, I highly doubt this will be an issue. And I also read about the complaints without an A/C. Yes, the Inn does not have A/C but first of all, SF tends to stay on the cooler/cold side almost all year long, with the exception of maybe 2 odd weeks and a few odd days in the September or October months. Additionally, the bedrooms are equipped with ceiling fans so that should help on a rare warm evening. In regards to the common areas, the lobby area is small but the only reason you go through the lobby is to come & go, speak with the staff or wait for a taxi/shuttle. The seating areas on each floor of the hotel are a nice touch and great to relax and have your breakfast and/or evening wine and cheese. AMENITIES: 5 stars The Inn is all about providing their guests with great amenities! -Aveda toiletries in the guest rooms -Daily continental breakfast (incl. pastries, yogurt, cereal, bananas, hard-boiled eggs, OJ, milk, coffee) -Evening wine & cheese hour w/ fellow guests -Nightly bottled water & chocolates to your room -Nightly cookies in the common areas LOCATION: 5 stars The Inn is all about location. They are located near the corner of Post & Powell streets, so this is a really great location for those who want to be in the center of town - especially for dining and shopping! Aside from the hotel itself, The Inn is so great for being in such a prime location! In conclusion, I HIGHLY recommend staying at The Inn at Union Square. You will experience a stay in SF that will be unlike staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good but surely not the 5th best in SF”
Reviews.Author: Notts_Today
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong this is a very well run hotel with friendly knowledgeable staff but I cant rave about it like other people have. It reminded me of a very British B&B. The boutique personal atmosphere didn’t win me over. It is exactly what I expect when I go to a privately run small B&B in England. We stayed for 5 nights, well actually it was 4 because of a 'plumbing problem' so we were put up in the Kensington Park Hotel(Rank 22) literally 10 seconds walk away. This caused us no problems and was thankful the Inn@USq dealt with this matter very professionally. The room at Inn@USq (apparently we got upgraded) was a small bedroom with a large bed with enough space to walk around, a separate room with sofa and desk and a bathroom. I don’t know what level room this was but it was room 203. Couple of small stains on the carpet but everything else was to a good clean standard. Positives - Clean, excellent service, great location, well priced rooms, good breakfast (although I had to eat stood up one time due to lack of room. Also reading an earlier post about room 501...I actually said to my partner that we should be thankful we are not in that room.), good strong Wi-Fi signal, the cheese and wine is a nice touch but I never had it due to always being out at that time. Staff couldn’t do enough for you if you required assistance. Negatives – Small and you seem to be in the way often. Sometimes I just want to be quiet and go about my own business but here I always felt you had to be involved in conversation. I found it very pokey whereas the modern hotels you get lots of space. The breakfast area needs looking at, I don’t want to go to a hotel and eat standing or as the post below stated....do a DIY! , small room with no air conditioning which made it stuffy sometimes. Overall – A good place to stay. Good location. If you want to get the cable car to Fishy Wharf then get up for an early one!!!!! The queue was mighty long. If the parking is to be paid by you and not a business we parked the car ourselves with no hassle just around the corner and saved ourselves at least $50. I thought the valet was expensive (and we knew once the car was parked it wasn’t moving for 5 days). 5th best hotel in SF? No. 5th best service in SF? Maybe I wouldn’t object to staying here again but will try somewhere different when I next visit SF.

Reviews.Title: “A unique place to stay with super staff and nice touches.”
Reviews.Author: TVSCHUCK
Reviews.Content: An older, small little hotel. The staff is super friendly. The rooms are older, but comfortable. No AC, but not needed when I was there. An open window was enough. Wine and cheese in the evening was complementary as was breakfast. And a late night cookie jar was a surprise. Great location in the Theater District. An easy walk to great restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Ditto”
Reviews.Author: Barryh8
Reviews.Content: What else can I add to all the previous reviews except ditto. We are staying here as I type and my wife and I love this hotel and totally warrents the previous reviews. No hesitation, I would recommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at the Heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Gsdtrue
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location. All the requirements of a successful visit are within steps of the front door. Restaurants, shopping, theatres, transportation links, tourist sites, bars and car rentals are easily accessible by foot. The staff, no problem is too big, no problem is too small, for them to help make your stay easier and more enjoyable. They were friendly, engaging, knowledgable, they addressed our concerns professionlly and with a smile on their face. What a pleasure dealing with people who take their job seriously and do it well. Their service was first rate. As often happens with our travel plans, they changed on the go. Rather then returning to the airport with a car rental to go home, we decided to return to SF for a couple extra nights. Not having anything booked and the Inn booked, we asked to be emailed if anything opened up. Before we had returned, the staff had notified us of an opening and booked us in for our last two nights. Having to return the vehicle by noon we were prepared to wait to check but upon our arrival we found a room ready. The rooms we stayed in were the '06 rooms. They are a jr. suite room. There was room to spread out in they were clean and well kept and the bed was comfortable. Don't worry about no air conditioning SF is a maritime climate and cools at night. Open a window and leave the fan on you'll be fine. What a convenience to be able to have a quick light or more sustaining breakfast in the sitting rooms on the third and fifth floors. Over a cup of coffee with a stranger, we discovered we had a mutual friend, how cool! In the evening these sitting rooms were set with snacks, drinks and wine. Staying twice over a period of time we literally visited with fellow travelers from around the world. These conversations at times were so interesting that evening plans often got pushed back. The one time this didn't happen was the evening a busker was playing a wonderful jazz trumpet in the square. His music kept drifting in the open window, we finally walked over to listen. It was really a San Francisco treat. If we left our heart in San Francisco it was at the Inn at the heart of San. Francisco, we totally recommend this wonderful hotel and would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: McGovern72
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in this small hotel ideally located just steps away from Union Square. The front desk staff are superb. Our room was beautiful and an adequate size although some rooms appeared smaller than ours. The bathroom was small but it was updated and clean. Bed was very comfortable. Yes, the only view was a brick wall and finished private alley but I expected this situation and it is a fair tradeoff for the great location and lower price than the large impersonal hotels nearby (e.g. the Westin St. Francis or the Marriott). Note that there is no air conditioning which was not a problem during our stay with open window and ceiling fan. This could be an issue only if a "heat wave" hits San Francisco which is relatively infrequent. Hallways are narrow but the hotel is small with only 5 to 6 rooms per floor so there is very little traffic. Breakfast in morning is best brought back to the room from small parlor at end of hall since there is only one table for 4 people located there. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel to people who prefer small intimate boutique hotels with fantastic personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a great central location”
Reviews.Author: Azardamus
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in the center of town. excellent rooms, comfortable and well appointed. nice touches like free wine tasting each evening and a tasty continental breakfast each morning. no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “A cute little place”
Reviews.Author: Borisrocks
Reviews.Content: Small, but oh la la! Very courteous receptionists. Great little extras in form of a wine reception every evening on our floor (3rd) as well as a continental breakfast buffet - help yourself on the same floor. Convenient location for (walking) visits to Chinatown, the Ferry Building, Market Street, etc. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tom A
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights while we explored San Francisco. As a central base, it was ideal. It was comfortable, clean and caring. The furnishings and facilities were more than adequate & the staff were always helpful and, occasionally, entertaining. Nothing was too much bother. The evening cheese & wine gave us an opportunity to meet other guests and to swap experiences & tips that enriched our stay. We met people from all over & it was a great way to relax. Wayne, the manager, joined us & added his local knowledge and stories. Great fun. We would highly recommend the Hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: peoplesvisionusa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at The Inn and it was perfect for us. This is an informal Inn rather than a luxury hotel. It does not have a large lobby, restaurants and bars, but It did offer nightly wine and cheese, a great continental breakfast and conversations with fellow travelers from around the world. It is close to everything and we walked everywhere: no car and no taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: sunbelters
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a different hotel for our return to San Francisco to celebrate our twentieth anniversary. The Inn at Union Square was outstanding. It is a small hotel (30 rooms) with big hotel services. You are cordially greeted upon your arrival, Omar you were outstanding. Every night there is a wine and cheese reception and Wayne the Innkeeper will join you. I was amazed that he knew our hometown hockey heroes. We met and talked with people from Australia, Louisisana, England and many more interesting places. What a great way to unwind after visitng SF all day. A great breakfast is served each morning which you can bring back to your room to enjoy. It is centrally located near the Powell and Market streets cable car s well as Chinatown. This hotel is a must. Can't say anymor about our great experience. Thanks Wayne for a wonderful time. We will recommend this experience to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A real character”
Reviews.Author: gth01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at Union Square for six nights. It's a lovely old building and unlike the other hotels we stayed at in the US on our trip, a continental breakfast was included in the room rate. There are some real plus points to this hotel: location, wine time, free internet and great staff being most notable. The location couldn't be better - very close to Union Square with its upscale shops and the Westfield shopping centre, very handy for the cable cars and also close to some great restaurants (you must try Scala's Bistro, just a short walk away - but book ahead if possible). There's also wine time, when between 5.30 and 7.00pm you can drink wine and eat cheese and biscuits with your fellow guests. Free alcohol's always a plus, but it also means that you actually get to meet and chat with fellow travellers. The free wi-fi is great. The connection here seemed super fast. I was able to stream video clips from YouTube and surf the internet as effortlessly as if I was on my home wi-fi. It was also very easy to connect to. We had possibly the warmest welcome I've ever experienced when we arrived, from Ann, who was larger than life and exceptionally friendly (as were all staff we encountered). I cannot praise Ann highly enough, because I think that this kind of personality is lacking in so many hotels (on our trip we also stayed at the Mandarin Oriental in Vegas - five star luxury, but they needed an Ann...). During our stay, personal touches included front desk calling us on our last night to see if we needed help arranging transport to the airport. There's also a turn-down service where they bring you water and pillow chocolates. Unlike many hotels, the room we stayed in wasn't air conditioned and instead had a great ceiling fan. We liked this feature a lot as it meant that we managed to get a night's sleep without having all of the moisture sucked from our bodies. San Francisco is not hot generally, so air con really isn't needed. In terms of room amenities, the bed was large and very comfortable. The curtains shut to make the room very dark at night (I'm a light sleeper so this is very important). In the bathroom there were nice Aveda toiletry freebies. There was an iron and ironing board and even an umbrella in the cupboard for our use. The downsides of the hotel (there are always some): the room we stayed in was quite small. It would have been fine for two or three days. For a six night stay, it was too small and I started to feel penned in. I can't comment on how large the other guest rooms are though. Because space in our room was tight, the safe was on a high shelf. I'm 5'11 and had to stand on a chair to try and find things in there. Just a few pointers for those who have never been to SF before: You will see more homeless and crazy people in one place than you will have ever seen before in total. It's very sad. The area around City Hall is worst of all. Fisherman's Wharf is the equivalent of London's Leicester Square - a complete tourist trap. There are lots of hotels round here and I'm so glad we didn't stay at one. The wine train is definitely worth a day out and I would highly recommend a few hours sailing under the Golden Gate Bridge in a catamaran. The queue for cable cars at the turnaround point is sometimes an hour's wait. If you don't mind hanging off a pole, wait a few stops up the street, as often the cars don't leave completely full.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing welcome...”
Reviews.Author: F4monty
Reviews.Content: The welcome at The Inn at Union Square is second to none. Businesses the world over can take lessons in the customer service provided to guests here, from the friendly staff on the front desk to the free cheese, wine and cookies laid on every evening in the lobbies. Location is excellent, just off Union Square with its many shops and a short walk away from the transport hub at Market and Powell. The Georgian decor is warm and fits excellently with the architecture of the building itself. It is a small hotel and the lack of space can feel claustrophobic at times. Our room was on the small size although there wasn't a problem with storage. However, there was no view from our window other than the brick wall of the neighbouring building. The city was experiencing a heatwave while we were there so the fan in the room sometimes struggled to keep the temperature down with there being no air conditioning. Cleanliness was excellent and maid service faultless. Bath robes are available and there's an iron and safe in the room. A continental breakfast is provided in the lobbies and this can be taken there or in your room. It was more than adequate for our needs. The only problem from our point of view was that our room was close to the lobby so the noise from breakfast did sometimes wake us up early in the mornings. A free newspaper is delivered to your door each day. On the whole, I'd recommend this place and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “No elevator service, so we had to climb 4 floors with heavy suitcases. It seems that it was just an unfortunate coincidence on o”
Reviews.Author: Abusado
Reviews.Content: Rooms are small, the corridors are narrow. Our room faced a wall. Booked a king size bed a got a queen size, with the information that it was "an upgrade". No air conditioning in a very hot SFO day. We left. The staff, and manager however were brilliant, and very flexible.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have stayed in! Stay here if you visit SF”
Reviews.Author: leftys_rule
Reviews.Content: My husband and I could not rate this highly enough! Everything about the hotel was fantastic. 1. the warm welcome by the front desk staff. Who greeted us every evening asking us how our day was and remembered where we were going that day 2.The room was extremely clean and we got morning papers delievered to our room for free every day. 3. Continental Breakfast served daily which you could eat in your room and was complimentary. 4. Every evening there was complimentry wine and cheese. This was the highlight as we were able to mingle with other guests and compare trips get reccomendations and to get tips for the area. Wayne the manager was very helpful and we enjoyed the chats every evening and the great food recommendations. Definately stay here if you visit San Fransico! A great experience. A small Inn with a great personality.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here when in SF. Guest since 1987.”
Reviews.Author: nancysnowboards
Reviews.Content: Perfect home away from home. Won't stay anywhere else when in town.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, personalised service, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: chicadee79
Reviews.Content: Staff at this hotel were so friendly and welcoming. Met lots of other guests from different countries with the included hors d'oevre and wine tastings held each evening and buffet breakfast in the mornings. Fresh fruit, water, cookies left out for guests in communal lounge/kitchenette area on each floor with ice, fridge, gourmet tea and coffee selection. Staff were happy to advise on places to visit in the area and dining suggestions. My partner and I agree this is the best boutique hotel we've ever stayed at, loved chatting to the other guests and staff with travel suggestions. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Character”
Reviews.Author: VillaMTBMan
Reviews.Content: The lobby was very small and you could miss it amongst all the bigger lobbies surrounding it. However the room was much bigger, very clean and full of character. The staff were extremely pleasant and the breakfast at the end of each hallway between rd and 5th floors was a unique experience. A great hotel and so glad I picked it based on other tripadvisor reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Old time charm, romance, and the best staff imaginable”
Reviews.Author: DaveSalyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our 30th anniversary last weekend (Sept 2011). This quaint hotel is clean, quiet, beautiful, and romantic. Continental breakfast is served in parlors on each floor and wine and cheese are served in the evening. The staff is the friendliest I've ever encountered. Dead quiet at night, I slept like a baby in the comfortable bed. Rooms are not large but well appointed. This is probably not the best place to bring young kids. Look for more of a resort hotel for that. This is perfect for a couple though. Location is absolutely perfect. We covered so many SF places just walking and using the cable cars. There are two cable car stops <2 min away. Restaurants galore and shopping are just a short walk away. No need to rent a car or spend much on cab fare. This place is highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Nice friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: scoa
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in August. The hotel is in a perfect location and is on the bus and tram routes. The hotel was very clean. Don't expect any nice views though as this wouldn't really be possible because of its location. Breakfast arrangement was a bit strange, but not a bad experience. There is a small room on each landing where excellent free coffee is kept hot in jugs for guests to get all day, breakfast is served in these rooms but only on two floors, where trays are provided for you to collect your buffet breakfast and take it back to your room, it was a bit strange the first night, but then we actually preferred it to eating in a large room full of strangers. The owner puts on complimentary wine and nibbles at 5.30pm each evening, which looks great if you fancy a mingle, but we were always out at that time so didn't try it. Overall it was a nice comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “This place is a bargain”
Reviews.Author: spruce_creek
Reviews.Content: We had a couple of days to spend in San Francisco after our Napa tour as part of our 35th wedding anniversary. I had stayed at several places in the city over the years, and always liked the Union Square location. We had a king suite here, and it was very comfortable and roomy. The staff are remarkably helpful, and the price is quite reasonable. This place sure beats the impersonality inherent in some of the larger hotels in the area...the other reviews highlight the advantages of staying here, and we agree with them wholeheartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Believe every good thing you read about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1977Iowan
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the rave reviews on Trip Advisor, and we couldn't have been more pleased. We arrived late on a Monday afternoon and immediately felt like we were family due to the friendliness of the staff. Our junior suite on the 5th floor at the back of the hotel and was very quiet, clean and well-appointed--king bed, big-screen TV, desk, dresser with large drawers, couch and chair. We were able to unpack and store our 3 suitcases without feeling at all cramped. The bathroom was small but well-organized with the toilet and shower separate from the vanity. There is storage in the vanity as well as a hair dryer. (I can't comment on the quality of the dryer as I bring my own travel-sized dryer and didn't use the hotel's). The breakfast was fantastic--hard-boiled eggs, bread, rolls, cold cereals (including delicious organic granola), skim or low-fat milk, yogurt, coffee and (I think) tea. I'm not a hot-drink person so I can't say for sure what other options there were besides coffee. We always took a tray back to our room, as seating is pretty tight for more than 2 people. The other guests in the breakfast area were friendly and interesting, and we enjoyed the brief visits while preparing our trays. The full breakfast saved us considerable time and money during our stay, and the family-like atmosphere is a bonus. We were always out and about in the afternoons, so we missed the receptions. We did come in early one evening when the people were gone but the food was still there, and of course we couldn't resist the goodies! Once again, delicious--mixed nuts, cheese and crackers, dried fruits, chocolate chip cookies (even my husband loved the cookies, and he's not a fan of chocolate chip). This is what stands out in my memory, but I wouldn't be surprised if other things were offered as well. Fresh oranges and apples are available on every floor all the time, and we loved this. It was great to be able to grab a healthy snack on the run. The location couldn't be better--a short walk to many restaurants and shopping and all public transportation. There is a 24-hour Walgreen's around the corner for any run-of-the-mill needs. On Wednesday night before we were scheduled to leave on Friday morning, I asked to reserve a cab to take us to the airport rather than depend on hailing one when we needed to leave. The friendly host at the desk said he would arrange it (I'm so sorry that I don't recall his name, but he couldn't have been nicer). We expected a normal cab to show up on Friday, so we were pleasantly surprised when a driver in a suit showed up (not only on-time, but a few minutes early) in a spotless Lincoln Town Car! He was very courteous and the price was the same as a normal cab.
