He said that the Inn would use his service only after verifying his license, insurance coverage, etc. We loved everything about the staff and the hotel itself, but the positive experience with the cab put it over the top. We will absolutely stay here when we return to San Francisco and I give it a 12 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, But Not as Special as Others Make Out”
Reviews.Author: MarkMcGinn
Reviews.Content: Well after reading all the reviews we decided to stay at The Inn. I have to agree with some other reviews here, whilst we had a pleasant time, I would not say that The Inn was anything 'special'. The first thing you will notice is that the property is quite narrow, and the room we had, 501 was a long, narrow room. The Inn offers a continental style breakfast, which is served on a little area on each floor, this area is directly outside room 501 on the 5th floor, so don't expect a sleep in because from 8am all you will hear is people having breakfast outside your door. Seating is limited to 4 people in this area, so if you time it wrong you wont have anywhere to sit, and will have to do you own DIY room service breakfast on the provided trays. The Inn also serves wine and cheese each evening in these locations, which was a nice touch, again if you late, you will be sitting on the floor due to the limited seating. Our room was nice, however the bathroom towels could do with a refresh and larger bath sheets rather than the small towels provided. Valet parking is expensive, but this is true of all parking in this area, that said our car was always delivered within minutes of asking for it. The staff could not be faulted, perfect service delivery, friendliness and a pleasure. I guess the acid test, would we return? Well not to room 501 outside the breakfast area !, but to be honest no, I would try something else in the area, there is plenty of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: Nittie
Reviews.Content: We chose this inn for a one-night stay in San Francisco at the end of a week-long trip. It was a delightful choice, close to the center of things, very comfortable and a super nice inn. We arrived to find our regular king room not yet ready and were upgraded to a suite. The check-in was easy and we left our car for valet parking. The hotel is long and narrow with a small reception area and elevator. But it was beautifully decorated and mirrors along the wall help expand the space. Our room had a king bed, full bathroom, couch and chair along with a bigscreen tv. Breakfast is in an area at the front of the hotel on each floor. It was plentiful and varied. Coffee was great! You can take a tray back to your room if you prefer. We left for a late lunch and the front desk clerk was helpful with information and maps. Later we caught a bus, again with information from the front desk, to the Giants game. We walked back through the city in less than 30 minutes. Checking out the next day, we found our car ready for us within 5 minutes. On a longer visit, we would stay here again, as we feel it is centrally located for all the sites. Public transportation is steps away. The price was certainly lower than some of the larger, higher rated on Trip Advisor places. We feel that the quality of the inn is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: AussieTraveller3204
Reviews.Content: I'm a little late writing this review, but we stayed here in June on the way home to Melbourne after travelling around Canada and a bit of the States. I have to say that San Francisco was my favourite town - a mix of Melbourne shops and Sydney harbour. And the accommodation just made the stay even more special. We arrived much later than expected due to flight delays from Seattle - not a problem for the staff as we were warmly welcomed and ushered to the final 15mins of Happy Hour. Great way to have a pre dinner drink, bit of a nibble (plenty of food and wine!) and meet other guests. Luckily Happy Hour was on our floor - even more convenient. Our room was comfortably appointed, great bed, nice amenities. We did find the wardrobe arrangement a bit strange - in the bathroom! And the safe was impossible to reach for me and located behind a door. Luckily my husband is pretty tall and could access it. Minor complaint and easily fixed. No view to speak of from the window - but that meant a quiet restful sleep. Breakfast was also served on our floor - lovely array of cold treats which could be eaten at the table there or taken on a tray to your room. Would have liked an oblong table and maybe 4 chairs, so that 2 couples could share the space, but we made it work for us. The staff on the front desk were most helpful and attentive. Good suggestions for meals, sight seeing, organising transport to the airport etc. Like others have said, writing a review is difficult for us who have stayed at The Inn - we want to keep it our little secret!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, excellent location and wonderful rooms!”
Reviews.Author: JTAP
Reviews.Content: Our family recently went to San Francisco for a nice get away. We used Trip Advisor and located the Inn at Union Square. I called the hotel, and Omar answered the phone. The exact dates that we were looking for were not immediately available, so Omar spent 10 minutes with me on the phone, made a number of moves in the reservation system, got our reservation booked, and was able to get two rooms next to each other. Talk about a great way to start our trip ! We later found that Omar (and everyone else, including Ann, Wayne the innkeeper as well as the housekeeping staff) was as pleasant in person as he was on the phone. Everyone who works in this hotel could not be more guest focused! The location of the hotel is excellent and we were able to walk to number of shopping areas, restaurants, to Chinatown and to catch the trolley or the cable car. The rooms were exceptionally clean, very comfortable and quaint. We like staying in the smaller hotels since they tend to have more character. In San Francisco, you do not need a hotel with air condiditoning (even in August)..we slept with the windows slightly open and did not hear a sound from the outside. Each room has a quiet ceiling fan too. We also loved the complimentary continental breakfast served at 7:30 AM and the complimentary wine and cheese that is served each evening at 5:30 PM (both nice touches). During breakfast and the "happy hour" we met a number of very nice and interesting guests from all over the world. This is part of the fun of staying in a hotel like this. Lastly, the hotel provides free internet...we used it and had no issues. We opted for the self parking option and the parking lot is 60 second walk down the street. I would call the front desk and by the time I got to the parking garage our car was waiting. My wife and I work both in customer service-related fields and are not easlily impressed. We were clearly impressed with this hotel, the staff and the location. We will return to this hotel next time we are in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Plain downright great service (plus fantastic location)”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveller_19590
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit to San Fran. my friend told me to stay in either Union Square or at Fishermans Wharf. I chose The Inn at Union purely because of its positive Trip Advisor reviews. I have enjoyed everything about my stay here. From the overly friendly front desk lady, Annie, to the gorgeously furnished Junior Suite that I am staying in, to the delicious wine and cheeses serves in the afternoons, I can happily recommend this hotel. Business travelers may prefer to stay in a more swanky hotel such as the Hilton, but for me the old school glamour of this boutique gem is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “As good as everyone says”
Reviews.Author: terry c
Reviews.Content: We read a good majority of the '11 reviews of the Inn and were not disappointed when we arrived. The staff is friendly and very helpful assisting tourists navigating SF. For us, the evening wine and cheese gatherings and morning breakfasts were great not only for the food, but for the wonderful opportunities to meet folks from other countries. The atmosphere seemed more like a B&B than a hotel. Our room was comfortable, and away from street noise - a concern we light sleepers had prior to our arrival. Using a 3-day Muni pass, the map, and Omar's directions got us to all sites not within hiking distance. Wayne's stories and dining recommendations are not to be missed.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience we have EVER had!!!”
Reviews.Author: MooreaLover
Reviews.Content: We read the many positive reviews on Trip Advisor and decided to stay here. When we walked in, early, Ann at the front desk greeted us both with "Happy Birthday, Happy Birthday" (we both were celebrating birthdays on our trip and our son had sent packages and spilled the beans). We were upgraded to a junior suite, surprised with a bottle of champagne to celebrate our birthdays, and began what was the most wonderful hotel experience we have ever had (not kidding!!!). The Inn is a boutique hotel with just 30 rooms (6 floors) with an amazingly friendly, helpful and caring staff. As we found out, almost everyone who was staying there had found it on Trip Advisor (mostly Europeans and Canadians). Our room with a king bed also had a sitting area with 2 armchairs and a bathroom with a separate area for the sink and closet. Unbelievably clean - always!!! There is a business center with internet access on the 2nd floor complete with menus from nearby restaurants and brochures on the many things to do in San Francisco and the staff is more than happy to call to book anything you want to do. Coffee and tea are served every morning on each floor starting at 6:00 a.m. and fruit is available 24 hours a day. Breakfast is from 7:30 - 9:00 a.m. on the 3rd & 5th floors. It included muffins, pastries, croissants, bagels, toast, hard boiled eggs. yogurt, cereal, fruit and just about anything else you could want. After exploring San Francisco each day, we arrived back at our hotel for wine and hors'douerves from 5:30 - 7:00. What a great way to meet the other travelers staying at the hotel. Upon returning to the hotel after dinner and after 8:30 there were home-baked cookies and mints on your pillows and bottles of water after the staff turned down your bed. The cost is unbelievably reasonable for San Francisco and the hotel is right in the middle of Union Square ( just down the hill on Market Street you can catch the cable car, street cars, bus and BART; it's convenient to everything. I'm half afraid to submit this review because The Inn at Union Square might not be available if we come back someday. Book early - it was sold out to anyone who asked when we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely picked the right hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoannaMM
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a really good trip and couldn't have been more pleased with this hotel. The staff were so friendly and helpful and I slept really well hearing no traffic at all. The location is just excellent next to Union Square and it took about half an hour to get to and from the airport. It was so handy having free wifi in the hotel and also the business room was useful for printing off documents. The wine and crackers was most welcome too and a great way for a solo traveller like me to meet other people. If I have one niggle it is with breakfast in that it was only Kosher yoghurt that was provided (with Kosher gelatine and I don't drink milk either) so I couldn't eat it with the delicious granola. I did mention this but there was nothing done about it. It sounded as if the staffs' hands were tied. Will definitely stay there again if I go back to San Francisco. Thank you all !

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great location, great place”
Reviews.Author: dompelican
Reviews.Content: Very happy memories of this hotel. Our room was lovely, if a little strangely shaped. The staff were very friendly & helpful. The complimentary cheese & wine every evening is a great idea - a chance to meet new people and compare notes in a strange city. Breakfast is help yourself and take it back to your room. We were there the night the Giants won the World Series (rounders); it was one of the best nights of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: flahertyeve
Reviews.Content: We could not recommend this hotel highly enough. Centrally located in the heart of San Francisco, The Inn at Union Square is an ideal choice. We stayed in this hotel for three nights whilst on our honeymoon in San Fran and were very impressed with the staff and the cleanliness of the hotel. The little extras the hotel offered such as wine tasting evenings were suburb.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest service, clean and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: abjj80
Reviews.Content: Everything at The Inn was exactly what we were looking for: central location, clean and functional hotel with the bonus of having extremely friendly staff. The rooms are spacious and nicely appointed, the complimentary evening drinks and snacks were a fabulous touch too. We will definitely come back when we are back again in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful little hotel and service”
Reviews.Author: Kiwifruitontour
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn on Union Square for 4 nights in June. The hotel has a fantastic location with Union Square located just around the corner, only 5mins walk to Market Square, Westgate Shopping mall, trains, buses and trams. On arrival the staff greeted us and were very friendly and helpful with things to do in San Francisco, gave us a map and recommended nearly restaurants and diners. Our room was on the 3rd Floor and was an adequate size and very clean. The bed was very comfortable with lots of fluffy pillows, complementary chocolates and water, a good sized flat screen TV and free wi-fi. We did not have a view however, this was to be expected given we were on the 3rd Floor! The bathroom was extremely clean with fluffy towels changed daily, freebe shampoos/conditioners/cotton buds etc. The hotel provided a fantastic breakfast with a choice of pasteries, bagels & cereals, fresh fruit, yoghurt, muffins, tea/coffee and orange juice etc. They even provide free home made cookies in the evening too! There was a huge selection which we took on our tray to our room to enjoy. The hotel also offers free drinks in the evenings where guests can mingle which I thought was a nice touch. The staff are very friendly and helpful-we made a booking for Giants tickets on the internet and they have an office area where you can use the computer and print out tickets etc which was an excellent service. Overall, we loved our stay and would highly recommend staying at this hotel. We think it represents excellent service, quality and value for money for your stay in San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay. Very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: plmcpa
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a big lobby and lots of room to explore a hotel, this ain't it. Small european style. Small reception desk and elevator, that's it for the lobby. Elevator (six people is tight) only out of commission once for a short time. And you may have to walk sideways to fit in the narrow hallways. Room is clean, big enough, flat screen tv, bottled water, comfy bed and soft linens. Had a brick wall view but wasn't expecting any view of worth. Nice wine and cheese, dried fruit & nuts put out in the evening. Continental bkfst more than satisfactory. And choc chip cookies avail at night. nice touch. Had to search for ice machine and finally found a little contraption on the sixth floor. A few more ice machines would be worthwhile. Valet parking with unlimited in and out very very convenient. I'd just pull up to the front of the hotel and hand the front desk my keys and keep walking. perfect. the many convenient factors of this hotel give it a big boost. I think Union Sq is a great location, very central and vibrant. All employees were very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Cute and cozy with great, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: blandab
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn at Union Square as part of our honeymoon in June 2011. The hotel is older style but the rooms have been renovated and they were very clean and comfortable and of good size. This hotel is small, with only about 30 rooms and this allows the staff to get to know the patrons, and we could not fault them. They were always friendly and willing to help in any way and the nightly wine and cheese tastings with the Inn keeper (I think it is Wayne) were a real highlight with many wines from the local Napa Valley to enjoy. Breakfast was included and was very pleasant with pastries, fresh fruit and tea and coffee and each level had a quaint mini dining room to enjoy it in (which was also used for the wine tasting). In all I have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone looking for a clean, warm and cozy place to stay in San Francisco with great service. I must note however, and this is by no way a blight on the hotel, that Union Square is an area inhabited by a large number of homeless people, we found it very confronting the amount of beggars we had to negotiate daily in San Francisco. They are not in front of the hotel, but are in abundance just a short walk away whenever you enter Union square, be warned.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lisa6155
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this hotel. Anne greeted us at reception and was sweet, helpful, funny and really welcoming. The hotel was clean, comfortable, beautifully decorated and in a perfect position right next to Union Square. The evening wine and crackers was a generous touch and the breakfast was all inclusive and plentifull. We stayed here for 4 nights and had a lovely time, we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average everything else.”
Reviews.Author: soonertourist
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just a block off Union Square and perfect for the shoppers who need to drop off their bags three times a day. I believe there are between 30 and 40 rooms. There are not any rooms with a view of anything but a wall or the generator on the roof next door. We had rooms 306 and 506. We booked one suite and one queen, but the hotel bumped us from the suite when, they explained, someone decided to extend their stay. However, we were there three nights and never offered an upgrade, even though our kids were on a different floor from us. The decor, like the hotel, is charming but old. Old is nice, but it also means spots on the upholstered chairs and cracks and water marks in the plaster walls. The rooms were clean, but do not expect stellar housekeeping service no matter how much you tip. They do as little as possible as fast as they can. And, take note ladies, there is no air conditioning. As for vehicles, we valet parked one car to the tune of $51 per day. My husband paid $45 for transportation to the airport, which is on par with taking a taxi. The breakfast service and wine bar in the evenings made for a nice touch. I guess I just expect better service and accommodations for the generous price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in the heart of San Francisco! Loved our stay at Inn at Union Square!”
Reviews.Author: D_RHale
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Inn at Union Square was even more fun than I could have planned! Close to everything downtown, nestled among all the great spots to eat, shop and sightsee, we felt at home! The staff is warm, cheerful, friendly, helpful & incredibly welcoming. This cozy hotel is beautifully appointed, comfortable and offers delicious breakfasts (china & linen included) as well as wine-tasting in the evenings, complete with cheeses, fruit, and a comfy area on each floor to gather with other guests and share experiences of the day. We will stay at this inn again and have recommended it to many!

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Downtown Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: Phantomphi
Reviews.Content: Friendly, outgoing staff that made our stay outstanding. We were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversery and were glad we made the choice. The other guests seem to be similar, out of towner couples that are visiting San Francisco. We used public transportation. The 5:30 happy hour/wine tasting let us meet other tourists and share information.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this gem of a hotel and will be back on our next visit.”
Reviews.Author: cathylynn27
Reviews.Content: Just got back from San Franciso and loved our holiday. We stayed at this hotel and it was just wonderful. A little hidden gem 1 block away from Union Square. Staff at the hotel were super helpful and very friendly. The room was clean, quiet and a nice size. We requested a fridge and it was waiting in the room when we arrived. A great breakfast was presented nicely each morning. Wine cheese and fruit between 4:30 - 6:30 pm and milk and homemade chocolate chip cookies for a bed time snack. It was located in the center of downtown so it was easy to catch the famous cable car, local transit, cab or the underground train. Walking distance to Fisherman's wharf, China town and little Italy. We will be staying here again when we come back to San Fran. The staff was helpful any time we needed help with directions or a good restraunt to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “supa dupa”
Reviews.Author: beckstar999
Reviews.Content: Lovely location, great and helpful staff, small but decent rooms. LOVED the wine and cheese served daily from 5-7 pm...gave us a chance to meet other guests from around the world and have a quick impromptu chat. Busy, lively area, close to train, tram etc. Very nice...would come back forsure :)

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: BernardZalm
Reviews.Content: The inn was absolutely wonderful ; not only its location just off Union Square, but also the very helpful and friendly staff (since it’s only a very small hotel, you get a lot of attention!), the ‘apéro’ at the end of the afternoon and the classy, clean rooms. You can get breakfast at the 3rd and 5th floor; it’s up to you to decide whether you’ll take it on a tray to your room or if you eat it there. The choice at breakfast is quite big (although a bit too sweet for me). In the evening, wine and cheese is offered, a good opportunity to have a chat with other guests. One (minor) remark: coffee and tea making facilities in the room would have been perfect! We stayed here one week and enjoyed every single minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, staff, style, rates at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: sydneytraveller010
Reviews.Content: Thank you Omar, Ken, David and Ann for making my week in SF for Wagner's Ring Cycle so warmly memorable. From Omar's greeting after the long journey (via LA) from Sydney - he assured me my room was quiet AND mentioned that I'd been upgraded - and seeing the lovely large room I would have for the next nine nights - huge bed - lovely high quality reproduction antique furniture, huge well lit bathroom - my favoutire Aveda things there - then Ken's recommendation for my first evening meal - Fino Italian restaurant a few blocks up Post Street which was simply brilliant, sitting at the bar, watching the barman perform and chatting to two brothers from Orange County - from the very first couple of minutes at this small "boutique" hotel I thought: why would anyone want to stay in one of those soulless multistorey international chains? Breafast is great (good coffee) - you can have it in the cosy room overlooking the street or take it back to your room on a tray. And a further miracle: a small "business" room on Floor 2 with internet and printer - free - so I could book my timed ticket for the Stein exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art for the next day and print it out. Back to the staff: I cannot overstate the role the staff played in making the week so enjoyable eg Ken's impeccable advice on where to eat (Fino, Daily Grill), Omar's welcome and help with different things like arranging the shuttle to the airport, Ann's charming hello if she was on the desk in the morning and David's help with late night supplies after a very long opera (David: do you remember?) which I found utterly overwhelming in terms of responding to a guest's request. Location: brilliant. Almost on the corner of Powell Street with the famous cable cars and a few blocks down to Market Street with its buses, trolley cars, BART and Muni (if you need it). And all the shops around Unions Square and those brilliant, atmospheric hotel restaurants. What more can I say? This chain (Greystone - I stayed at the Elan in West Hollywood after SF) will be my first choice when if I get back to the States.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service .. Home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: Rezo85
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my sister and we loved it!! The breakfast was great, rooms were very quiet and comfy.. Wine and cheese in the evenings was great! Staff were really friendly and always willing to help! Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the Heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: SDBSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Right in Union Square, such friendly staff, comfy and clean rooms, wine and cheese, and a great breakfast included! (We had stayed around the corner earlier in the week and the tiny continental breakfast was $34 for the two of us.) We booked the "free valet parking" package. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top class”
Reviews.Author: Olliefla
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Friendly staff and guests. Wonderful atmosphere. Newspaper in the morning, wine in the evening and turn down service at night. You couldn't ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: raesunny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel at the beginning of an 8-day trip down the coast of California to celebrate our 30th anniversary. I chose this place because of so many wonderful reviews I had read on Trip Advisor. We arrived around 2:00p.m. so our room wasn't ready. Anne greeted us at the front desk, told us our luggage would be taken care of and the room would be ready by 4:00. She was so friendly and helpful! We went on to Saulsalito and arrived back at 5:30 to find our a very welcoming room and amenities awaiting us in celebration of our anniversary, along with a congratulations letter! We have traveled many, many places together in our 30 years and very few hotels have treated us as well as this one! We enjoyed meeting Wayne and appreciated his friendliness at the evening wine and cheese reception. Kudos to the staff and we hope to return to San Francisco and stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “just right”
Reviews.Author: gina2443
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to the suite which was lucky for us - it was really nice to have more room and a window that looked out onto the street. The bedrooms are small. Continental breakfast and dinner cocktails were also fun - we could sit and chat or take it all back to our room. Staff was friendly & helpful. Self Parking was a snap. The location was great, nice steakhouse next door and a drugstore & trolley around the corner. We'd stay there again and happily pay a bit more for the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Location, AwesomeStaff, Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: jimbarrettsmith
Reviews.Content: Well what can I stay, we stayed in the sister hotel (the elan) in LA which was excellent but The INN is better still. The hotel was clean with comfortable beds, the staff are fantastic fun, great to get along with and nothing was too much trouble. Their knowledge of the local area is invaluable and really helped us make the most of our short time in San Francisco. The complementary breakfast was excellent and the free wine and cheese in the evenings was a great way to meet other people and chat with the staff. The location is excellent with a cable car stop 2 minutes away and the BART system, bus stop and Trolley Bus stop are all about a 5 minute walk away. If we were to come back to san Francisco we would certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely a must-stay location!”
Reviews.Author: fan_of_The_Inn
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been advertised as being renovated recently. It's an absolutely charming building - don't let the small lobby throw you off. The staff - each and every one I interacted with during my stay - was always professional, friendly and going above-and-beyond to provide service. I didn't feel like a paying guest - they were so hospitable - especially Wayne with all of his tips on the places to go and see in the city! The rooms are very nice and spacious and impeccably clean. The bed was comfortable; there is complimentary wi-fi in the room and they offer a fabulous continental breakfast that far exceeds anything I've ever had! They offer a happy hour as well which is fun and a great chance to ask Wayne about the local sights. I loved the feeling of coming in the door each day and being greeted as if I were returning to my home. And it's within walking distance to so many wonderful sights of downtown San Francisco. On my next trip here I will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “All around Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: Alik_Inman
Reviews.Content: My mother and I visited San fransisco at the beginning of June. It was our first trip to San fransisco for both of us. We arrived earlier than expected at the hotel, and we had the pleasant surprise of being greeted very warmly by Anne (The front desk lady)! She was very pleasant, she offered to take care of our luggage for us. Our room was not ready yet, so Anne told us about breakfast and explained we were more than welcome to take advantage of it. We did, while eating Anne found us and offered to upgrade us to a suite with a king size bed at no extra charge to us! The suite was on the second floor and the noise was very minimal. The entire staff has been awesome. They went above and beyond to make sure our stay was the best. To Anne: "thank you so much for the upgrade! it was very much appreciated!" My mother has already decided to come back to San fransisco with my father. She already knows she will be staying at the inn at union square again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service, Great Location, Will definitely come back!”
Reviews.Author: Bmlinville
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights and absolutely loved it. The staff was so friendly. They welcomed us back after each return and were willing to give great sightseeing tips. The boutique style and cozy feel make it feel more homey and personal than the larger hotels. We did have one problem with our toilet overflowing while we were there, but we had someone fix it and they gave us access to another room in the meantime. The location was perfect, within walking distance to lots of shops, restaurants, and even major points of interest. If we are ever in San Fran in the future (and hopefully we will be) we will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would certainly go back!”
Reviews.Author: shadams2
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is 1/2 block off Union Square so the location is wonderful. The rooms are of moderate size, but certainly adequate for a vacation stay in the city, very clean and up-to-date. The 3rd and 5th floors have a small seating area in which is set out a very good continental breakfast and, in the evening, wines, cheese and crackers. It's a nice opportunity to meet other guests, many from other countries, but there are trays available to take food back to the room if desired. The outstanding feature of the hotel was the staff. They were extremely knowledgeable, very friendly, cheerful and helpful in every way. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT Boutique Hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Bev812
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff from front desk welcome to housekeeping could not have been more welcoming and helpful. More like bed and breakfast than std hotel since area where breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese are served is more intimate. Great way to meet fellow guests. Room was cozy, comfortable and clean. Location is just steps away from Union Square, shopping, restaurants, pubs, China Town and all modes of transportation. Would recommend hotel to anyone wanting a B & B feel in middle of town. Only drawback - no views.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: PghTraveler20
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a honeymoon based on the wonderful reviews posted on tripadvisor. The second I walked in to our "suite" I was immediately formulating a plan to leave this hotel and transfer to another. The entire place is ver cramped, the hallways are dark and narrow and the rooms are stuffy and outdated. The breakfast is nothing to write home about and their turn down service consists of a warm bottle of water and some chocolates. I would settle for this hotel if I were paying maybe $60 a night, not several hundred dollars. The location and staff are great, but there are lots of nicer, newer, cleaner hotels in SF with equally good people. This place is way overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “your home in the city”
Reviews.Author: josanpu
Reviews.Content: This can be "your home in the city", as Ann told me when she checked me in. Super friendly, helpful staff in a good, central location. Next door to good happy hour spots, like Farallon. Continental breakfast with excellent granola and little cinnamon buns and more; wine & cheese reception in the evening with nuts & dried fruit and mineral water, then house-baked chocolate chip cookies at 8 pm. Wayne will make sure your glass is full and fill you in on local history, if you like. Spring water and chocolate turn-down service. Lovely room, done in rich gold & red, comfy bed w/good pillows, fluffy towels, Aveda amenities. Free internet & printing in a little business center. This is a heritage building, so expect quirks and don't plan on air conditioning or that 'new car smell', but it is charming and unique. The windows actually open and there is a quiet ceiling fan. Everyone goes out of their way to make your stay special. I would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location,friendly team.”
Reviews.Author: johnaallen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn at Union Square for a week in June 2011. Great location right in the heart of union square. Great shopping and restaurants on every corner. The team very friendly and always ready to help. The room clean and well kept. The only improvement required is to the breakfast available each morning during your stay. Overall a great place to stay. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I'll go back”
Reviews.Author: amyandrea
Reviews.Content: We stayed for few nights , very confortable bad ,probably room small for the american standard, but good location very good staff.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely charming, lived up to our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: littletomato032
Reviews.Content: I had an absolutely fantastic stay for 5 nights at The Inn at Union Square. My boyfriend and I thoroughly researched hotels in the area, so we knew exactly what we were getting. The reviews below are correct that the elevator is slow, our room didn't have a view, and the room/bathroom is smaller than you might find elsewhere. We knew this going in, and were ok with these trade-offs in exchange for the other benefits of this charming boutique hotel. It's in an excellent location near cable cars, sightseeing buses, major city bus lines, a taxi line, great restaurants, and walking distance to a lot more. This hotel delivered everything they promised with gusto. The continental breakfast, wine & cheese hour, and cookies late at night were all very impressive. They also left out bottled water in the rooms and common areas for guests to take. The hotel didn't skimp, especially compared to what other similarly priced hotels offer. The room was charming, and in good shape. The staff were all friendly, professional, and helpful. When my boyfriend had a question about using the available computer/printer, the concierge was quick to help. We found whoever staffed the front desk to be incredibly helpful. They followed through making good dinner recommendations and taking care of reservations for us, calling a cab, and helping my boyfriend have beautiful flowers delivered for my birthday. I felt they also went the extra mile on the "little" things. For example, when they saw us walking up to the door to enter the lobby, they would quickly press the elevator button to call open the elevator for us. It's a small staff, and they smile, look you in the eye, and greet you when you enter/exit. It felt very personable. Overall - I would highly, highly recommend this hotel, as long as you've done your research and aren't expecting something this hotel can't offer (like extra room in the lobby and sweeping views of the city). I bet we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “It's All About the Birthday Girls...Part 2”
Reviews.Author: justbecause3
Reviews.Content: I stayed March 2009 (drop down menu of date not available) as well with my close friends to celebrate birthdays...we did feel like royalty from the time we walked through the doors until we checked out. Check in was a breeze and the Customer Service from all staff mentioned... Omar to Josie... was incredible. Staff members were very professional and cordial and it felt like we've known them for years. Loved the Suite..the decorations in the room were very warm! Having the evening social gathering with other guest members was a nice touch. The complimentary food was very healthy and satisfying. We shopped till we dropped, dined sufficiently and our sightseeing tours were wonderful. We will definitely return to the Inn & Union Square again to celebrate birthdays, or just to have fun....The hotel stay was a wonderful experience. Keep up the great work Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievably Great!”
Reviews.Author: Phil036
Reviews.Content: Just read the reviews here to understand why we rate this property so highly. It was this collection of TripAdvisor reviews that caused us to book three nights in early May. What a find! We think what really distinguishes this hotel from others is the friendly, helpful, honest attitude of every one of the staff. From Innkeeper Wayne to front-desk Ann and Omar (and all others whose names I didn't catch or don't remember). Don't even think of staying anywhere else in San Fran. You've got to experience this real hospitality and service.

Reviews.Title: “We will return to the "Inn"”
Reviews.Author: Mixmaster300
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a four night stay at the Inn at Union Square. We found this location by reading reviews on tripadvisor.com and could not have been more pleased with the hotel and it's location. The hotel itself was very clean and the staff were all very friendly and concerned with making your stay comfortable. We stayed in room 401 which is a smaller suite with two rooms. The sitting room faced Post street, the front of the hotel. The bedroom window overlooked an alley with no real view but this was good, it made for a very quite sleep time. The breakfast and wine service was held on the third and fifth floor so it was just a walk up or down to eat and drink without having all the foot traffic on your floor. The location of the hotel is right in Union Square, great walking distance from many activities and great restaurants. We flew into San Francisco and took a taxi to the hotel. Leaving from our stay we had an early morning flight and inquired about having a taxi waiting for our trip to the airport. The desk recomended a car service, Bernie's Limousines, which really worked out great. The cost was just a few dollars more then a taxi. The driver professional, the car roomy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: TeVo2
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister, and I stayed at The Inn at Union Square May 6th-8th. We stayed in a Queen Suite on the 6th floor and it was perfect for the 3 of us. The directions that we had to get there were perfect, and valet made parking a breeze. Check in was very fast as well. The room was clean. It is small, but so quaint and very comfortable. The location was perfect. We usually stay at larger chain hotels, so this was a big change for us and we were pleasantly surprised. The wine and cheese was great, we were able to enjoy that both evenings. The continental breakfast was fabulous with a great selection of pastrys, toast, bagles, yogurt, muffins, granola, raisin bran, coffee, juice, tea, and bananas! It was so convenient to just walk down one flight of stairs, get our breakfast, and walk back up to our room. The location was great, just a few steps away from Union Square and the cable car stop! The entire staff at the hotel was terrific, from housekeeping to the valet, from the front desk staff to the friendly man that visited people during the wine and cheese hour (which was actually 2 1/2 hours!). I have never had such fabulous service. I wish I could remember the names of the 2 gentlemen that worked at the front desk, they were both fantastic! I hope to stay here again and I will recommend it to family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy, friendly, welcome home, bed and breakfast feel.”
Reviews.Author: TimetwoGetaway
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the best staff I have ever encountered. Every person we spoke to was friendly, and helpful. They all made us feel like they truly cared about us having a good experience at their hotel. They all took great pride in the hotel. The continental breakfast was very nice, everything was fresh and tasty. We really enjoyed the wine and cheese experience in the evening. It was a special experience due to the quaint area it is set up in being so cozy that it lends itself to being a place that is very easy to start conversations. We sat very comfortably engaging in conversations with other travelers from all over the world. It was much nicer than gong to a local bar and it's free! Another extra special touch is the staff bakes homemade cookies and puts them out at 8 pm, yummy! The hotel is right by Union Square and all that it has to offer. It is also very close to every type of transportation San Francisco has to offer so getting from place to place is very easy without having to rent a car. It is also a very good location for being able to walk to places. The only thing that was a bit ackward was the way the bathroom and closet is arranged in the suite we stayed in. However, that would not prevent me from staying there again. We did look at a couple of other rooms that had smaller living space but larger bathrooms. These older hotels only have so much space to work with which is also part of their charm. I must add that even though it is an older hotel it is excellently maintained. I've stayed in new hotel, high end hotels that weren't in as good of shape as this one. If you like the hassle and bustle of the city, but like to begin and end your day with calm and quite this is the place for you. I really loved the experience we had.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with Very Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: spontantravelereous
Reviews.Content: This is a boutique hotel which offers comfortable beds and a very friendly staff, and is also in a fantastic location, just a few blocks from a major train/subway station, and cable car stop. Typical of San Francisco hotels, rooms are small, but I prefer a small comfortable room than a large uncomfortable room. Daily continental breakfast offers fresh pastries and breads in a nice setting, and they have trays available to take food back to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Nicole76oz
Reviews.Content: The inn is small, our taxi driver had 'never heard of it' but thankfully I found it on trip advisor! This is a historic hotel which has been well maintained. The staff are freindly and helpful, keen to provide restaurant tips, directions and helpful adivce on things to do depending on what you are looking for. It was great to eat in some not so touristy places. The inn keeper Wayne came along to the wine and cheese 'mixer' where he introduced guests to each other. We meet some great other couples and ended up going out to dinner together which was nice. I would recommend taking a look on travelzoo for cheap deals or book direct through the hotel, the internet rate is 20% off!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location.... Location!”
Reviews.Author: FunJunkies95
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a great four-night stay at The Inn and Union Square. Couldn't be happier with our decision to stay here. Located right off Union Square, From the hotel it's just a short walk to many of the must-see waypoints of downtown - high-end shopping, a great variety of restaurants, Chinatown, etc. My wife and I even walked back from the Ferry Building at Pier 1, so that is possible as well... although many readers might prefer a taxi or public transportation for that one! Other than the stellar location, another major selling point of the hotel would be the comfort - and the surprising quietness - of the rooms themselves. Despite the relatively limited square footage of the guest rooms, it's well utilized, and there is more than enough room for two guests. However, the TOP selling point of this hotel has got to be the stellar service. Every single employee was incredibly polite, helpful, and knowledgeable. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little gem convenient to the center of the city”
Reviews.Author: judithzfriedman
Reviews.Content: Warm service, great location, and the most comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: gindog
Reviews.Content: I can only reiterate what the other reviews have said. In fact there's one review that has only given this charming hotel 4 stars and I can't understand why! I would like to give 6! As everyone we met over wine and cheese in the evenings said, when in SF we will never stay anywhere else! Thank you Inn at Union Square for giving such wonderful hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SL27
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 days in december 2010 with my wife and 4 year old son. Its a small hotel tucked away in a corner on the side street leading away from union square which is steps away. We were booked in to a smaller room.Ann at the front desk asked us if we would want to upgrade for a slightly higher price- though reluctant at first we happily agreed when we saw the room.The room itself was cosy and warm though it overlooked a brick wall. the bed was comfortable and internet worked well.The staff are very helpful. in the evenings there are cookies, nuts and wine in the same area where breakfast is set up. The area is a little small for more than 2-3 people at a time, but the whole experience was very nice. We enjoyed our time in the city though it was very cold and rainy all the time. Ann and Omar at the front desk deserve mention and are very helpful with requests and information regarding the city or bus routes etc. The hotel is just a few steps from all the action in Union square but still retains a serene mood. Though a little small in areas but we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Location and service second to none”
Reviews.Author: Boonatics
Reviews.Content: This is one of the friendliest, most helpful, courteous hotels we have stayed in for a very long time. The wine and cheese evening is a great way to meet people. They recommend some awesome r restaurants and piano bars. What a fantastic place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with very helpfull and friendly staff and a super location.”
Reviews.Author: MBSNR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights at the beginning of our trip through California. We were returning to Denmark from SF and therefore had one night prior to leaving. When we left the hotel to drive down the coast we booked our final night at the same hotel because they are just so friendly and the rooms really clean with good beds. We were upgraded om both pur stays sjovt also makes you feel thar they Will do what they can to make the guest feel at home. Each afternoon at 5 there is complimentary cheese and and at weekdays the Inn keeper Wayne Olson joines the guests and gives good restaurant tips etc. The bestctip we got was to dine at Rue Lepic on Pine Street.

Reviews.Title: “The Way It Should Be Done!”
Reviews.Author: Canaa
Reviews.Content: If all hotels were as customer oriented as this special place, we woudn't need Trip Advisor. THE PRICE - special through Travelzoo, suite for under $120.00 THE EXTRAS - full continental breakfast, afternoon wine reception, evening tea and cookies, 8 pm turn down with chocolates and water THE STAFF- friendly, helpful, knowledgeable. A very pleasant way to end our trip to a beautiful state!

Reviews.Title: “The best costumer service I have ever experienced”
Reviews.Author: HelmutHungary
Reviews.Content: I am a returning guest to this hotel. I think I can only confirm my opinion from last year - this hotel is on a prime location, rooms are comfortable, but what makes it really special is the costumer service. In this hotel, you do feel that the guest is the king. Each and every guest is important for these guys and they make you feel it. You feel that you are important for them, they are there for you to answer any questions, solve any problems, they do care about you. Anytime I travel to San Francisco I will stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: sophieb01
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at this small gem. The staff was the friendliest and most helpful that I have encountered in a while. The room was spotless, beautifully decorated, and the bed was very comfortable. It is located steps from Union Square and the Powell street car line. There are small sitting rooms located on floors 2-5 with coffee and tea available throughout the day. There is a breakfast and also wine and cheese are served in the evening on floors 3 & 5. This gave us a chance to meet and visit with other travelers. We had a very nice time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a great staff”
Reviews.Author: Waylawfirm
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the last 2 nights of our 10 year anniversary trip at the Inn at Union Square. This hotel reminds me of a hotel in London....same small corridors and narrow spaces. BUT, the room size was better than average and the staff kept the hotel and room spotless. Wine and cheese in the afternoon and a nice breakfast each morning were wll presented and very fresh. The food is provided by floor, so those of us on the third floor shared at a common area overlooking Post Street. The room had a large flat-panel tv, small couch and wing chair. Plenty of room for my wife and I to set up our luggage and just relax. The pillows were a bit soft and the bed didn't give me warm fuzzies, but it was still fine, just not a 5 out of 5. The location was ideal. Walk out and turn left and in a half-block you are in Union Square. Go 2 blocks further, take another left and a short walk puts you at the Dragon Gates entering Chinatown. Great central location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding hosts”
Reviews.Author: Lesson_learned
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that caters to older couples and business visitors who want some quiet in an excellent location. The hotel is tiny and is across the street from the gigantic Westin St. Francis. I preferred the small hotel with no lobby. They provide a very nice little breakfast at the end of the hall and they have excellent wine and cheese every evening with a gracious host. Every employee is spontaneously friendly and gracious. Our room was relatively small but it was complete and comfortable. Our window looked out on a wall but that was not a problem. People we met say that they have come here many times and I can see why. You need to spend at least a few days to appreciate the place fully. Parking is in a garage around the corner on Mason Street with an amazing turntable that the attendants use to spin cars around - it's worth a trip to see it in action even if you aren't parking there.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: WDFOverlook
Reviews.Content: If you want to walk or be close to transportation to see the famous sites of San Francisco, don't hesitate to book The Inn at Union Square. This small quaint hotel is the perfect location. Though the rooms are small, there is no window view, and the carpet in our room was quite stained, it didn't matter to us. The rest of the small room, including bathroom, was very clean. The bed was comfortable and the staff wonderful! Every night a complimentary wine and hors d'oeuvre event and a healthy complimentary continental breakfast makes this hotel more than reasonable in cost. Again, I must compliment the staff! Great place!

Reviews.Title: “Cosy & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: DeborahNewcastle_Uk
Reviews.Content: Great boutique Hotel Friendly approachable staff, special mentions go to Ann and Omar. Very central to Union Square & Cable Cars. Breakfast very good, great idea to let you take tray back to your room. Wine & cheese nice touch, also cookies were lovely. Room nice size and bed very comfortable slept like a log!!

Reviews.Title: “What A Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Lind-Fran
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square really lived up the reviews on Trip Advisor! This small boutique hotel is a great find in the centre of the city. We arrived at about 10am and did not expect to access our room until the afternoon but they gave us another room so we could check in immediately, which we really appreciated after a long flight. All the staff were really friendly and very helpful with directions and also suggestions of places to eat, including making reservations for us. Being a smaller hotel it was nice to see the same friendly faces each day. A continental breakfast is included and has plenty of variety, cereal, toast, yoghurt, pastries, fruit, juice etc. A highlight is the wine and cheese served each evening in a common area giving a chance to meet with other guests have a chat and exchange ideas of where to go and how to best navigate around the city. Much better than brochures! Another extra touch was the cookies provided at night, we got quite addicted, they were yummy! The room was very comfortable and very quiet. We did request a quiet room so we did not have a view but we were very happy to get a good nights sleep. The location could not be better, very close to Union Square as the name suggests. The cable car is around the next corner and the tram is a 5-10 minute walk as is the Bart. We would certainly recommend this hotel and would stay there again if we have the chance to go back to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “We recommend This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fischro
Reviews.Content: The reviews of The Inn are spot on. The best features are the wonderful and friendly service by all of the staff, and the location a few feet from Union Square. If you are looking for a large convention hotel, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Warm stay, everything you need, nothing you don't”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelor99
Reviews.Content: Clean, half a block from union square and the feeling you are staying in your own apartment. I had the second floor junior suite at the end of the floor-very quiet and no need to use the elevator. No lobby, but as others mentioned, good sized rooms. Old, but comfortable, clean, and great staff. No safe or fridge in room, but with daily wine and breakfast included no real need for fridge. Be warned, as an older building something's are small (halls and tub), but this was in no way a small room. I also stayed at the Milano (milano is not nearly as nice) and visited the Mosser-the inn is much nicer. I was a single male visiting for a conference and this place was great-I kind is miss it. If you're looking for something grande, this is not the place. This is the type of place that gives you personal attention and just makes you feel good. If you want a b&b experience here you can have it, but if you don't you you can skip the idle chit chat and parlor stories and treat this place like an embassy suite-I'm not one for b&bs but I likes this place for the warmth of your own apartment combined with the baic amenities and service of a hotel. Great format really. The basics-big rooms for any major metro area (San Fran, NYC,chicago, etc), flat screen LCD tv, aveda products, robes, good styling and good finish (ceramic tile, fresh simple wall paper and paint), good business room, light room(I was on the lowest floor but still had some natural light), etc. Staff were all smiles, and if anything probably too attentive. Night chocolates and bottle water were a nice choice. By sf standards this place was a steal for under $200 during my visit (game developers conference). Neighborhood is great. If your a busiess traveler who needs an impressive lobby, just bring clients to a nice dinner instead :) I was scared when I booked this place, I feel like an idiot now. Much better than a chain. Warning,book a low floor so you don't have to deal with the one old elevator. Wine and breakfast were on 3&5, singular floors might be aloghtloer nosier. This also probably not a great place of you plan to party in your room, but it's a great home base.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Quaint Inn in busy city--another A+”
Reviews.Author: Selina10022
Reviews.Content: Well we just got back from celebrating my birthday in Napa and San Fran for the first time! Firstly this Inn is in a great location and accesable to the BART, numerous bus lines and two of the 4 famous trolley car lines. At check in they surprised me by saying they upgraded my room to a Queen Suite (501) and upon arriving into the wonderful room was a bottle of champagne and truffles! Thank you! The staff is friendly and helpful with any question you may have. They have a continental breakfast and a happy hour with wine and cheese for an hour and a half where you get to meet other hotel guests which is cool. The value and amenities you get at this hotel in this location is pretty great! Plus its the first trip that I stuck to public transport and it was simple! We got to Alcatraz, the Wharf, Ghirardelli, Trolley Museum without a problem at all ever! Northern California overall was awesome and we will be returning!

Reviews.Title: “what a delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: carol s
Reviews.Content: our recent 4 night stay at the inn at union square, was a winner on all accounts. the location was perfect for getting around, shopping, restaurants, park. the very best feature was the friendly and accommodating staff. they suggested dining places, tours, and choices of transportation (right near cable cars, busses, BART). the special treats are the complimentary breakfast, daily wine and cheese, & fresh cookies in the evening. the room was clean and comfortable. couldn't find a better staff - always offering their assistance. will surely recommend the inn to our friends and family visiting san francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel with amazing staff”
Reviews.Author: jaffie05
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I recently spent six nights here on our first visit to San Francisco. I chose the hotel from Trip Advisor reviews and was not disappointed. We were welcomed by Ann with great warmth and enthusiasm which was shared by the other staff as we came to know them throughout our stay. Our room was lovely. We had no view, but the upside of that meant that the room was very quiet and we were only there to sleep anyway. The bed was excellent and the decor charming. The breakfast and wine and cheese were an added bonus. The location coudn't have been better for us as tourists, being right on union square as well as having lots of public transport options virtually at the door. I would happily stay here again and look forward to returning to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “All hotels should be like this one”
Reviews.Author: Txadmom
Reviews.Content: Bend-over-backwards-to-please staff; charming, clean, well-appointed room; central location; a bountiful breakfast spread included; evening wine and appetizers included too! What more could we ask for? Big things come in little packages -- the lobby was not much bigger than a broom closet so the character and comfort of the rooms; the pleasantness of the staff were a wonderful surprise and all at a great rate for the location. I will definitely stay here next time I visit San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Overall fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rkst
Reviews.Content: It's a small hotel, it has quite a narrow and dated look as you walk around but all that quickly fades away when you get into the rooms. They are (mostly) awesome, I had quite a noisy room when I arrived and I asked to be moved and it was fulfilled straight away. The beds are comfy, the furnishings are excellent and the staff are so accommodating and helpful, every single one of them. I normally stay at the Westin St Francis but I think this is my new stay every time I come to SF.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in downtown San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: suklee
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful stay at the Inn at Union Square. I was there with my sister to celebrate her 40th birthday. When we checked in, Ann at reception happily told us that they had decided to upgrade us from our king size room to a 2 room suite! How thoughtful! And a great start to a wonderful birthday weekend... The Inn serves a nice breakfast in the mornings, wine and cheese in the evenings, and to top it all off, there are complimentary bottles of water and cookies for everyone to take back into their rooms at the end of the day. Perfect! Perfect! Perfect! The Inn is also in a perfect location to explore the shops and restaurants of Union Square. Great access to public transportation. And far more personality than the big chain hotels nearby or any other personality hotels in and around Union Square. I wouldn't stay anywhere else! To everyone at the Inn: You guys are doing such an amazing job, thank you very much for extending your warm hospitality to us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: jsoshea
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights in early February. The location was excellent, the accommodations (we had a queen suite) superb, and the service extraordinary. Innkeeper Wayne, plus staff Omar, Tony and Ann were all top-rate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, location and quality for your money”
Reviews.Author: franeym
Reviews.Content: Ecellent service, location and quality for your money. The staff is very helpful giving directions and advice.

Reviews.Title: “Superb friendly & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: asmundeer
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a few nights in this small but cozy hotel in November 2010. The staff were really friendly & helpful, and I mean REALLY. Maybe the most memorable service I've had anywhere. The hotel was very good in other aspects as well. The building was a bit shabby, but the rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Colleen1610
Reviews.Content: We arrived dripping wet and after a long flight from Auckland, very warmly welcomed. Staff were very friendly and helpful with their suggestions. Excellent location. The dude on reception was extremely helpful when I lost my husband in Victorias Secret as was the lovely lasy when we checked out. Would stay there again definately.

Reviews.Title: “the service was extaordinary!”
Reviews.Author: travelsister63
Reviews.Content: I travel all over the world and stay at very nice hotels The Inn is definately a wonderful value without sacrificing anything. Staff went out of their way at every opportunity to make our stay lovely. One morning, our hair dryer didn't work. In additon to an apology and immediate replacement, we found a bottle of champagne and box of chocolates with a lovely note when we returned in the afternoon. Also, don't miss the wine and cheese happy hour and the lovely continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, small & charming”
Reviews.Author: Laser_traveller
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a single night at the end of a week in the USA on business, the second time I'd stayed at the Inn at Union Square. This is a small, well located hotel with elegantly decorated rooms and incredibly friendly staff. It's ideal if you want a low key hotel without a bar and restaurant - the continental breakfast and evening wine & nibbles make up for this and add something different to the usual hotel offering. I also think that it makes for a friendlier stay for the solo traveller. If you want the large city hotel experience with a glitzy bar, go stay at the Westin St. Francis; otherwise, go here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: Nevada_Kate
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square is located near many of the landmarks in San Francisco. We walked to Union Square (of course!), Petticoat Lane, and Chinatown and took a cable car to Fisherman's Wharf. We caught a bus half a block away to Golden Gate Park and Alamo Square. The return bus ride was . . ahem . . . interesting. The bus driver apparently was trying to see how many people he could make fall down on his packed bus with his whiplash-causing starts and foot-stomping braking. I'm sure (or at least hope) that he is the exception among San Francisco bus drivers. And there are great restaurants and shops all around the Inn--from Tiffany's to Forever 21. I could have spent a week there just shopping! The room itself was small but well-decorated. A nice breakfast was served every morning, and wine with appetizers was served in the evening. The staff was unbelievable! I had the feeling that, no matter what I asked for, they would get it for me. The only minus was my husband had trouble sleeping on the very soft bed in our room. In fact, he ended up on the floor because his back was so bothered by it.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable surroundings, friendly staff and extremely well located”
Reviews.Author: Clare_TL
Reviews.Content: The minute we arrived following our long journey from Australia we were very warmly greeted by the Inn staff, and that level of helpful and friendly service continued throughout our stay. Rooms and hotel decor is charming, beds are super comfy and small touches such as the complimentary chocolate chip cookies in the afternoon, and wine and cheese in the evening were lovely. The Inn is really well located so you're well placed to get out and have a wander around Union square and beyond. We would highly recommend the Inn as a great place to stay when visiting this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: MeaningfulTravels
Reviews.Content: I loved this place. The location couldn't be better, a few steps from Union Square, our room was very nicely presented, if a little on the small side, and the staff were some of the best I've ever dealt with in the US, very helpful and friendly. Just to balance out the review a bit, the complimentary continental breakfast was not bad but wasn't a highlight, the hotel isn't cheap and it only offers valet parking but this was only marginally more expensive than the car parks around Union Square. In general, yes, I'd definitely stay here again and have no hesitation in recommending it to anyone looking for a relaxing, comfortable stay in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good value!”
Reviews.Author: hawaiigirl50
Reviews.Content: A great hotel for a romantic weekend. The location in union square is close to everything. The complimentary breakfast and wine were much appreciated. Hotel staff is friendly and helpful. If you're in SF for a few days get a muni pass. $20.00 for three days was a bargain and we had a great time exploring the city by cable car and street car.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff!”
Reviews.Author: JJB-Ottawa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just recently stayed at the Inn at Union Square over the xmas break for 6 nights and we had a wonderful time. Here are the positives: 1) The Staff- Especially Anne and Omar. The Inn staff is perhaps the best thing about the hotel, excellent suggestions (especially off the tourist track) very personable and helpful. They helped with dinner suggestions, neighbourhoods to visit and wine valley tours. 2) Location is great- I am not sure about where the hotels are throughout SF but if you like shopping and being central it was great. Personally we really liked the neighborouhoods like cow's hollow, haight etc much more than Union Sq but I did not see many hotels out there. For Union, this was central for visiting the entire city. 3) Included Wine and Cheese in the evenings- a wonderful touch. 4) Rooms were clean, quiet and a bit dated, but no problems to report. If you want really modern / hip style rooms and a hotel, I would not recommend the Inn. If you like small and comfortable, I would. We really enjoyed our stay and would recommend it anytime and encourage anyone to talk with the staff to get the locals perspective on what to see and do in SF. I would say as a couple new to SF my wife and I really liked to walk the neighbourhoods to see the shops and cafes especially cow's hollow, haight, marina, and chinatown to name a few.... Two restaurants I would highly recommend are Bix (speakeasy style) and B-44 (spanish). Fisherman's Wharf wasn't for us, it felt like a cheesy amusement park, but would be great for kids. Along the waterfront if you like food and wine I would suggest the Ferry Market.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: burls1
Reviews.Content: As the name implies, its right at Union Square. It is close to a major cable car line, great restaurants and fantastic shopping. Being a boutique hotel, the rooms are smaller, but the service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: kagome999
Reviews.Content: We read great reviews about this hotel and it has lived up to the hype. Had a great stay at the Inn at Union Square. From the airport, it was about a 20 min drive. We got a cab and it cost us just over $40. The location was incredible...right at Union square and could easily hop on to the trolley, since the stop was a few steps away from the hotel. It was walkable to Chinatown, the financial district. There was tons of shopping nearby. Public transportation was easy to use and very accessible. We got a 3-day pass for $20 which allowed us to use the trolley and buses. The room was clean and cute. We really appreciated the breakfast, wine & cheese, and cookies at night. The staff are really friendly and helpful as well. Stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - would rate higher if I could”
Reviews.Author: millie2112
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this lovely hotel with my husband and teenage son for 3 nights at the start of December. I was lucky to get a good rate for the executive suite. It was on the 6th floor, and the room was very comfortable and large. my son said that the sofa bed was very comfortable. The location of the hotel is perfect. Right at union square. It is a much nicer hotel to the larger chains. We loved the breakfast and the afternoon wine. All staff were excellent. We really enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for those who want high class individuality rather than chain hotel sameness”
Reviews.Author: twipper
Reviews.Content: We booked a Junior Suite (Room 501) here for our 6 nights in San Fran, & couldn't have hoped for better. Plenty of storage in the bedroom, & the lounge area was terrifc with a view of Union Square. Great bathroom amenities. Our room was right near the 5th floor 'lobby', one of 2 floors where the complimentary breakfast & evening wine & cheese was served. There was plenty of choice for breakfast, to eat either in the 'lobby or take back to your room, and the evening wine was a fabulous opportunity to meet other travellers & exchange tales. Extra chairs & seats from our room were regularly moved to the 'lobby' to accomodate the group. Whilst there are no coffee making facilities in the room, all day coffeee & fruit is available on the second floor. Goodnight cookies & a bottle of water is also left in the lobby of each floor every night . Most guests seemed to be returning guests over a number of years - a sign of the quailty of the hotel. All staff were exemplary in service. It was lovely to be recognised by room staff as well as reception staff, and this adds to the feeling that the whole hotel is like a big family home. This atmosphere & its location, a few steps from Union Square, make this an ideal place to stay in San Francisco. We wouldn't choose anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fmt14
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little hotel just off Union Square, with comfortable & well maintained rooms. The breakfast is a great start to the day, juice, breakfast cereals, fruit scones, good coffee and fruit. The added bonus of wine & cheese in the evenings is an entertaining start to your night off & a relaxing way to meet fellow travellers! The staff are always extremely friendly and do everything they can to make your stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, European style hotel”
Reviews.Author: Welltravld
Reviews.Content: Right off the Square! Easy access to shopping, restaurants, cable cars- the whole SF experience. Pass on the overpriced and overbooked monster hotels and opt for charm, service and wine & cheese in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “conviviality and comfort in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: truffles50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is convenient to main shopping area of San Francisco. However, its main feature are the staff and other travellers. During our four night stay we enjoyed the happy hour. The staff were most caring and obliging although the rooms were a bit "tired".

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: TracyNY
Reviews.Content: To start, the staff at the Inn at Union Square is amazing! Polite, happy, and helpful - even when you arrive at 1:30 in the morning or go out shopping (Black Friday) at 5:00 a.m. Our room was a nice size, with plenty of storage, and very clean (loved this aspect). Every morning there is a continental breakfast on each floor, the evening brings a wine and cheese tasting, and cookies to tuck you in at night. The breakfast and wine hour makes the hotel seem like a little community. Location: less than a block from Union Square and only a few blocks from the San Francisco shopping center. Tons of shopping and eating to be done right in the neighborhood. The Inn at Union Square will be my home whenever traveling to San Franciso!

Reviews.Title: “Superb service, soulful unique place.”
Reviews.Author: davabar
Reviews.Content: Soulful old hotel with exceptionally friendly, helpful responsive staff. Not a large hotel nor are the rooms hugs as it apears to be a late 1800's/turn of the century building that has been updated. Beatiful decor. Nice (free) continental breakfast each AM and (free) wine every PM.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get a better spot”
Reviews.Author: Philly413
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel. The staff are very friendly and welcoming and the location couldn't have been better. It's right on union square so you're close to all the shopping that you could want. But the big plus for us was how close it was to public transportation, it made getting around the city so easy. The breakfast was more than adequate and the nightly wine and cheese was an added bonus. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “away from the maddening convention crowds”
Reviews.Author: irislily
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square is situated perfectly for any traveler to San Francisco. We drove to the Bart station in Millbrae and took the train to the Powell St station. Then just a short 4-block walk to the Inn. The continental breakfast does live up to its "expanded" description on the hotel's website, with fruit, pastries, hard boiled eggs, bagels, orange juice, cereal, and toast. The wine and cheese in the evening provide just enough to hold you over until dinner. Coffee and tea (organic free trade) are available all day. The staff are friendly, courteous, and helpful. Unlike friends who stayed at the convention hotel (Hilton), we did not have a room with a view (window looked out onto a brick building just a few feet away). And the Inn at Union Square is a bit worn (a fresh coat of paint would go a long way toward brightening up the place). But the room was quiet and comfortable; I could really relax after the noise and commotion at the convention hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: candyjones2010
Reviews.Content: I am a seasoned world traveller and have stayed at numerous 5 star luxury hotels as well as holes in the wall, all over. What I love about the Inn at Union Square is plenty: unpretentious, well maintained, enthusiastic staff, superb location, clean, comfortable, excellent value... It is certainly not a "high end" place (its style is akin to old school urban 'luxury' instead luxuriously snobbish. If anyone recalls, it reminds me of the old Wyndham in New York), but if there are 10 criteria by which to judge a hotel, this place would get at least a 9 in every category and thusly out-distances nearly every other place I've stayed at (certainly in San Francisco) because it hits so close to the mark every which way.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Everything about the Inn at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: earSaltLakeCity
Reviews.Content: Just got back with my 12 year old daughter from SF and stayed for 4 nights at this wonderful Inn. Everyone did a wonderful job making us feel cared for and welcome....and safe. I really can't say enough good things about the place. First, the staff is fabulous. A special thanks to darling Ann at the front desk who could not have done more to help in every way. And, David, who we never met because he works the night shift.; but, who offered so much helpful information and enthusiam by phone before we even arrived. The location is perfect and because I am a very light sleeper I asked for a quiet room. We were in #406 in the back and we never heard a sound. The place is beautifully maintained and even thought the room was SF size we still had plenty of room. In the morning, included in the price, they served a huge breakfast buffet...juice, pastry, bagels, cereals, eggs, fruits, tea, coffee, etc. In the evening wine and cheese, fruit, etc. About 2 weeks before we arrived I mentioned I was allergic to down pillows and they even remembered and had great foam pillows waiting. Also, business center with computer at no additional charge. Loved the place and the people. They sure helped make our visit special!

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up.”
Reviews.Author: JAL15
Reviews.Content: Small and quaint. Not for everyone because it's not a full service hotel, but overall we couldn't have asked for a better hotel while in San Fran. The staff was awesome. Props to Ken and Omar. And everyone else for that matter. Don't remember their names but the beautiful young lady at the front desk and the night clerk were just as helpful. One note, if you're a light sleeper I would recommend staying in the back rooms, as the hotel faces Post Street and it can get quite noisy, specially on the w/e.
