Other than that, we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect gem”
Reviews.Author: smileflo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel whilst we were travelling around San Fransisco, after our first stay we immediately rebooked on leaving. Cant say enough about this hotel, Extremely friendly and professional staff, with a special mention to the front desk staff. Services included, complimentary breakfast, complimentary wine and snacks in the evening, shoe cleaning. Perfectly located in central San Fransisco, it was like we had found a rare gem.

Reviews.Title: “This small hotel is a "winner"”
Reviews.Author: Kushka
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. The room was fairly small but very clean, the bathroom was spotlessly clean and the shower was perfect. We were so impressed with the friendliness of the staff and their genuine desire to go "the extra mile" for all of your needs. We especially would like to mention some of the Desk Receptionists. Omar, Ken and last but not least, Ann. Ann's smile would light up a room and she obiously loved what she was doing.... the Hotel also had a complimentry breakfast, it was excellent, and also a buffet of fruit, wine and cheese in the late afternoon.... does not get any better than that! Our thanks alslo to the housekeeping staff, again, warm and helpful.... We would definately stay with the Union Inn family again................ Alice and Lu

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay in Union Square”
Reviews.Author: mandnontour
Reviews.Content: The last 3 nights of our tour of northern California were spent here and it easily provided a relaxing and comfortable end to our honeymoon. The bottle of champagne provided by the hotel was just that extra little touch that makes places like this special. The room we had was quite small but big enough, although the view was of a brick wall about 1ft away! But that didn't matter as it rained the whole time we were there. So the umbrella the hotel provided in the closet more than made up for it! The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was clean and well spec'd. Oddly, breakfasts and the wine and cheese in the evening were served in two little landings on the 3rd and 5th floors, but you could take it all back to your room - just a little bit anti-social compared to other 'inn' type hotels. We really like the jar of cookies on each landing when you return from your day out! The hotel is as close to Union Square as you can get without being on the square itself (and I think only the Westin is on the square) so location is great. The staff were really helpful organising airport shuttles and places to store luggage. Our parents were paying a lot more to stay at the Grand Hyatt just around the corner but I think we got the better deal!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to return to”
Reviews.Author: FromtheEast
Reviews.Content: Really well located, just off Union Square. Very welcoming and helpful reception staff. Rooms tend to be small but still comfortable. We liked the complimentary wine and canapés in the evening, it was nice to get together with fellow guests and talk about our experiences. Shuttle from the hotel to the airport was well organised and efficient. When we return to SF we will definitely stay here again. Breakfast was buffet style which could be eaten in the small seating area on some of the floors or taken back to the room. Breakfasts were adequate but not a great deal of choice.

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a place in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandTravel-lover
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights at the end of our trip to California Chose this place from trip advisor reviews and was not disappointed. From the minute we arrived and were given a free upgrade to the minute we left were very happy we stayed here. The staff were amzing, a specia mention to Ann at the front desk who made us feel very welcome and gave out helpful advice. Room was good size, very clean and comfortable. Think all the reviews have said what we think so no point in repeating but excllent central location but very quiet considering. Loved the cheese and wine in ther late afternoons.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Ele007London
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Francisco for a few days on a stop-over and really loved this hotel. It is very conveniently located at Union Square so perfect for exploring the city. The rooms are spacious and elegantly furnished with really comfortable beds. You also have complimentary bathrobes and a nice supply of cookies, tea and coffee on each floor. There is no communal breakfast areas and everything is served in the coffee corner at each floor, so best to take this back to your room where you have a nice table to sit on and you can also enjoy your morning papers. We did not try the wine tasting in the afternoon as we were always out somewhere but thought this was a really nice touch. Can definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: yank7
Reviews.Content: the stay was great, the front desk staff (all staff actually) were very helpful and friendly. room very comfortable even though it was 90 degrees + (the ceiling fans worked well!). nice continental breakfast, wine and cheese in the evenings. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great location, value and service”
Reviews.Author: Mark1014
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. Blink and you would miss the hotel but the location is ideal just off Union Square with easy access to trams and buses. The room was not the biggest but was tastefully decorated and very clean. The staff on the front desk were also very helpful answering any questions that we had. The complimentary continental breakfast sets you up for the day but the jewel in the crown was the complimentary cheese and wine in the evening, After a long day walking San Fran there was no better reward than sitting down with a glass of wine and selection of cheese!

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: DebfromNC
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Inn on Union Square and couldn't have been more pleased. The location of the Inn fabulous; walking distance to Union Square and many fine restaurants & shopping. Our room was attractive with a very comfortable king sized bed, flat screen television and bay window. Not huge, but certainly big enough. Breakfast was served in a pretty room at the end of the hall and was very good, as was the nightly wine, cheese and chocolate chip cookies ! The service was incredible; special thanks to Omar and Ken for happily answering all of our questions and filling our many requests. When we return to San Francisco we will definitely come back to the Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Don't pass this one up”
Reviews.Author: jedm49
Reviews.Content: I have probably walked by this hotel in the past and given it no thought. There is just a very narrow entry with a desk. But looks can be deceiving. The rooms are not large but are well appointed and the bathroom small but efficient. The breakfast is more than adequate and the wine and cheese in the early evening gives you a chance to meet fellow travelers, many of which are international. I have nothing but praise for the helpfulness of the staff. And the location is unbelievable if you wish to be a Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: SouthDevonChris
Reviews.Content: 100 yards from Union Square could not be a better location to visit the city. 15 minute walk only to the waterfront. Front desk ever helpful with restaurant suggestions and attractions to visit, came up trumps every time. We had a junior suite for 3 nights which was plenty big enough and very well furnished, bed extremely comfortable. Complimentary wine and cheese offered each night between 5.30-7.30 great way to meet others and swap tour ideas. Small hotel with a very big heart.....thoroughly reccommended

Reviews.Title: “Great wee hotel, superb location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: irish_captain
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the end of our 3 week road trip around the national parks of the Southwest/western US. While we used the BART to get from the airport to the hotel, the 3 block walk up from Powell St. station to the hotel took it's tool with heavy bags! Now going back the other way was easy!! The hills!! But the hotel itself is great. We got a great welcome, our room was ready early. It was a great room, lovely bed, nicely decorated, with a lovely ensuite. The view was a brick wall, but that was fine with us, if we wanted a room with a view I would have booked somewhere else. Free internet, good TV with around 100 channels! And next to the cable car line, which we definitely used! Loads of restaurants nearby, and all the shops, and when you get loaded down with bags, you can just pop back to the hotel as it's so close. As said, the staff were super friendly and always had great tips and advice in the mornings when we headed out for the day. The breakfast was very continental, but again loads of restaurants close by to have something bigger. I'll definitely stay here next time we come back to the city...we may even see the golden gate bridge then! (fog!!)

Reviews.Title: “Ideally located and querky”
Reviews.Author: stumped55
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Inn on Union Square - the place grows on you and we'd loved the querky character of this old hotel. Location is excellent and reception staff couldn't have been more welcoming and approachable. Rooms are compact but comfortable and clean. Breakfast is plentiful and can be taken to room or enjoyed with other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Location and personal service- Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Canadian_Hoser
Reviews.Content: This is a very small inn with no view in ANY of the rooms. It is located 1/2 block from Union Square and all the amazing shopping and restaurants. We were moved from a very small room (european standard small) b/c of a plumbing issue. The next room was much better. Loved the staff and the daily free wine and cheese each evening. LOVED our 3 nights there. AMAZING staff at the desk who helped us with any questions and gave recommendations. The price was $109 a night in early April which was waaaay cheaper than other properties we researched. We felt that it was a GREAT deal and worth the savings from the big chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: universalgirl
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel. I loved the continental breakfast, wine and cheese at cocktail hour , fruit and coffee all day long and free wireless internet. For a woman traveling alone the location and security were perfect. The INN at UN SQ is clean, quiet, cozy, comfortable, charming and up-to-date. Both the day and night staff were friendly and helpful. My room was upgraded to a queen suite when I checked in. The free internet worked perfectly. Thanks to David, Ann and Ken for making my stay so relaxing and memorable!. RS

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel with the personal touch”
Reviews.Author: JonAngie
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed early sept in this great Hotel. Its located very central and easy walking to most places The staff are most helpful and friendly without being overbearing What the hotel lacks in size is more than made up for in service and facilities. The complimentary breakfast, while of the continental style, was a most welcome and relaxing way to start the day. The wine & cheese "party" in the early evening was great crack with the other guests, so much so we ended up going out for dinner and onto a bar with them. The rooms are on the small side but very comfortable, clean and well equiped. Don't be put off by its size, go and enjoy yourself and join in the cheese and wine session to interact with fellow travellers, who will give you graet tips on where and what to visit

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room, staff and value!!”
Reviews.Author: cmac3
Reviews.Content: Room was both comfortable and classy. Every front desk employee we spoke with was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Location was perfect, providing easy walking access to most places and a BART station. The evening cookies were a nice touch and the breakfast was simple, but ample. We did have a view of a brick wall, but when surrounded by taller or equally tall buildings, that is to be expected. At least we weren't looking into other windows! Considering the location in S.F. and the convenience it provided, this hotel was a bargain. There were great bars with jazz bands within 2 blocks which made for a low-effort, very nice night on the town.

Reviews.Title: “GEM!”
Reviews.Author: charlieannepascoe
Reviews.Content: This B&B hotel was absolutely wonderful. It was in a top location, wonderful service, and it was so charming. Daily breakfast was wonderful. All ammenities great. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in central San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: LondonRob1961
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square is situated just off Union Square in the centre of San Francisco and as such is in a great location for exploring the city. It is nothing fancy but is clean, the rooms (and beds) very comfortable and the staff are friendly. A continental breakfast is served each morning which can be taken to your room. Good value for an expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice hotel and great location”
Reviews.Author: JohnHarrisDerby_UK
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel in the heart of San Francisco - it's a great base for a visit and good value too. The complementary breakfast is very good and the cheese and wine set out in the afternoon is a really nice touch. It's also a good way to meet other guests and to pick up tips on places to go. We had a really nice room and the staff were all really helpful, informed and keen to make sure that we had a great stay. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect little San Francisco spot”
Reviews.Author: Vivellos
Reviews.Content: This hotel isn't fancy, but if you're looking for comfortable accommodations, centrally located, with San Francisco charm, this is a great place to stay. We spent three nights here before heading out to visit family in the wine country. We loved being able to take BART from the airport to Powell street and walk a few blocks up the street to the hotel. We also loved that when we wanted to rent a car to go out to Muir Woods for the day, several rental companies were right down the street. The location is great for eating, wandering, and poking through shops. And the rooms are comfortable and clean. Best of all, you don't feel like you're in a big chain hotel. The scale is right and the building feels like San Francisco the way it's meant to be. We'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaSLondon
Reviews.Content: I can't praise this hotel enough, and certainly agree with all the very positive reviews that have already been written. The helpfulness of the staff, the amazing location which cannot be beaten, the provision of cheese and wine in the evenings, the complimentary breakfast, cookies and free WiFi, all contributed to a fantastic stay in San Francisco. We will definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, intimate home away from home feel”
Reviews.Author: Doasyoulikeclub
Reviews.Content: We were travelling around the world for 3mths and the Inn at Union Square was really a highlight in our hotel stays. Not for the swish glass and chrome of some other hotels but for the intimate feel it had. Only 7 rooms, I think, to a floor with a little sitting area at the end of each floor were you could make yourself a cup of coffee or tea and have a biscuit. Breakfast was served here each morning and we met up with fellow travellers briefly and compared travel tips. Every evening there was a wine and cheese available and again the casual company of some of the other guests, we were joined by Marc one evening and also Austin, both from Greystone Hotels of which the Inn is part. That both of these charming men took the time to interact with the guests was an indication to me of how serious Greystone are about the satisfaction of their customers. I would highly recommend. One thing to keep in mind, although our room had a view some other guests mentioned the were looking out to a wall close to their window. ......don't look out the windows I say because the hotel was lovely inside.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: RachTheH
Reviews.Content: Just loved the intimacy of this place right in the heart of the city. Staff were lovely, and very genuine, and the wine/cheese was a nice touch for meeting other guests. Breakfast style suited me, and there's a lovely selection of teas. Free wifi good also. Would definitely come back here.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: CityGirlCH
Reviews.Content: On our arrival we were upgraded to a bigger room than we had booked - for 10 dollars a night, but ok. The room was lovely - decorated in an old style. The bed was very comfortable and we were at the back of the hotel so couldn't hear a thing from outside. The bathroom was a little small and antiquated, but functional. Complimentary continental breakfast every morning - there's only one table in the serving space, so you really have to take it back to your room, but that was no problem. Complimentary cheese and wine (and non-alcoholic drinks) in the evening too was a nice touch. And free wi-fi in the rooms was much appreciated. Because the hotel was so small you felt that the desk staff knew you. The location is perfect - just off Union square.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently ticks all the right boxes”
Reviews.Author: robmarshall33
Reviews.Content: It was chiefly our stay at this hotel last year which persuaded us not only to return to San Francisco but also to the Inn. Nothing has changed - the same high levels of individual service coupled with the very best location imaginable. Thanks again for a perfect stay - to all the front of house and service staff.

Reviews.Title: “The positives outweigh the few negatives”
Reviews.Author: lexy16723
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights this past week and picked this hotel because of the multiple great reviews on trip advisor. Here is my review: Location- The location was absolutely perfect. Initially, I debated whether we should stay at union square or fisherman's wharf. I am glad we picked a hotel near union square especially this one. This hotel is a few steps from the actually union square courtyard area. It is surrounded by tons of shopping like Macy's, Nieman Marcus, Nike, and William Sonoma so although there are a lot of homeless people, we felt relatively safe in this area. If you go about 3 blocks south of the hotel, you are in Market Street which has more shopping and is a great place to find your transportation (cable cars, street cars, buses). Also, you can buy your transportation tickets from here (in front of Forever XXI). I recommended taking the public transportation to Fisherman's Wharf instead of walking because of the huge hills. If you are heading to the piers, embarcadero, or the ferry building, you can walk NE along Market Street and then walk along the piers because the land is flat. Service- The Staff at this hotel was great! Very friendly and willing to go out of there way to make our stay comfortable. We had a late flight out of San Francisco our last day so they held our luggage and invited us to their nightly wine and cheese. A very nice gesture! They offered us use of their washroom and business center and made sure we had transportation to the airport. Rooms- The staff upgraded us to a Jr. Suite and despite the size of the hallways and elevator, the room was quite spacious. All the windows open and I guess acts as your air conditioning (We are from South Florida so we are not use to that). There is no view of the city because the bedrooms are along the side and not the front of the building. We overlooked the roof of Morton's restaurant next door. Cleanliness- This is an older hotel and the first thing I noticed was the smell in the elevator and the hallways. To me, it smelled like bug spray but my boyfriend did not think so. When we arrived in the room, I noticed that the shower curtain was stained and notified the front desk the next morning and they fixed it right away. Also, the next night, I noticed a stain on the sheets and asked them to replace it and they did. After that, I did not encounter any further problems but is the reason why I gave them 3 out of 5 stars. Value- The breakfast and nightly wine and cheese were a plus for us. There is no gym in this hotel but they do offer a day pass for $15.00 to the gym around the corner. I think overall, this was a great hotel to stay at. I am very particular when it comes to cleanliness but the other factors outweigh the few problems I encountered with that. .

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: ScratchBostonMA
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel lavishes it's guests with clean spacious suites , free breakfast, and complimentary wine and cheese tastings each early evening. The staff bent over backwards to make our stay most enjoyable with directions and recommendations. Right on the cable car line, you can get anywhere from here when staying at the Inn at Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but for the price, I expected to have bath towels”
Reviews.Author: cls808
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the inn for two nights on a weekend. The place is tiny. It is clearly one of the older buildings in the area as the structure is only six stories and everything is on the small size. The walkways are small, but if you've been to some European or Asian hotels, you have seen comparable sizes. The rooms themselves were on the small size, even for a San Francisco hotel and we stayed in a Junior Queen Suite. The bathrooms are miniscule. There is barely enough room to move around in there and it is very tough to get all of your toiletries on the counter (and I don't have many). The room itself was clean although the sheets were wrinkled even before we sat on them. The pillows and mattress are not the most comfortable. I have a much better night's rest on my siemens beautyrest. There wasn't an air conditioning unit that I could see. I really like to turn on the AC and snuggle under the covers and I wasn't able to do that at this hotel. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, however housekeeping needs some work. We were without bath towels two days in a row (and we were only staying in the hotel for two days). It was ridiculous. I have never not had any bath towels let alone two days in a row. On the first day, there was only one hand towel in the room. We called down to the front desk twice and no one answered so my boyfriend was required to walk downstairs to the lobby to find someone to give us towels. The second night, again no towels! At least on the second night, the front desk answered the phone and brought up two towels immediately. I would give service a four if not for housekeeping not providing me with towels. However the best part of this place is the location. You absolutely cannot beat the location. Literally steps away from union square, if you are in the area for shopping this is a good location so that you can buy stuff and haul it back to the room. It's also a short distance from the trolley end of the line. Although I think for the price you could probably stay at the Westin which is right across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay, great staff”
Reviews.Author: CACDJ
Reviews.Content: We just got home from our second stay at the Inn and we will stay there again on our next visit to San Francisco. The hotel staff (front desk, maid service, valet, everyone!) are the friendliest and most helpful you'll find in San Francisco. When we arrived, we were treated to an upgraded room. The staff seem genuinely concerned that you are comfortable and happy during your stay. The breakfast includes a nice selection of fresh foods and the evening wine service is a relaxing way to start your evening in the city. The location cannot be beat. We have stayed at three other Union Square hotels in the past, including the St. Francis, and none of them compare to the Inn. We look forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “A gem hidden in plain view of the city”
Reviews.Author: top5design
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for a bargain boutique hotel in the middle of San Francisco and found the Inn at Union Square thanks to Trip Advisor. I am so pleased to report that all the accolades and praise the everyone has heaped on this hotel was extremely well-deserved. We arrived a bit early and checked in and parked our car around the corner at the convenient garage on Mason St. Coming from the Midwest, I have a hard time paying $22 a day (unlimited in/out) for parking, but the convenience is pretty great and for big city it was reasonable enough. The Inn is located less than half a block off of San Francisco's historic Union Square and is within easy walking distance of the main shopping district, China Town, the main trolley station at Powell, which can take you most of the places you'd want to go when visiting San Francisco. The staff is phenomenal at the Inn, always doing little things that make your stay special. One example: I returned one morning from grabbing our Starbucks (not necessary since the Inn provides a terrific continental breakfast each morning as well as complimentary wine and cheese each evening) and my hands were full because I'd also stopped by the Walgreens around the corner to grab a couple of supplies. The front desk manager called the elevator for me and helped me get to my floor. It may not seem like a big deal, but it was a significant touch that made our stay that much easier. I really can't say enough good things about our stay at the Inn at Union Square. It is a great little hidden spot in the middle of a huge city. I would recommend to any couples visiting San Francisco or travelers looking for a little more quaint stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with extras like wine and cheese”
Reviews.Author: GrahamMcFTM
Reviews.Content: This is a gem of a hotel and great value for a big city. Location could hardly be better situated just on the corner of Union Square. Our room had a lovely big comfy bed. No bath, just a shower but that apart couldnt fault it. Great little extra was the free wine and cheese every evening. Breakfasts were plentiful, just load the tray and back to the room. Staff were so friendly which is often lacking at big city hotels. They really seemed to care about their customers

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rshlsh
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights and could've stayed 23 nights! Our flight landed at 9:40am on Sunday and we figured we would drop off our luggage at the front desk and then go out and about until we could check in. When we got to the hotel at about 10:30am, the front desk clerk checked to see if our room was ready. He told us it was going to be about 10 MINUTES! Sweet! Speaking of sweet...he also told us they upgraded us to a jr. suite! Awesome! The room was really cool...very Victorian kind of decor (only gave 4 stars in the review because saw some other rooms and could see someone maybe not being all that happy with the size). The view was of a little courtyard that backed up to some tattered older buildings, but it was WAY quiet! And based on many of our other stays in SF in boutiques, that was a welcomed change. Being from Vegas we were concerned about there being no AC in the rooms. However, even with the windows shut, the ceiling fan kept the air circulating and it was pleasant. Afternoon wine and cheese from 5:30-7pm was awesome! Serve yourself and eat and chat with other guests or take back to the room and relax. Continental breakfast was nice. Nice danishes, bagels, croissants, great caramel nut rolls, fruits, yogurts, hard boiled eggs, coffee, etc... Was enough to get you kick-started but not enough to bog you down so you could still find a good place for lunch. The day we checked out, we kept our luggage there and came back at about 5:30pm before we left for the airport. The front desk person knew what time our flight left and said "You have some time, why don't you go up to the 3rd floor and have some wine before you leave?". WHAT??!! Unsolicited niceness?! We like to explore new hotels when we travel to the same destination, but we might just have to keep coming back to this gem!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming inn with bed-and-breakfast feel”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: For this weekend getaway, we originally booked at the Mandarin Oriental, where we stayed last year. We were wooed to try the Inn by a great rate from a private sale website, and by positive TA reviews. The Inn is no Mandarin in terms of luxury, views or amenities, but for its unassuming demeanor and small size, it's chock full of nice touches and has a definite bed-and-breakfast feel. We were pleasantly surprised. The Inn is an easy 3 block walk from the Powell Street BART Station, which we took from SFO airport. The location 1/2 block from Union Square is ideal for tourists--so close to so many restaurants, shops, and attractions such as the cable cars. Taxis are easily found, and many public transportation stops are nearby. The Inn itself was originally another hotel and was reconfigured about 20-30 years ago. It most recently was refreshed about 4 years ago. The Inn is a narrow building with a long corridor down one side on each of its 6 floors, from which all the 30 rooms are entered. All rooms face a little alley between the Inn and the adjacent building--lower level rooms face a brick wall, while upper level rooms get a bit more light and a view of the next building's rooftop A/C equipment. One room per floor also faces Post St., as does a "lobby" on each floor--a small, quaint lounge area with a table and chairs, window bench, fireplace and sideboard. It is here where the Inn offers numerous treats throughout the day. There are: 1)apples and tea all the time 2) continental breakfast daily on floors 3 and 5 from 7-10am--a variety of carbs--bagels, bread for toast, pastries, scones, muffins, croissant, cereal, granola--plus yogurt, OJ, hard boiled eggs. There are trays to take to your room. 3) wine, cheese, crackers, fresh and dried fruit, nuts and sodas served from 5:30-7pm, also on levels 3 and 5. 4) cookies (recently baked, not commercially baked), tea and bottled water from 8:30-11pm. Quite impressive! We booked a Junior Suite Queen, a larger room than the Deluxe room, which looked small but comfortable. The Suite was nice, with a queen bed and sitting area with pull-out sofa, chair, desk and flat screen TV. The bath was split and small, but with nice amenities, including robes. There is no A/C, but the windows open and there is a ceiling fan. The bedside clock has a CD player and nature sounds. Although the Inn's literature touted twice-daily maid service, we never received evening turndown service, although the daytime service was fine. Since there is no restaurant, the Inn offers room service from an outside company. The lobby is tiny and was staffed usually by just one friendly person who also does concierge duties--they even called us the day before our departure to see if we needed airport transportation assistance. For security, a room key is needed to enter the front door, to use the elevator, and to get past the first floor by stairs. There is a small one-computer business center on the 2nd floor. Overall, this charming Inn has a lot to offer and has reserved a place in our hearts, alongside other more luxurious and costly accommodations, for future San Francisco stays.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: MKBG
Reviews.Content: The Inn is old, but very clean and well maintained. The extra little things were a nice touch that we really appreciated. (free wireless, and a computer available to check in for your flight, breakfast, homemade cookies at night, wine/ cheese hour, aveda bath products, robes). The staff was very nice and helpful. The room was ok. There is not much counter space in the bathroom, so it was difficult to get ready. We had a view of a brick wall and area with machines running constantly. No breeze came in through the window and it was VERY hot in the room. This was fine because we weren't in our room much, but It did make it difficult to sleep at night. The location is very nice, right in the center of everything. The walk from BART was easy (except for trying to dodge the hundreds of people on the sidewalks). If you want to use a nearby gym that they have a "deal" with, it is $15. Overall, it is a very nice place. It is not luxurious, but very comfortable and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: scubadiver5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights in May. Upgraded us to a junior suite at check-in. Room had all the amenites we required and was of adequate size for a city centre location ( and much larger than most European city centre hotels). Breakfast was good and the complimentary evening cheese and wine was a welcome chance to relax after a day's sightseeing and chance to chat to other guests. Two things that stand out for me- the first was the staff. All were very friendly and full of helpful suggestions- even down to finding out where stocked a particular type of camera battery charger, when mine needed replacing at short notice. The second was the location- as first time visitors to San Francisco, having Cable cars at the end of the block and the various transport options on Market a five minute walk away was exactly what we were looking for. So if you are looking for all the amenities of a large chain hotel, you might want to look elsewhere. If however you are looking for a comfortable, friendly, well located place to stay, I would look no further.

Reviews.Title: “A place not to be overlooked when you book a vacation to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: 2010Gettaway
Reviews.Content: This Inn provided excellence in every aspect of hotel services. The ambience created a charm that the bigger hotels can't compete with. A throughly pleasant experience that expceeded or expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nestled into the City”
Reviews.Author: Whitneydumaw
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this hotel. It's location is just off Union Square and a half block from the Powell Street cable cars. The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful. The afternoon wine and appetizers as well as the morning breakfast go way beyond what is normally provided in a hotel setting. This hotel is small, cozy, and most convenient to all major downtown attractions. I will stay here again when I return to San Francisco next year with friends.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel3434
Reviews.Content: I have been to this Inn a few times now, and I have had a positive experience every time. This inn exudes San Francisco charm. The staff are very friendly and do everything they can to make your stay enjoyable. This is not the place for you if you like the impersonal chain hotels. For example, the wake up call is made by a real person instead of a computer. They arranged for a cab to take me back to the airport. There is a free wine reception every night. The Inn does not have a restaurant, but there are so many wonderful places to try in the heart of the city and the staff is happy to help with recommendations. This is by far my all-time favorite place to stay in San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: McCann-Cheshire
Reviews.Content: Hotel within a good location for Union Square. Breakfast was average, lots of bread products including muffins bagels pastries etc.. No fresh fruit other than bananas and there is nowhere to sit, I think the idea is you are meant to take the food back to your room. No turn-down as advertised or ice. No tea or coffee facilities or fridge in the rooms if you need one. The evening wine and cheese that we had one evening was a nice touch. Our room was quite cold as the heating did not work, however, they did bring us an electric heater

Reviews.Title: “A great introduction to San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: RT111
Reviews.Content: My partner and I loved this hotel. We got off the plane from Sydney at midday, caught the BART into Powell, hauled our luggage three blocks up the hill to Union Square and it was easy to find. We were upgraded to a premium double room on the fifth floor. This hotel is so friendly and pleasant. Staff were always helpful, the maid service is excellent and, as others have said, the wine and nibbles at 5.30 every night is a bonus and we learned quite a lot about the city from other guests. Lots of pubs and restaurants in the area and, of course, the cable car to Fishermen's Wharf is just half a block away. There are no negatives . . .

Reviews.Title: “Better than I ever expected”
Reviews.Author: Leeinn
Reviews.Content: First we were greeted by a lovely, warm receptionist who made us very welcome even though we were several hours too early for check in. Within 30 minutes she had our room ready and we were able to check in. Our room had a wonderful bed with many pillows, a flat screen TV, wonderful FREE room internet, FREE water, business office with FREE computer, FREE breakfast, FREE cocktail hour and yummy bathrooms to wear around the room. I've been traveling to SF for more than 10 years and walked by this little boutique hotel so many times and just never noticed it. Wonderfully close to Union Square and many restaurants, the location is perfect. But best of all is the amazing staff who are so eager to please. Anything you want, that is in their power to provide, they will do for you without any questions. The cocktail hour gives you a chance to meet other hotel guests or you can take the drinks and snacks back to your room. The General Manager, Wayne, is a wonderful host and sets the tone for this lovely property. I can't wait to go back! Lee

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: EllieDee_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel June 2009, the location is excellent right off union square, close to the shops. Hotel rooms were clean and beds were very comfortable. staff were friendly and helpful. only complaint we had was the noise outside our window from the ventialtoin system from the building next door was a bit annoying but overall we had a lovely stay. there is free wifi on union square which we found very handy.

Reviews.Title: “Really good location, and good service, small and cosy”
Reviews.Author: ripresa
Reviews.Content: Good stuff: * I liked the location, right at the heart of union square. * It was clean, not OCD clean, but very clean. * The folks were very friendly * Free food/snacks early evening. Not so good stuff: * Our view was a brick wall * Hallway was cramped

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Falcon2626
Reviews.Content: We stayded at the Inn for a week. Our stay was most pleasant. OK, the view was not the best possible and ventilation fans on the roof of next building were making some noise but otherwise the hotel was very nice. The room was big enough and the bed was comfortable. We loved the continental breakfast as well as cheese and wine tasting in the evening. Wireless internet was free. Location could not have been better. But the thing that made us feel at home was the friendly atmosphere of the personnel.

Reviews.Title: “What a great find”
Reviews.Author: TLN5
Reviews.Content: Talk to other guests at this small charming hotel and a phrase repeats itself; "I'm so glad I found this place". Don't be put off by the small cramped reception lobby. What this hotel lacks in size and amenities is made up for with charm and quality. The welcome and check in was very friendly and efficient. Our room was a good size for the price with good quality fabrics and furnishings and bedlinen, a good sized bed, desk, coffee table easy chair. The bathroom fittings bright and sparkling, and a good shower. Our room didn't have a view (a brick wall opposite) but we were here for three days to sightsee. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever had in a hotel. It obviously lacks the amenities of the big multi-national hotels, no room service, bar, tea making in rooms. But what you get is in some ways a better personal service. There is a lobby/kitchen area on each floor where you can get coffee and tea 24 hrs. The breakfast buffet was extensive; juices, cereals, breads, rolls, croissants, yogurts, everything you would expect. You can eat at the one table in this lobby area or do as we did take in back to our room on trays provided. A great touch is the evening wine and nibbles where you can meet fellow guests and and talk about your day and get recommendations. The staff recommendations for restaurants etc. were spot on, places not in the guide books. If you want a gym and pool the hotel has a deal with a facility just a block away, where I had the 25 yard pool to myself. Overall very helpful and friendly staff and a very comfortable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - my new favourite hotel....ever!”
Reviews.Author: hecticbunny
Reviews.Content: This has to be my new favourite hotel! I was so sad the day we had to check out. I really did feel that this place became our home away from home in San Francisco. It feels cosy and safe even though union square is on its doorstep. I think it's all the extras that make this place special. My favourites: - free internet in a really cosy study; - the breakfasts; and - the afternoon wine and cheese. If that were not enough, the staff are helpful and obliging and give you the feeling that you are actually welcome. In a word? Outstanding. The Inn at Union Square helped to make San Francisco the highlight of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcome”
Reviews.Author: reiseonkel
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in till we left we felt extremely comfortable due to the outgoing personell and manager.Indeed the lobby,elevator and rooms are small but this is compensated by the charm and personality of the inn - anyway when you're visiting SF who spends much time in the room.We enjoyed the company of other guests at breakfast and wine and cheese(more like a B&B experience)-if you value privacy you can take it to your room.We found internet access good!

Reviews.Title: “Small, compact, clean, quiet, tasteful European-style hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Fayerweather
Reviews.Content: The antithesis of a chain hotel. Nothing you don't need, everything you do, plus an ample breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese. When we were there, I believe that I was told that only half the 30 rooms were occupied. If the Inn had been fully booked, I think that the aforementioned breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese would have been too much to accomodate in the small 3rd and 5th floor areas set aside for the purpose. Still, Omar at the desk and the cleaning ladies couldn't be nicer and for our money, at least, it will always beat the St. Francis, the Mark Hopkins, and the many other, higher priced and more generic alternatives!

Reviews.Title: “great pre-honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: yani2605
Reviews.Content: Jill (front desk) was unbelievable. She gave us recommendations for lunch, dinner and places to go. The hotel is so centrally located that we were able to see everything she recommended in two days. The evening reception and the breakfast in front of the fireplace made the place feel like home. We would have spent more time in front of the fireplace if we did not enjoy our room so much. It was overall one of our best hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting....”
Reviews.Author: NYCTraveller18
Reviews.Content: Booked in this hotel because at the time of my booking it was rated #1 on tripadvisor. The pros: very pleasant staff (manager in particular would give personalized restaurant recommendations without even being asked, spend happy hour chatting to guests etc so it felt like you were more in a private home); fairly centrally located; rooms were very clean; wine/happy hour in the afternoon and the other guests were unusually nice. The cons: small, dark passage ways, old tiny reception and old creaky lift, tiny room and bathroom and quite dated; breakfast was dreadful (why is it so hard to get fruit?) and the internet connection was slower than in Africa. Also the way the breakfast and wine afternoons are set up, you are forced into contact with the other guests so if you want to be anonymous or have alone-time, that's a bit hard. It was also expensive - I could have booked a room for a similar price at the Fairmont, but chose to come here because I thought it would be more atmospheric and cosy. The bottom line: it is more like going to a private home. But if you want luxury, you should probably head elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Second Time as Good as the First”
Reviews.Author: TravellingAussie3000
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed at the Inn at Union Square. The first was in September 2009 and found the service and amenities of high standard. The recommendations for dinner, places to go and the social aspect of the pre dinner drinks was fantastic, particularly as I was travelling by myself. I stayed there again in February 2010 and the experience was equally as good. The breakfast was always fresh and the dinner recommendations never failed. The homemade chocolate chip cookies were great with the final cup of tea at night. Close to Union Square, shopping and cable car makes it an ideal location.

Reviews.Title: “It is the attitude of the staff that makes this hotel so special”
Reviews.Author: HelmutHungary
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, the breakfast was delicious, but what really amazed me is the can-do attitude of the staff. Each of them were very helpful, there were no wishes or requests of us that they did not fulfill, no matter how many phone calls they had to make or how much time they had to spend on it. They took over heavy parcels for us, they warned us on the introduction of daylight saving time, one of them spent at least 30 minutes to find us just the right foot massage when we needed one after long walks in San Francisco. I really feel that we, ordinary guests, received an extraordinary service from these guys, and this is an attitude to be appreciated. These guys went that extra mile for us.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: SummerGirl8
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay in San Fran. for a night or 2. The building is very old and has charm; but that means the rooms are very small. The entrance to the hotel is even tiny! The 2 concierges were encountered were both very nice. friendly and helpful. Breakfast was serve yourself out in a small dining area on 2 different floors. It was cereal, pastries, juice, tea, coffee, etc. In the same rooms in the afternoons there was serve yourself wines and snacks. LOVED THAT! Good for the price and location but prefer a bigger room. not enough room to move around in with 2 suitcases!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room and amenities, however needs staff with more local knowledge.”
Reviews.Author: PikoVancouver
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel with well decorated rooms. The washroom, while very clean, is on the small side. Not that much storage area. The room was very quiet. Nice touches include an afternoon wine and cheese, and cookies in the evening. Very good location, a half-block from Union Square. Front desk staff at times lacking local knowledge. Breakfast is continental style, note there is no separate breakfast room, and rather breakfast is set out in a small seating area at the end of two hallways.

Reviews.Title: “You've gotta be kidding, this is a top pick for San Fran? (don't do it!)”
Reviews.Author: TravlinFrank
Reviews.Content: I really appreciate getting recommendations from this site, so when I saw this Inn was rated 3rd in San Fran I jumped on it. It was not a question of budget, although the deal was good. My wife was joining me for this business trip, and we thought it was a great opportunity to spend time in San Fran. Well, we loved San Fran but we did not love this hotel. It is in SERIOUS need of a make-over. The carpeting is old and grungy. Very little space in the hotel or in the rooms (perhaps typical of the city). Breakfast, included, is OK - but make sure to get a table early. Otherwise, you'll be eating in your dingy hotel. Across the street is the Westin St. Francis, which certainly looks nicer from the outside. We would have gone there if not for the recommendations on this site. At this point, I am a bit concerned - under what standard is this place considered great? Adequate, yes. A good deal, probably. Good location, for sure. But that does not a make a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “nice staff but very basic old 2 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: martinclarkq1
Reviews.Content: i chose this hotel based on outstanding coments on TripAdvisor. Now I dont know whether all the comments were put on by friends of the owners, because this hotel was very disappointing. Nice staff (1 front desk person), and the rooms are good considering the old age of the building, but the lift is tiny and doesnt take swipe cards properly; foyer is tiny; the corridors and dingy and narrow; breakfast room is tiny and depressing; usual hotel facilities such as power adaptors for overseas appliances not available (we were told, 'you can buy one at Walmarts"). I think they have done a good job with what they have to work with, but this is an old, small building with dingy entry/corridors and lift. I recommend it for people wanting a 2 star hotel, but ti doesnt deserve the rave reviews that it has receive don TripAdvisor

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: bandi
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel provided many special extras-from continental breakfast (with excellent coffee) to wine and cheese in the early evening to fresh baked cookies at night-all served in a lovely intimate setting. The accommodation were nicely decorated (including original art) very comfortable (full sized bath tub!), and immaculately maintained. Best of all, however, was the service. It was a rare experience to feel that everyone working at the Inn placed the guests' needs as the top priority. I really felt welcomed and well taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “A Must......”
Reviews.Author: lulubelle5
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best boutique hotels i ever stayed in. Recommend anyone going to San Francisco to stay here. The rooms are comfortable, spotless, they offer a bountiful and good breakfast and wine and cheese every evening.. The innkeeper Wayne makes you feel like your family.. Staying here gives you a very warm, comfortable feeling.

Reviews.Title: “okay...perhaps overrated”
Reviews.Author: canshman
Reviews.Content: I did my research online about this hotel and many others, finally deciding on the Inn at Union Square, based on user reviews. What drew me in was the amenities that other reviewers raved about, such as the 1) Aveda bath products, 2) the wine and cheese happy hour, 3) the morning breakfasts, 4) the complimentary wireless internet, 5) the location, and 6) the service. Well I was very happy with 4 out of the 6 amenities. The complimentary wireless internet, however, was not working for the 40 out of the 48 hours we stayed at the hotel. As this was a business trip as well as a leisure trip, this posed quite a problem. Most of the staff (3 out of the 4 front desk people) that we encountered did not know how to handle the problem, not even apologizing that it wasn't working, or giving us other options. I had to come up with a temporary solution myself, which was to go to the borders down the street to use their wifi. We were not compensated for this inconvenience and crippling experience to our work, as well as our leisure activities. It was difficult to find restaurants that I wanted to go to, or to map out my route using public transportation without the internet. The other thing I wanted to mention was that their elevator does not take the key cards readily....each time we used the elevator to go up or down, it required swiping our key card at least 3-4 times just for it to take it. In addition, our own hotel room required two swipes before it would let us in. It was quite annoying. All in all, I would still recommend this hotel, but maybe not so readily, and with the caution that there are some "quirks" that you have to prepare yourself for.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel, Great Amenities and Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: p3rkolater
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Francisco for a week during President's Day/Valentines Day weekend 2010. The greeting was extremely friendly and efficient, we had booked a month in advance at the hotels website. The check-in/out staff are the concierges and they do a great job at both. The hotel is located about 40 feet from the cable car line, which combined with the Muni buses were great for getting around the city (3 day pass for $20). Union Square is located really close, unfortunately it had an event tent set up the whole time we were there. The room was larger than I expected, plenty of room for me and my spouse to move around without feeling like we were in each others way. The hotel has an excellent staff, that is extremely efficient and helpful with any requests. They helped us get restaurant reservations nearly every day we were there, and also set up the gray line tour of the wine country. The included amenities of breakfast and wine/cheese were outstanding. I was absolutely amazed that these were included with the rate we got. Can't say enough positive things about the hotel and if I were ever in San Francisco again, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “our best ever hotel stay- service like their lives depended on it”
Reviews.Author: allenfamily2000
Reviews.Content: I think the title sums it up - staff could not have been more obliging - nice free happy hour and made our trip even more of a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely FANTASTIC!!!”
Reviews.Author: JRBNORONHA
Reviews.Content: Absolutely FANTASTIC!! This is all I can say about my stay at The Inn at Union Square. After visiting the beautiful San Franciso several times on business and just staying in big hotels as Radisson and Hilton and in some other boutique and nice hotels as Serrano, I've decided to look at Trip Advisor to find out a new and nice hotel to stay with my wife in a special trip that we where facing as our "2nd Honeymoon". It was when I got really impressed about so many positive reviews about "The Inn at Union Square", always rated among the Top 5 Hotels in San Francisco. And then, we've booked it from Hotels.com. Since our arrival in San Francisco, everything there it was so perfect! Staff was absolutely outstanding! We got an upgrade for a very nice Suite! Our suite (super clean) and its amenities were really great!! Wireless Internet and Continental Breakfast were complimentary, as Wine and Cheese (wow!!!) from 5-7 pm everyday as well!! This is the place where we really feel at home!!! So, I strongly recommend this Hotel for everyone!!! I'm sure you'll love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value in a great location”
Reviews.Author: SunLvrs_FL
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at Union Square for 3 nights we were in San Francisco. Compared to the rates of hotels in the area, it is a great deal. The breakfasts are of very good quality and plentiful, and everyone we dealt with was very helpful. Spaces are small - our room was comfortable but tight, the hallways/staircases are narrow, the breakfast area only has one small table. However, if small spaces don't bother you, the rest is great! You are literally 10 steps from Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and the best location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: crixie
Reviews.Content: even we have to passed twice in front the hotels doors to realize it was there and my husband wanted to check the room before taking the luggage!! So first impression wasn t that good staying there was great! the location couldnt be better and sevice was relaxed and helpfull. Bed and sheets were soft and pleasent. Breakfast is a highlight and if you arrive for the afternoon cheese and wine dont miss the taste. The experience of living in a 19th century san francisco building with all the nowadays confort. Free wi fi in rooms!!! Absolutly recommended

Reviews.Title: “The Inn is a home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: gccole
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Inn for years and they always make you feel like family returning home. They serve a nice breakfast and in the evening offer wine and refreshments. The rooms are roomy and all have a nice decor but they are all different! The Inn is within easy walking distance to great shopping, the trolley and BART. I highly recommend the Inn at Union Square. It's wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “The best place we ever stayed !”
Reviews.Author: hANDb3
Reviews.Content: We could only spend 2 nights in this lovely place, but that was the most memorable hotel stay for us... Brilliant service, location, and the wine and cheese in the lobby every evening were as lovely as everything else here...!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect choice for service, location and ambience.”
Reviews.Author: SallyMalibu_CA
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed both with our suite ("the penthouse") and the outstanding, personal service at this Inn. The innkeeper went to great lengths on Christmas Eve Day to accommodate our need for a DVD player, desk staff was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. Our spacious but cozy suite included a wood-burning fireplace, a wonderful touch for our Christmas holiday visit. Very high recommendation for anyone who would like to relax in the heart of the City and enjoy service backed by true sincerity to assure guests are always comfortable and contented.

Reviews.Title: “Every bit as good as the reviews say.”
Reviews.Author: LiliPinkiePie
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, and I wasn't disappointed. What a fabulous place. We arrived late in the evening, a little tired from a long drive, and barely listening to what the very nice guy on reception was telling us. So it wasn't until we got to our room that we realised we had been upgraded to a suite for no extra charge. Not only that, but when we decided to spend an extra night, they rearranged their check-in schedule so we could keep the suite, and gave it to us at our original room rate. The wine hour with the owner is a lot of fun, he gives excellent restaurant recommendations, gets everyone chatting, and really seems interested in how your day went. A truly nice person. As is everyone who works there, they were all friendly and smiling at all hours, even when I stumbled in drunk from an excellent club the owner recommended! (it was Slide, for those interested!) We never tried the breakfast, but the cookies they left out at night were very good. The hotel is close to a lot of good restaurants and bars,and right by a cable car stop too. Having said that, we had no noise problems in our room. I'm so glad we went to this charming little hotel! It's always tempting to go for a chain hotel in a strange city, but you'll never get the feeling and atmosphere of where you are. This hotel made San Francisco feel like home.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable atmosphere in a magic city”
Reviews.Author: elibel81
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel after having read all the good reviews I found on TripAdvisor. Well, it was everything true! The staff is incredibly kind and friendly and everything wes set to welcome me in that great city. I arrived in the late evening and as soon I entered I was announced I had been freely upgraded in a suite. Free happy hours with cheese and wine tasting, free breakfasts, LOVELY rooms (on the walls, beautiful pictures from the nearby art gallery). I couldn't say anything better about this hotel. I only hope to find an available room for my next visit in SF ;-)

Reviews.Title: “great vacation”
Reviews.Author: onedery
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, over New Years eve. It was my first visit to San Francisco. This is a perfect place - great location, clean comfortable rooms. The late afternoon wine was always enjoyed. The staff were fantastic, recommending and booking great restaurants. At the price, this was great value. The rooms are large enough, though not huge - but we did not go traveling to stay inside a hotel room. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in San Fran”
Reviews.Author: js24uk
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to San Fran and it didn't disappoint, especially staying at The Inn. Last time i stayed down in Fisherman wharf which was good but The Inn is ideally placed for everything. The rooms are clean spacious and well laid out and if you have time in this great city there is a big TV to watch. Macy's is just the opposite side of the square so you can come and go with bags of shopping all day. (just remember to have a big suitcase to take the bargins home) The staff are friendly, helpful and efficient. The Wine and hors-d'oeuvres are a lovely touch in the evening allowing you to meet and greet other travellers and Wayne the delighful and very informative Innkeeper (great tips for food/shopping/shows/wine tours etc). I will definitely be visiting again, I had a delightful 2 night stay at the end of a whirlwind 3 week round the world trip and the retail therapy and comfortable surroundings of The Inn was just what i need.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience - Omar was great”
Reviews.Author: OmLO
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the center of shopping and everything else. Omar and the rest of the staff provided the best service you could ask for. This place has character. The beds are very comfortable. This place is every bit as good as the reviews on here claim it to be. You will not be disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “This is a friendly, personal place!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoMimi
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable, breakfast was easy and had many choices. The wine afternoons were full of interesting folks, many of whom had stayed there many times. The best part was the staff!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is for us, a newly discoved gem in our favorite city.”
Reviews.Author: Geraldo99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at this wonderful boutique hotel in San Francisco. We liked the name and ended up loving the Inn itself. The rooms were beautiful and comfortable with special ammenities and the breakfast was terrific. An unexpected extra was the special wine reception in the evening where we felt very much at home and mingled with pleasant, interesting guests who like ourselves, were patting themselves on the back for having found such a charming and affordablr hotel in the heart of San Francisco's best dining, shopping and theatre district. The service was exceptional from every staff member we came in contact with. These are friendly, happy people who make you feel welcome. My wife is a travel professional attending a trade event during our stay. I know she will be sharing her own accolades. This is truly a gem of a hotel and one we will stay at again no matter if it is for business or a weekend get-away!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiona_100
Reviews.Content: We arrived mid afternoon after a very long flight and were greeted by a very friendly receptionist. Another member of staff (I got the impression it may even have been the owner) chatted with us and told us about the facilities. On hearing of the kettle I mentioned that, being typical Brits, we would love a cup of tea. He immediately went off to fetch a selection of teabags and bottled water for us, and couldn't have been more helpful or friendly. The room was lovely - maybe not as large or filled with every convenience as some hotels, but it felt like someone's home. The free cheese and wine buffet looked very nice, but the jet lag caught up with us by late afternoon so we didn't take part. Breakfast was great - toast, tea,coffee, cereal yoghurts etc. On our final night we were called by reception asking if we needed a taxi for departure - we had actually booked a hire car so didn't require one- but it was a nice touch. Location couldn't be better - right on Union Square. The only complaint whatsoever was that a loud air conditioner seemed to start just outside our window at about 4-5 am both mornings. As we left we mentioned this - seems it belongs to the Steakhouse next door and they are not supposed to start up until much later. The receptionist actually thanked us for bringing it to his attention, and promised that they would look into this. Such was the my positive impression of this lovely hotel, that I genuinely believed that they would do this.

Reviews.Title: “good small hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: frequent6O9traveller
Reviews.Content: To be honest, our first impression was not very positive since this hotel looked a little bit shabbily small with only one door at the entrance where only one receptionist attending the guests. However, we finally realized that such facts did not matter at all. As its name suggests, the hotel is just thirty seconds a pied from the Union Square, the heart of the city within walking distance to Chinatown, Nob Hill and Financial District, etc. The hotel offers breakfast and a happy-hour reception (free californiia wine!!) at a tiny southmost spot on the 3rd and 5th floors, where any guests can enjoy frank conversations with others. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel to all who like a small hotel in the heart of a big city except for those who do not prefer much to share a breakfast and/or happy-hour table with other unknown guests (well, you can also take the food and drink to your room or a respective spot on other floors).

Reviews.Title: “We knew we were in trouble...”
Reviews.Author: RichNRed
Reviews.Content: when we couldn't even get our suitcase through the front door. Everything about this hotel was small and a bit dingy. You couldn't have more than three people standing in the lobby at the same time, there was only room for two people in the single elevator and when the ironing board was set up, only one person could stand in the room - the other person had to sit on the bed! Don't believe the photos online - they are very deceiving! Be sure to call down for your car at least 30-45 minutes in advance - we were late for dinner because it took so long to get our car. All of the rooms are located on a single side of the building and when you open your window, you are within arms reach of the next building and there was the constant noise of the HVAC system rising up from the ground level - and we were five floors up! On a positive note, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. When our iron blew up, they immediately brought a brand new iron to the room. Unfortunately, this good service could not overcome the mediocrity of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: CramerFamily
Reviews.Content: Very clean and nicely decorated. I love this type of old world hotel. Great location right at Union Square. Staff was friendly and helpul. Free continental breakfast was good and wine and cheese in the evening was very nice. They also had bottled water and apples out most of the time and cookies at night. Only complaint is that the wireless internet was VERY slow.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Mainewanderer12
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at Inn at Union Square. The room was quiet and comfortable. The front desk staff was variable. Some restaurant recommendations by the front desk were awful. Please note: Ann at reception is a gem. Some of the beds are more comfortable than others. They tend to be a little soft. There is no A/C. A recommendation I would make to management is to vary the wine and cheese selection at happy hour and offer higher quality breakfast ingredients (cage free, FRESH eggs, better pastries, soy milk, e.g.) Also the telephones are outdated and need to be replaced. Still, I would recommend this hotel and would return there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Fred & Denny
Reviews.Content: A small hotel in a great central location. The staff are very personable and helpful. Continental breakfast is a bonus and the free wine & cheese sessions each evening provide a great opportunity for exchanges with other guests. The room was very comfortable - no view, but then we did not expect one as we were out and about - not sitting in the room. Our stay was only a short one of 3 nights, but we have no hesitation in recommending this great little hotel - and of course we booked the Inn on Union Square based on other reviews in Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Adamtosman
Reviews.Content: Great place. Competes with the big dogs around the block. Free breakfast, free wine, free internet, friendly staff. A nice small hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: Wisconsinbadger20
Reviews.Content: We came to San Francisco with no definite plans. The front desk staff and the InnKeeper Wayne gave us many suggestions and helped arrange the tours of this beautiful city. The room was very nice, clean and with many extras that we were not expecting. The morning breakfasts (complementary) were very good. Best were the evening wine and cheese get togethers. We met many guests from around the country and world. Many ideas of sights to see were exchanged and new friendships were made. The late evening "chocolate chip cookies" just like mom used to make. The location of this establishment could not be more perfect. Near all modes of transportation. We recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Locaion, Warm Atmosphere, Free WIFI”
Reviews.Author: winkone
Reviews.Content: TThis is a small boutique hotel in the thick of Union Square that is run by a small, but up and coming management company. Each guest is invited to enjoy a delicious, free breakfast and an evening happy hour for networking and social connections that are crtiical for the solo or novice traveler. The rooms are mre like suites and the spacial placement of bedroom, sitting room, bathroom, etc, conveys even more of a spacious feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service, Will Stay Here Again.”
Reviews.Author: MooneyPilot
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a truly fun place to stay for my week in San Francisco. The hotel has a quirky charm that grows on you throughout your stay there. The check in was very smooth and the front desk attendant could not have been more pleasant. My suite was very clean, but missing a few things. The bathroom was clean, but in need of some renovation (water handles in the shower were falling off and it was very worn). The rooms had very nice robes and excellent Aveda bath products. However, the some of the towels were a bit worn out and had some frayed edges (not quite up to par), compared to everything else. The living room area desparately needed a coffee table to set things down on, so you don't have to use the desk chair. The good part of the rooms is that they are very quiet (a rare find in a downtown location), however the reason that they are so quiet is that the windows have a view of the brick wall of the building next door. It was nice to be able to open the window though, as there were no a/c controls or vents in my room and it was a bit hot during the day. It was still hot out, but cooled off enough at night to sleep with the ceiling fan on high and the windows opened. The high speed internet was nice and fairly fast. On the plus side again, are the sitting areas on each floor. It was nice to be able to get up and have coffee each morning and work on my laptop in the common area (which has a window and view out to Union Square. The hotel has an arrangement with a very nice local health club (just around the corner) to work out, but the cost is $15 per day (a bit much, as most higher end hotels offer a fitness center or free workout passes). The daily continental breakfast was fine and the afternoon wine and cheese reception was nice (the wine was actually enjoyable and the cheese selection was interesting and pleasurable, unlike most other hotel receptions with unpalatable wine and cubed swiss, cheddar and pepper jack). All in all, I enjoyed my stay and will stay here again on my next visit to San Francisco, whether for work or pleasure. The location can't be beat and the service was great! I would have to rate it as a 4 star experience and with just a little bit of work it could be truly 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, centrally located.”
Reviews.Author: NeuTravel
Reviews.Content: Best parts: free wine, cheese and hors d'oeuvres from 5:30-7 in the evening, free breakfast, free internet, right at Union Square. The room was cozy, clean, nicely decorated, and quiet. Nice queen size bed (we got the least expensive room). Front desk staff very helpful. The parking garage for the hotel is on Mason, less than a block away.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located with the added touch of great personal friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: DublinPippa
Reviews.Content: Myself and hubby sttayed here for 8 nights in Sept 09. The hotel is a charming old worldly place that is perfectly located with all forms of transport on your door step. We stayed in an executive room which was lovely but a but noisey. We found every one of the staff to be so friendly and most helpful. They were great at suggesting places to eat and drink and places to visit and were only too willing to check out places for us on the internet.We loved the wine tasting that was held early evening. It was a great way to meet up with the other guests. If you a looking for a hotel that is good value and a little bit different with a very personal service this is the place to stay. We would definately stay here again. Newly weds Dublin

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in one great place!”
Reviews.Author: AVALON02
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many hotels around the world and this little gem is up with the best of them. We like smaller hotels with character. Location, amenities, wine & cheese, breakfast, simple but terrific rooms....we have found our SF hide away!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: BristolBert
Reviews.Content: After planning a trip to San Franciso for a couple of years the trip finally came to fruition. During the planning we had looked at many different hotels, large, small, on the warf, on the square etc. We finally opted for the Inn at Union Square and were all absolutely delighted. We were travelling with friends and had 2 rooms on the second floor. Our room was a one bedroomed suite at the front of the hotel and our friends had a large room with separate sitting area just down the corridor. The rooms were clean and well appointed. The bed was comfortable and we loved the down pillows! However, most of the rooms (not the ones at the front) look out onto the brick wall of the adjacent building - so don't expect a view. The staff were a pleasure. Ken on reception was both helpful and willing to pass the time of day with you. It was clear that he took pride in helping guest like us from out of the country. This was also true of his colleagues who also manned the reseption when Ken was not around. The continental breakfast had a good variety, including fresh fruit cereals etc and you had the choice of eating it in your room or in the communal areas on each floor. The evening wine & snacks in the late afternoon, however, was the icing on the cake. 3 varieties of cheese with buscuits, a selection of dried fruits and nuts was quite a spread. It was lovely to sample the wine & nibbles whilst chatting with the other guests.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCat
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on previous reviews here and we were happy with our choice. We stayed six nights in a double room. I had booked the cheapest room available but to our surprise we were upgraded at the check-in to a junior suite. The room was spacious and beautiful. It was decorated with red, yellow and gold and it felt comfortable. The safe was in the room. Our room didn't have a great view but it didn't matter to us. Breakfast was included with the price and there were bread, cereals, pastries, fruits, juice, coffee and tea. The breakfast area isn't big so we took a tray to our room. The free morning paper and wine and hors d'oeuvres in the evening were very nice treats. The staff was excellent, very friendly and helpful. Only downside with our experience was that they had reserved the room cost twice from our credit card and it took days before it was cleared out and we could use that card again. Location of this hotel is perfect. It is quite near two BART stations so access to and from the airport is convenient. The historic cable cars run nearby and there are plenty of shops in the neighborhood. Many of the tourist attractions aren't close but you can take a cable car, tram or a bus to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb”
Reviews.Author: MikeKidderminster
Reviews.Content: Visited The Inn in September. Excellent room, excellent position,brilliant staff and management. Breakfast was excellent , room was spotless, host was friendly and entertaining. Thoroughly enjoyed ourt stay at this hotel and would recommend to anyone. Wine tasting was entertaining with Wayne and his friends. Would definitely visit again.

Reviews.Title: “You have to stay here!”
Reviews.Author: c1d
Reviews.Content: There is a reason this hotel is rated so highly on TripAdvisor.... Location: The location is PERFECT. Right near Union Square there are plenty of restaurants and shops nearby. Its only a short walk to get to wherever you are going - the tram and plenty of bus stops are also a short walk away. Rooms: Rooms weren't the largest we've stayed in but they weren't small by any means. Well equipped with a LCD TV, lounge chair etc. Kept clean too. No airconditioner, but trust me when I say you're not going to need one. Service: AMAZING. So friendly. The owner is only to happy to have a chat about the sights of San Fran, how to get there etc over the complimentary drinks and snacks the hotel puts on daily. Free breakfast every morning as well. Staff at the front desk also very friendly and all knew the area well enough to be able to answer our questions. Hotel also offers complimentary internet which was handy. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Close to cable cars and shopping”
Reviews.Author: RNonthemove56
Reviews.Content: We were so impressed with the hotel, the service and the close proximtry to the cable cars. The cable cars take you to the Fisherman's Wharf and other fun locals. Shopping is blocks away. A continental breakfast, wine bar and cookies at night......all for free. What else can I say.......

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SVaughn1
Reviews.Content: While our stay was only two evenings --- we LOVED the hotel!
