Upon arrival, one staff member and the manager (Wayne) went to our (temporarily illegally) parked rental car to get our bags. We merely asked them to hold on to them while we returned the vehicle to the airport --- but they quickly whisked them up to our room. Wayne was wonderful! After we returned from SFO (returning the rental car) and got familiar with our room, Wayne ushered us up to the wine and cheese reception and introduced us to several of the other guests. He made us feel right at home! Every staff member we encountered was professional, courteous and quick to respond to any request we had. The hotel is in a great location! Post Street at Union Square; convenient to BART and cable car stops; shopping; dining; literally everything! The room was really nice! Large bed; adequate bathroom; nice TV (didn't watch it much though); there is no air conditioning (but remember, you are in SF!!) and the view from the side rooms is limited. If you are in SF to spend time in a hotel room and look out the window --- then you may wish to find another hotel. However, if you are looking for a very nice hotel in a great location the The Inn at Union Square should be seriously considered. We visit SF every now and again --- and do enjoy staying in different hotels. However, we would definitely stay at The Inn at Union Square again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: xxxx025
Reviews.Content: Multiple features made this an outstanding hotel that we would highly recommend to others. Evening wine, cheese, and fruit plus morning breakfast, both served in a quaint library setting, were a spontaneous gathering time for hotel guests. You had an opportunity to meet and talk with others that you would be difficult to replicate in a large hotel. The inn keeper met guests in the library at the time of the evening wine and cheese, a sign of the commitment this hotel has to its clientel. The breakfast choices were different from what you find at most chain hotels, and were appreciated over the cookie cutter approach to morning meals. In particular, the granola was excellent and the pecan rolls and almond croissants melted in your mouth. There were chocolate chip cookies on each floor in the later evening, and the staff members were responsive to every request. For example, we asked for fresh coffee at 10 p.m., and it was ready in the library within minutes. The rooms were modest in size and the shower was small but the room appointments were high quality and the bed was excellent. We slept so well both due to the mattress and the quiet, restful atmosphere. The location was ideal, a few steps from Union Square and the cable cars, and a brief walk to China Town and the Powell Street BART station. If you are looking for a large hotel with big rooms and lavish baths, this is not the place. However, if you are looking for a uinque experience in a hotel where the guests are well cared for and the rooms are nicely decorated, this is the setting. We met several returning guests during our stay, and we can understand why they came back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveller2
Reviews.Content: I was staying in S.F. for a conference. The conference hotel was much more expensive and had terrible reviews on TripAdvisor. I stayed a couple of blocks away at this very nice property, and I had a pleasant stay. I received a complimentary upgrade to a Queen Suite upon check-in. The room was clean and comfortable, and the suite was spacious. I did see inside one regular (non-suite) room, and it was small, similar in size to hotel rooms I have stayed in in London and New York City. There is complimentary wine in the evenings, and free continental breakfast is included in the price of the room. Free and particularly tasty cookies were set out each evening. The security system required guests to scan their room key card both to enter the building in the evening and to use the elevator at any time. There are only 2 downsides to staying at this hotel, and neither really has nothing to do with the hotel itself. The Union Square area seemed to have lots of tourists, and consequently many homeless people begging. Although none were particularly aggressive toward me, it was sometimes annoying. Also, Post St. is one of the major routes into Union Square, and there is lots of traffic. One of my windows faced it, and it was noisy. However, because of the hotel's floor plan, most rooms do not face Post St. My bedroom was very quiet, as it was not on Post St.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Emma2009BathUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for 3 nights and loved it. The room was small but nicely decorated and good bathroom. Breakfast was fantastic. Seconds to Union Square and close to car rental companies if you were heading on from San Francisco. Brilliant value for money, personal and really nice staff. Free wine tasting in the early evening was a nice touch. No a/c but that wasn't a problem despite the hot weather. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure why this is top of trip adviser”
Reviews.Author: mikeyb2410
Reviews.Content: Having always used trip adviser to find our hotels or restaurants, as part off a month long holiday in the US we flew in to San Francisco a decided to stay for our first nights stay in this hotel. I have to say I am surprised at all the reviews, on arriving at our room, we found it was not clean and smelled. We immediately checked out and went to the Fairfield nobhill which was a 10 minute walk away from Union Square, and we got n amazing room with a view of both Alcatraz and the Golden Gate bridge for $159 for the night.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Stippie
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was a pleasure. Staff was very friendly. Location is excellent, steps away from Union Square, which is central, but less of a tourist trap than Fisherman's Wharf. We were lucky to have a room on the upper floor (6th, I believe), in the back, which meant no street noise and plenty day light. Since this is a narrow hotel, I wonder whether the other rooms might have a view of the wall of the building next door (don't know about this though). Daily newspaper is complementary, which we appreciated very much. Breakfast was fine, better than most continental breakfasts we had during our stay in the U.S. (and we've stayed in many hotels). Enjoyed the tea selection and cookies! Both room and bathroom were very clean and comfortable. Good size bed, comfortable. We booked a superior room online (Hotels.com) and found a good deal (book 3 nights, pay for 2), which was wonderful since this is not a very cheap hotel. Would come again if we could find the same deal. :)

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home - highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: gooseSaintPaul
Reviews.Content: The staff was exceptionally hospitable and personal - they had even invited us for breakfast the morning we were checking out of a different hotel (the Frank Hotel - not so recommended). The rooms were very clean and comfortable (even robes and an umbrella in the closet!). The bed was very comfortable with luxurious bedding. The location was perfect as we were traveling with our 5 year old daughter - within walking distance to sights or easy access to public transportation. The breakfast was delicious and they offered healthy foods - not your typical American continental breakfast. The wine tasting in the afternoon was a nice touch too. We loved San Francisco and staying at this hotel was icing on the cake. Highly recommend!! If traveling with kids - highly recommend the California Academy of Sciences too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoTraveller30
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square is a San Francisco bargain. The price is outstanding compared to many other SF hotels and by far beat the large chains. The rooms are small, but luxuriously appointed and clean. The breakfast and afternoon wine and cheese bar are generous. And the service from the staff is excellent. Top off with a great location within walking distance of several tourist attractions and just a few steps away from public transportation and you have a winner. There is a business center that has area tourist information, a computer with internet access and a printer. The downside is if you bring a car, as the parking charges are expensive. If you are staying in central SF, I recommend ditching the car and relying on your feet and public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cute”
Reviews.Author: elizab569
Reviews.Content: We only stayed two nights but we had a great time. Great locaion- we walked everywhere! Our room was TINY... and it didnt have AC... so that was kinda a bummer... but luckily it didnt bother us too much, but if we were there for any more than two nights, we would have went crazy in such a tight space... the wine and cheese at night was very nice.... and the breakfast was yummy! Front desk is super nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: sdbyrd
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to San Francisco for my 30th birthday in August/2009 and it was my first visit to San Francisco. I realized quickly that The Inn at Union Square is a great location while visiting SF. Lots of shopping and restaurants within walking distance. The room size was plenty big for the two of us, with a separate bathroom/shower area and a "lounge" area with love seat. The bed was incredibly comfortable! Each morning the staff would set up free breakfast areas on every floor, so no need to all gather in one area. They also had free wine/cheese socials set up in the afternoons. Speaking of the staff, they were exceptionally friendly. Every time we walked into the hotel we would be greeted and also on the way out. They would even offer to hail a cab without even asking. It wasn't just the front desk staff either, as the cleaning staff were constantly saying hello and asking how you are doing. I would absolutely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to San Francisco. We only stayed for 2 nights but it was perfect! *Also had free WiFi access for those interested.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, will come back to SF just to stay here”
Reviews.Author: mindy74
Reviews.Content: Charming, European feel boutique hotel with excellent service. My husband and I spent a weekend here and were very pleased. First, the location is excellent. Our room was not huge, but had a small sitting area and plenty of space for the two of us. The only negative in the room was the tiny bathroom. The bed was incredibly comfortable with high quality linens. The wine reception every evening was fun and a great way to start off our evenings. Similarly, the morning breakfast buffet was impressive, especially for a hotel this size. Finally, the service was exceptional. We were particularly impressed with Omar, who was friendly, attentive, and bent over backwards to make our trip go smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but over-hyped”
Reviews.Author: Kayte4321
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the lobby is small but the hotel has character. We had a "King Suite" and I was shocked at how small it was. There was not even room for a sitting area. I was a little worried after reading that there was no AC but that was not a problem at all. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. All in all this is a decent hotel but we definitely did not get the service other reviews are raving about. The front desk always seemed understaffed. When we arrived it took a long time to get bell service and valet and when we left we ended up just having to go get a luggage cart and bring down the luggage ourselves after 2 calls asking for assistance. We called in advance and they asked when we needed our car and bell service but 20 minutes after the requested time we had received neither. The wine reception and breakfast were nice touches but the areas where these are held are tiny. Not really big enough for more than 5 people. Like I said, it's a decent hotel but should not be at #3 given all of the other options in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “this hotel retains the wow factor”
Reviews.Author: cracklehillhogg
Reviews.Content: A gem of a hotel in a fantastic location. The staff bend over backwards to meet your needs and answer your questions. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: buv1955
Reviews.Content: What a great surprise this hotel turned out to be after having seen the frontage on arrival. My wife and I were slightly concerned but our fears were soon blown away by this cute, friendly and cosy hotel. Our room was very comfortable and clean. Each evening between 5 and 7pm the hotel provided complimentary wine, cheese, nuts and soft drinks etc and this proved to be an ideal way to meet the other guests and relax. The breakfasts were just the job and you could fill your tray and eat in the comfort of your room. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff and were willing to book us reservations at restaurants etc. There was a free to use The hotel has a perfect location being 100 yards from Powell St cable car stop which is in Union Square. The centre for all the major stores. Great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Met my expectations”
Reviews.Author: claudiaB1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Inn from July 19-24. We were very content with the hotel. The staff was excellent. Wayne, Omar and Ann were exceptionally great. Loved the rooms. Did not need air conditioning as San Francisco was cool that week. The location could not have been better. It was centrally located. The breakfast was more than adequate. There was food for all palates. The evening wine and cheese was an additional perk. It was great to sit and chat with others from all ove the world in a relaxed atmosphere. The nighttime cookies topped it all off. All in all we would return again and would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: ddmoon
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at this hotel. Was a little disappointed at first that it did not have air conditioning, but we did have a ceiling fan which surprisingly, kept the room extremely cool. Room was small, but nicely furnished. Complimentary breakfast was served at the end of the corridor on level 5. In the evenings wine and cheese was served in the same location and this was an excellent way of meeting other guests of all nationalities in the hotel, in fact some evenings we didn't want to leave the hotel as we were having such a good time with the other guests! This hotel is in an excellent location for shopping, trolley buses and local restaurants. Should we ever visit San Francisco again, would stay at this hotel and would highly recommend to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, fantastic location, the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: LinMcK76
Reviews.Content: We had a 10 day stay here at the beginning of July, the hotel served as an ideal base for our sightseeing. We were upgraded upon arrival to a Junior Suite which was greatly appreciated (after a long journey from Glasgow via Philadelphia). The room was comfortable and a good size, though the carpet was stained in parts. The bathroom was also a good size and we were kept very well stocked with lovely Aveda toiletries. The continental breakfast was always well stocked with cereal, pastries, fruit and bread for toast. And if you need a coffee or two before you can get going, you can have as much as you like, while reading the morning paper! Hot drinks were also available thoughout the day, with kettles on each floor. The bottled water and cookies in the evening were a fantastic bonus! We only made it to the cheese and wine on a couple of occasions but everything was of a good quality once again. This hotel is situated just steps from Union Square and a short stroll from Market Street, so if you're keen on shopping, it's ideal. Westfield Shopping Centre is highly recommended. We used public transport thoughout our stay, the MUNI passes are fantastic value at $24 for 7 days, especially when you consider that one cable car ride is $5. We used the buses mostly (you can get a map from reception that shows all the routes) and found them very efficient and easily accessible from our base at Union Square. Lastly, a big thank you to all the staff for being SO helpful and efficient throughout our stay, this hotel offers a much more personal touch than any others we've stayed in before. They have lots of good tips and will happily make reservations at restaurants and on day trips on your behalf. We were even provided with a takeaway breakfast at 6am before heading to the airport on our way home. Overall, this hotel offered great value, location and service. We would definitely recommend it to other travelers, for both short and longer stays.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and fantastic location!!!”
Reviews.Author: paulstew
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased in our two night stay at the Inn, since we were going off the Trip Advisor’s recommendations. Wayne and his staff (like others have said) really do make the stay at the Inn worth it. They make thier three star rating seem like four. They are humorous, knowledgeable and make you feel like you like you’re at home. They have a fine breakfast and wine/cheese hour each day. We ate at Morton’s (just seconds away) and above Macy’s at The Cheesecake Factory. We saw Wicked one night and it was a short taxi cab ($6.00) ride to the Orpheum (If you are over 5'10, either sit in the front rows or back rows, leg room is tight) I am glad we trusted the reviews on Trip Advisor and had such a nice stay at the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Super location and super service!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMaestra1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for three nights (July 1-3). We were greeted by a vary friendly and knowledgeable staff. We enjoyed the continental breakfast, the cheese and wine time and the evening cookies. Our rooms were clean and spacious. The location was great. The trolley and other modes of transportation were only a short walk away. We would stay here again on any future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel...loved the wine reception each evening”
Reviews.Author: trvlLV
Reviews.Content: As several reviewers stated, don't be shocked by the small lobby. This is a small hotel, but is filled with personal touches. The staff is extremely helpful and the wine reception at 5:30 each evening was lovely. It was a great opportunity to relax, feel pampered, and meet a few guests. The room is quite small and my boyfriend stubbed his toe quite badly on the bench as he walked across the room. The room is nicely furnished, but with the small size could have used fewer pieces. We would definitely stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Way overrated”
Reviews.Author: lasocal
Reviews.Content: I have seen it before: An otherwise forgettable hotel makes it to the top of the TripAdvisor rankings through a combination of good prices and very friendly service. This place certainly has great service and good prices, and the location can't be beat. However, the hotel itself leaves more than a little to be desired. First, there was no air conditioning in our room; this necessitated sleeping with the windows open, and thus brought in all of the noises of the city. Not exactly the best night's sleep we've ever had. Second, the shower was one of the worst showers I have ever experienced (and that's including a lot of European showers!). It was very tight and the shower head could not be adjusted to actually spray onto one's body. If you can deal with these unpleasantries then this might be the place for you, but I was thoroughly unimpressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, atmosheric, friendly little place.”
Reviews.Author: Fridaygeorge
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3 nights. We got a complementary upgrade to a 'Queen Suite' which was nice. The only thing i would say would be that the views from a lower level room on the rear of the hotel will look directly onto a wall. If that doesn't bother you then good. The room was clean and reasonably big. Location is fantastic, you really are a short walk from union sq and the heart of san fran but far enough away to get peace and quiet. They held wine evenings every night, where you met with different guests from the hotel and had complementary wine and cheese. Lovely place, would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff, nice room”
Reviews.Author: 021810a
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in June. We liked the location, very friendly and helpful staff, our room decor and safe, complimentary snacks and wine every evening, complimentary wireless internet and the value for money that this hotel offers. The room was a little warm for our liking, did not seem to have air conditioning but did have a fan. Also there was ever present white noise from what seemed to be a huge air conditioning system in a courtyard space outside; this was overlooked by our room. The noise did not prevent us from sleeping but was not exactly pleasant either. There was a gold rush each morning for the complimentary breakfast and the day that we tried to get breakfast there was very little of anything left. We called down to reception and someone came promptly to replenish supplies. Also the breakfast area is small and can get crowded easily. Overall we recommend the Inn at Union Square, the positives of this hotel far outweigh the negatives. We especially thank ALL the staff for their warmth, friendliness and assistance during our stay. Everyone was extremely nice to us. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at Union Square is a jewel of a hotel right in the heart of San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: lloydbtc
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square is a jewel of a hotel right in the heart of San Francisco! No sooner do you walk into the lobby then you are warmly greeted and pampered after your long journey. The staff and service are exceptional. They take a special interest in meeting your every need. We can't say enough of how much we enjoyed our stay. The rooms are beautifully decorated and very comfortable. We stayed in a lovely suite that had a parlor sitting room. It was a perfect room to entertain our daughters whom we came to visit. We especially appreciated the free wine and cheese offered every day on two floors of the hotel. It was fun to meet other guests in this lovely setting with comfortable high back chairs around a fireplace. One evening, we spent several hours talking with Wayne, the hotel manager, and another guest, DeAnna. It felt like an evening with old friends. Then, later in the evening, Joseph, one of the staff, made delicious chocolate chip cookies. How could we resist? If this weren't enough, each morning the hotel offers a lovely breakfast with delicacies of croissants, eggs, biscuits, muffins, juice, coffee and tea. Aside from the wonderful amenities, the Inn is located just steps away from art galleries, great shopping, upscale restaurants, and of course, all the famous spots in San Francisco. We definitely will return to the Inn in the future and highly recommend it to anyone who is looking for a comfortable, clean, quiet, bed and breakfast hotel right in the center of a most beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel lives up to its Trip Advisor Rating”
Reviews.Author: DianeCole
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely 10th wedding anniversary stay at this hotel. We booked a deluxe King room, and were upgraded upon arrival to the King Suite for free. The staff is wonderful, and they truly seem to enjoy their jobs (which is reflected in their excellent service). Many Thanks to the staff for their cheerful attitude and helpful tips. They booked show tickets for us at a moment's notice, and mapped out for us great places to go that were in the same area as the show: appetizers, the show, dinner, and dessert. What a nice date night we had. Each place was excellent, and lived up to the claims of the staff. We would definitely stay here again. The only (minor) negative was the bathroom - the shower was much to be desired, but if I wanted a luxury bathroom, I would have gone to a spa. Stay here and Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home-away-from-home in this truly wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: cag18
Reviews.Content: Quite simply the best hotel I have ever stayed at. The location could not be better, located one minute from Union Square. Easy to get around the city from there. Plenty of shops (Macy*s/SAKS etc), and despite this central position, the rooms are away from the street, so a nice quiet and relaxing sanctuary to return to after a hectic day of sightseeing! The hotel itself is quite small, but the room size is absolutely fine for city centre location. Clean and modern bathrooms, and comfy beds. Nice quality TV (should you have time to watch any!) and very comfortable homely feeling. What makes this hotel really stand out however is the customer care. From entering the front desk area, Ken ensured that were warmly welcomed, and checked us in in no time. He really could not have been nicer. During our stay we would have the pleasure to meet some of the other staff, including Omar and David on the front desk, who were equally great - offering recommendations of what to see during our stay, and also there to just have a nice chat at the end of the day. As you have probably read in other reviews, the hotel offers complimentary wine and cheese in the early evenings. I highly recommend you attend this. Lovely way to meet other travelers, and to also have a glass (or two) of wine with hotel manager Wayne. Another fantastic member of staff, very entertaining and full of San Fran hot tips! Lovely way to start the evening. If you find yourself back at the hotel around 8:30pm, make sure you take a look down at the communal seating area at the end of each floor. Tony bakes cookies each night and places them out in small jars. Be quick though - they are addictive and disappear quickly! We loved our room, the location and most of all the truly fabulous staff. We can't wait to return to this incredible city, and we already know where we will be staying. C + A.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location - lovely hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: fishiana
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days in April 2009 and loved it! We stayed on the 4th floor in the room all the way at the end and were very pleased with the size of the room and all the comforts that came with it. The breakfast at the end of the hall was a great way to start the day and the evening wine and cheese were a wonderful perk! Our only issue was the internet access was very limited. We could not get access in our room, and therefore had to check our messages from the common areas. The most important thing for us was location - and it was superb. The personal service was charming - we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Best value and location in Fan Fran”
Reviews.Author: pollerina
Reviews.Content: Just jump on the BART and go to Market Street and you are there in no time. Don't let the small reception put you off - Great location, clean tidy rooms, very helpful staff at reception, perfect buffet brekkie.

Reviews.Title: “It does the job”
Reviews.Author: FussyGlobeTrotter
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a good location and feels modern'ish', so for the money I was happy. We stayed in a room one class up from standard. The room was large, but it didn't blow my socks off. The airconditioner was placed in the window - and was behind the blinds = not effective or blinds need to be open all night. It has a bath shower and shower curtain. Yuk. The bathroom was tiny and while it was recently refurbuished, it felt amatuer hour, like a five year old did the tiling. The finish was bad so it still felt kind of 'old' and dirty. The decor in the main room was cute, with fun lamps and a desk and the bed was comfortable. It isn't a spectacular hotel, but you aren't paying spectacular prices either.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: lindaw11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a very good location. They offer a social wine tasting every evening for free and the employees are helpful and friendly. The room was very recently re-furbished and is very lovely.

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: magsy49
Reviews.Content: It's all been said already but I have to put my tuppence-worth in. On arrival at the very small frontage my heart plummeted , thinking what had we come to, and again in the tiny reception. However, by the time we got to our room my spirits lifted at the sheer quaint/nostalgic feeling this hotel gave. Our room was lovely and that fabulously comfy bed - where did they get it cos we want one! Everything about this hotel ticked all the boxes and the staff were great. Location, breakfast, the cookie jar, apples - all the little touches - perfect! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Are all of us crazy?”
Reviews.Author: cesargcastrejon
Reviews.Content: We were there in september 2008. We don't understand the good qualification of this hotel. First the positive: - Good location The negative: - Bad matress - Small room - Noisy - Dirty - Uncomfortable - Old-fashioned - Bad breakfast (You had to be faster than the roadrunner to get the cakes)

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and spacious room.”
Reviews.Author: EleniA
Reviews.Content: There is nothing to fault with this gem of a hotel. The location is conveniently located to allow you access to cable cars if you want to head to the water and it's in the buzzy and vibrant district of Union sq. We stayed in a Deluxe room. It was clean and spacious, continental breakfast was sparse but fresh. All in all, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant - don't go anywhere else! or there should be six stars for this one.”
Reviews.Author: chrisuk1000
Reviews.Content: This is without the best hotel I have stayed in full stop. On arrival I looked at the entrance and my heart sank. Basically a doorway and an awning, that’s all that marks the front of the Inn at Union Square. Even as I entered I was filled with doubt and felt I was on the edge of yet another disappointment. How wrong I was. If I said the reception I received was amazing, I would honestly be cheating you of the true experience. We were made to feel like the most special customers on the planet. Courtesy was displayed in abundance; whoever trains or selects the staff should receive a medal. They couldn’t give us enough advice or assistance with planning our stay. Nothing was a problem in the slightest. I was deeply impressed by the service I received, a big thank you to everyone there for that. I found the room very bright, airy and comfortable. The decor was to a good standard and the fixtures and fittings seemed totally appropriate for my requirements. The hotel is full on environment aware so everything is about going green. And it works. There’s even a superb mission statement outside the lift that supports the hotels commitment to the customer and to the environment. And I firmly believe they mean what they say. Breakfast was served down the corridor in a special reserved area. Mmmmm I thought sounds dodgy but you know something, even that was great! A nice touch was the local newspaper on the doorstep in the morning. It all really got too much when reception rang me, totally unprompted to ask if they could book me a taxi as I was leaving in the morning. Absolutely switched on to every need I reckon. 10 out of 10 to this hotel. Thanks for the superb stay. This hotel should be the benchmark for all others to meet, I’m totally serious. Definitely don’t go anywhere else you’d be crazy...... I'm going on so much about how good it is I forgot to say the location is good as well. The trolley car stops just at the end of the road and there's buses and taxis enough to go around. Stuck for info ...... ask at reception :-)

Reviews.Title: “Congratulations The Inn at Union Square!!! You are number one indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Piramidon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn at Union Square this April for 7 days. My husband had a conference at Moscone ctr and this was our first time in San Francisco. We were so glad we didn't book with Mariott - the official conference hotel. Charming historic building and amaising staff at The Inn at Union Square made our stay in San Francisco unforgettable. I will not repeat all the details - they are in other reviewes - but I would like to congratulate the staff and especially manager Wayne with Trawellers Choice Award. Thank you for making our stay special!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant in every way!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NELLYAustralia
Reviews.Content: Great location - close to union square, trolleys and buses take you everywhere. Buy a MUNI pass and you can travel everywher for a few dollars a day - great value. We shopped heaps - Victoria's Secret just around the corner. Every major department store and boutique imaginable just minutes away. Food in SF is great - Cheescake Factory just across the square, on top of Macys has an awesome menu - so hard to choose. Hotel staff are exceptionally amazing - all very different personalities but all customer service oriented. You wouldn't expect it from such a great-looking boutique hotel. They suggested restaurants and advised us on how to get around to various places. Can't fault them at all. Thanks to David, Omar and Wayne. Cleaning staff were very friendly also. I can't remember the last time I received such great customer service. Thank you - it makes a difference to your stay in a new city. Breakfast every morning is great - cereal, pastries, yogurt, fruit, eggs, etc. Cheese and wine in the evening, and fresh-baked chocolate chip cookies left out for guests at night. Every floor has a tea room/area, where you can help yourself to teas and apples at any time. Nice if you want a quiet place to relax. As for the rooms, VERY CLEAN, and serviced daily, complimentary water bottle and chocolate on arrival. The decor is beautiful!!!! I'm very picky about where I stay and I was impressed. Rooms are spacious for a big city. 24 hour reception and electronic cards make it a very safe/secure hotel. Quiet business centre room free to use which was handy as we did not travel with a laptop. Can't fault it in any way. If I come back to SF I will only stay here. It is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Crikey this place is a little beauty!”
Reviews.Author: crikey68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently enjoyed a wonderful stay at this quiet, gorgeous little hotel. Got a great deal on Expedia and the tripadvisor reviews were excellent. The Inn was so close to the shopping at Union Square that my credit card melted from my wifes use! and easy walk to cable cars. Check in was a breeze, got in a little early but Omar at the front desk simply said "no worries your room is ready" up to the 5th floor, great room with king bed, very comfortable with great amenities in bathroom. We stayed on the 5th floor which has breakfast set up every morning and the evening wine and cheese reception, easy access from your room. Breakfast every morning was superb, toast, pastries, muffins, hard boiled eggs, juice, coffee, yougurt, fresh fruit just awesome before hitiing the sights. You can catch the cable cars just meters down the street from the hotel. At 5.30pm every night wonderful wine and chees reception on the 5th and 3rd floors, great local wines, wonderful fruit and cheese platters and soft drink (pop) if you do not want to sample lovely wines from Napa! Great way to meet new people and get some great ideas on what to see and do. The staff at the hotel were simply wonderful, ask for anything from directions to rental cars to transport to restaurants nothing was too hard. The hotels location is simply wonderful, catch the bart from the airport and a short walk from powell street and you are at the hotel. We went to the baseball to see the giants and got to the park in less than 10 minutes from the hotel using public transport, easy and cheap and AT&T park is awesome. The rooms are a little small but for 2 adults on vacation from freezing cold Edmonton it was just perfect. We are originally from Australia and met many Aussies on our trip many of which stayed at the hotel as well, very popular with folks from downunder and again can't recommend the hotel enough. Would definately stay here again anytime we come to San Fransisco and highly recommend this establishment to anyone. Great job and thanks to all at Inn at Union Sqare for making our trip ( wedding anniversary ) really awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Wazza145
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I couldn't wait to get to San Francisco, we read all the reviews on Trip Advisor, and decided that this would be the best value for money vs location. We weren't disappointed from that side at all. On arrival, we were upgraded, and thank goodness for that, as the hotel is where we spent most of our time, as both of us were unfortunately sick. The staff were great though, they managed to keep our room clean when we mustered the strength to go on a tour, they were great with offering advice and directions, and even where we could find the closest doctor. The room has a sitting room with a flat screen tv, as well as in the bedroom. the bed was large and comfortable, and even though we had a problem with the toilet, the staff were excellent in sorting it out. You can not beat the location, just off Union Square, and real close to the BART station and cable car. Unfortunately we couldn't take advantage of the wine and continental breakfast, but looked good. It is a small hotel, and the room can get a bit claustrophobic if you spend too much time there like us unfortunately. The service is excellent, and the location really is great. Just can not be beat. We would definitely return, hopefully on a healthier note.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: frix26
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May this year and it is one of the lovliest hotels we have stayed in. San Francisco is a beautiful city and the location is perfect. The hotel is fairly small and very friendly. The staff cannot do enough to help you. We loved the complimentary evening cheese and wine. There are so many other special touches, delicious breakfasts and evening home cooked cookies. We cannot fault this place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be put off by the small reception area, it's an excellent hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: jetsetterirl
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel last minute for my parents as the hotel I was staying in had no rooms available. This hotel had received excellent reviews on tripadvisor.com and they were all true to their word. Although the reception area and lift are small, the rooms themselves are a nice size, clean and comfortable. The room had a seating area, dressing table, flatscreen tv aswell as a good sized bed. The bathroom was small but spotless. A delicious continental breakfast was included in the price (just under €500 for 4 nights) was served on a few different floors until 10am in the morning. Breakfast was laid out on the landing area and they provided you with trays so you could bring it back to your room. Complimentary newspaper every morning. Complimentary wine and cheese served 5pm-7pm every evening. They also had tea and coffee facilities laid out on a few different floors all day (my parents were delighted with this as they love their tea). Fab location only steps away from Union Square. It may not be the fanciest of hotels but the service and value for money in this hotel is unbelievable in this day and age compared to other hotels in and around Union Square. Only downfall no air con but the windows do open in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, position and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lillbillies
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband, 2 kids (9, 11) and my parents. All of us were very impressed with the location, right on union square better location than the high priced hotels. We arrived at 10 am exhausted from a flight from Australia and for the first time in my many travels they had both rooms ready and available for immediate occupation, WOW. The service the whole time was wonderful, breakfast in the morning and wine with nibbles every evening. It was like staying in a home away from home. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: rmurgas
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Inn for "carnavales" and we picked this hotel based on the reviews we found in Trip Advisor. We were pleased with how neat and clean the hotel was, and the decoration is very appropriate for a boutique hotel. The service was excellent. The location is ideal a conveniently located near everything you might be interested in seeing. In general, the hotel is great for a romantic gatewaway. The only drawback is that they serve breakfast in a small hall they have in the third and fifth floors, and some times in the third floor only, which gets crowded and uncomfortable at times, as these areas accomodate up to 4 people at anytime.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in SFO”
Reviews.Author: sjmacdee
Reviews.Content: The Inn is one of the best hotels we have ever used. Everything about it is great. It is a small hotel, about 25 rooms, so don't expect some of the big hotel things like pools or gyms. But if you love great, small, European style hotels with amazing service, beautiful and very comfortable rooms, only steps from Union Square, look no further. The staff is amazing and made perfect recommendations for restaurants and tours, which by the way, the best tours in SFO are free. Ask the front desk for the info. The afternoon wine and cheese receptions are hosted by a member of the staff and are really great. The whole hotel takes part. We looked forward to it everyday. It is the first time I have ever participated in any free wine reception at a hotel. They are usually boring and have bad wine. This however was wonderful. Lots of visitors from Europe mad it very nice. I can't say enough about the Inn. You must try it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, very sociable, great helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: MarcDark
Reviews.Content: A great hotel in a fantastic location, free wii-fi, complimentary wine tasting and continental breakfast. Amazingly helpful staff (thanks Wayne and Ken)... would definitely recommend it to anyone wanting something a little different and sociable!

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: mosrm
Reviews.Content: We stayed just one night and found the hotel to be clean, comfortable, and in a great Union Square location. For the price this hotel is great! Wine and cheese are complimentary each evening, a continental breakfast is provided in the morning. Wi-fi is also FREE!! The negative aspects of this hotel is the small barthrooms and narrow hallways. However, if you are looking for a good deal in Union Square and you don't mind being a little cramped- this place is probably the best deal in downtown San Fran. The hotel has both self parking and valet parking for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every aspect of this place!”
Reviews.Author: Curls99
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel - it had a brilliant location, really close to Union Square, with all its shops and people, and places to eat. I loved my cosy room, which was plenty big enough for me travelling alone, but if you want big and spacious, it isn't really that. Each night we would meet in the lobby, for drinks and snacks with Wayne, who was charming and urbane, and I could find out about things to do and see, by talking to him and also the other guests - it was a lovely way to be part of the hotel, instead of just disappearing into your room, as you do in most hotels. I would visit San Francisco again, just to stay in this hotel! All the staff were very friendly and helpful too, especially the ever smiling Tony!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: ABL2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights and could not fault it. The staff were extremely helpful right from arrival, the room was well presented and always thoroughly cleaned every day. One of the pleasing features was all the little extras above what you get in an average US hotel which would make us recommend it - good choice at breakfast, quality toiletries, free wine and hors d'oeuvres for the pre-evening out drink as well as free internet access (even if you don't have your own laptop - good for online check-in!) and tea/biscuits in the evening. Excellent location too, especially if like us, you intend to travel round using public transport. Would be first choice if going to SF again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: Raffles2
Reviews.Content: The hotel appears small, but our room was really spacious. It was kept clean and well stocked. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. All the amenities and complimentaries you would expect from a quality hotel. More than adequate Continental breakfast, tea, coffee, fruit always available. A nice extra is the complimentary cheese and wine in the evenings in the guest lobby of one of the floors. The hotel is ideally situated especially for my wife (very near to Macy's). If we revisit San Francisco we would stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Would not hesitate to stay here again”
Reviews.Author: annhopeSanfrancisco
Reviews.Content: The hotel was centrally situated with friendly helpful staff ,the complimentary breakfast was an added bonus.We stayed for three nights and each evening there was complimentary wine from 5.00pm to about 7,30pm this was hosted by the manager or a member of staff who were only too willing to reccomend restaurants etc in the vicinity .We met so many interesting people of all ages from all walks of life,many of them who stayed there on a regular basis when they visited San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: RotherDrummer
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel with friendly staff right in the heart of San Francisco. The only reason I voted 4 star overall is because it doesn't have a bar or restaurant, but obviously this isn't too much of a problem in San Francisco! Don't think twice about booking this hotel if you want nice accommodation in a great location

Reviews.Title: “It Was All About The Birthday Girls”
Reviews.Author: fizzgigg
Reviews.Content: My friends and I have our quarterly Girlfriends' Getaway and this getaway was special as it fell on our birthdays. The stay at the Inn was FANTASTIC--EXCEEDING OUR EXPECTATIONS!!! From the moment we walk in the door we were treated as though we were royalty. Joseph, Tony, Wayne Olson, Heidi, Omar, and our favorite, Josie, were very accommodating in providing not only great service, but recommendations on what to see, where to go, where to eat, etc. The nightly wine and cheese reception was a nice touch and very relaxing after a day of sightseeing and shopping. Wayne and Heidi made certain we had everything and spent time chatting with us about the sights of San Francisco. Tony and Josie were great and made certain we didn't want for anything. Joseph and Omar provided great tips on where to eat, shopping areas (not that we needed help on that one) and took the time to ask how our day went when we returned to the Inn. We stayed in the Penthouse and never bumped into each other as we each had plenty of room. The continental breakfast provided healthy choices and again, was so relaxing you hated to get up. We will definitely return to the Inn. Thank you all for making this one of our best weekend getaways!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at The Inn at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: SafeTravels02
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed an exceptionally large room (used to tiny hotel rooms in the city) with an abudantant array of extras like wine and cheese, bottled water, fancy bath products, newspaper, and continental breakfast. The room was decorated immaculately and the service was most helpful. The attendants with our bags and serving the wine and cheese were extremely pleasent. The location is top notch for shopping and a quick cab ride to most anywhere else. (We took a cab to North Beach for dinner). I highly recommend this hotel. I stay in probably 10 hotels a year and this one ranks as one of the best value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “The best things in life (and the Inn at Union Square) are free!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaKh0le
Reviews.Content: While the price isn't phenomenal, little extras made the big difference: FREE - In room Internet - chocolates, bottled water - evening wine and cheese - Aveda bath products - continental breakfast - newspaper We arrived after a long drive, hungry and road weary, and were so pleased to have valet take care of the car ($40 for 1 night btw), drop our bags in the room and chill out with complimentary wine and cheese. Many restaurants nearby; we chose Scala - pretty good! Woke up the next morning, read the complimentary paper and had a complimentary breakfast before heading out to the airport (only 30 minutes away). We will be coming back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet retreat - next to everything”
Reviews.Author: pbnjNewHampshire
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Inn at Union Square was perfect. An oasis just steps from Union Square and the city at your doorstep. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Rooms were spacious and very clean. Elegant decor with the feel of a grand hotel. All the extras included - free internet service , full breakfast, chocolate chip cookies, and drinks/snacks in the evening! The only downside was parking was via valet (or you could walk 2 blocks to a public lot) and you had to wait for your car but to be expected in most downtown areas.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Chanty1
Reviews.Content: We stayed there February 25th. Our first time and we definitely would return. Not a hotel for those who prefer the large chain, full service places. This is more like a small European hotel. Staff members were polite, friendly, knowledgeable and quick to address our needs. Rooms, while not large, are well appointed and VERY quiet. Both the gratis continental breakfast and evening wine/cheese events were perfect. Given that these are included in the room price, this hotel gives excellent value-for-money. The Inn is centrally located and that enabled us to walk easily to shopping areas, theaters and restaurants. The small alcoves at the ends of each floor, where both breakfast and wine/cheese are served are particularly nice because they encourage mingling among guests.

Reviews.Title: “Still Our Favourite SF Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Airstreamlover
Reviews.Content: Over the past five years, my husband and I have stayed at this inn whenever possible (ie are able to snag a good deal!). It is our hotel of choice because: - all staff, from desk manager to housekeeping ladies, are friendly and helpful - perfect location: right at Union Square. Saks and flagship Williams Sonoma in the next block - complementary continental breakfast is fresh and delicious (hard-boiled eggs, assorted breads and pastries, yogurt, cereals) - atmosphere is calm, intimate and elegant, without being toffee-nosed! - clean, relaxing rooms, decorated in golds and reds -- while downtown SF hotels are usually on the small size, have never felt cramped in this hotel's rooms - nice business room with one internet station & printer To the management and staff: we really appreciate staying at your lovely hotel, thanks and look forward to seeing you again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Boutique Hotel in a fab location”
Reviews.Author: Ed_S_2004
Reviews.Content: Location & service made this a great stay. Chocolate chip cookies and turn down service are a great way to be spoiled and a wondrfull Continental breakfast every morning was excellent. But there is no view, the rooms are tired and very much in need of repair. (We stayed in 2 rooms; 305 and 407, asked to be moved from 305 as it was rather small and the view is of a brick wall. 407 is larger and a very limited view). So, if it was not for the great deal on Expedia(the hotel could not even match it - $177.00 CDN per night as an average for 5 nights Fri - Tues) We would not be rating the hotel as high as we are(the rooms are just too much in need of minor repairs that are very very visual!). And would we stay there again - no! For their set rates - you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: soldierbot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this small boutique hotel recently and really enjoyed the experience. We enjoyed the room and took advantage of the breakfast spread in the mornings. The staff was very helpful, dinner reservations, transportation, etc. When heading back to SF... this will be my #1 choice.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this little gem”
Reviews.Author: WorcestershireAndy
Reviews.Content: We loved staying in this delighful liitle hotel in the heart of the city, close to all forms of public transport. The staff were welcoming, friendly and helpful. The rooms were comfortable and well furnished & we enjoyed the facility of taking breakfast trays back to the room. The wine & cheese provided in the evenings gave opportunities for chatting with fellow travellers if desired.We would certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: R_LOntario
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels that we have stayed at. The staff is very friendly and everybody works very hard to make sure that you have the best stay possible. The room isn't huge, but it is comfortable and decorated nicely. The hotel is surprisingly quiet for the the middle of the town. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is right in the center of town. It is close to the cable car lines and is a 15 min. ride to Fisherman's Wharf. The breakfast and wine happy hour are great. The only (very minor) criticism about this hotel is that the safe was on the top shelf of the closet. If you are shorter than 6' you might have get up on a chair to use it. If you like the big fancy hotels, this isn't the place for you. If you like small, comfortable lodgings with great service, you will like the Inn at Union Square.

Reviews.Title: “A great place!”
Reviews.Author: Mastistyle
Reviews.Content: Sorry I am just writig this-but I wanted to write a review about teh Inn. We stayed there for 3 nights in Nov 2008. It was an excellent find. We went to the wine country for a few days and then came in to the city. We hate big, chain hotels; so this was perfect. It is a GREAT location...we literaly walked across the street to catch the trolly or go shopping. We were a block away from the Chinatown gates... The staff was very professional and courteous; they helped with directions, suggested some great restaurants, and jazz clubs. They even helped my boyfriend with the 'proposal plan'! The rooms were well maintained. I noticed there were children staying in the hotel-but I never heard them. And the happy hour was a perfect way to start the evening. They had some great wines out! If you are looking for a W or Hyatt type of place-this isn't your route. But if a boutique type hotel is your style-this is a great find!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Wanttocitall
Reviews.Content: Cant say enough about this hotel. Excellent location, friendly staff who couldnt do enough for us. The rooms aren't massive but hey when you have a great city like San Fran at your door why would you want to stay in the room. Bed was super comfy! We got a great deal on hotels.com which basically gave us our third night for free so was excellent value. Only thing I would say is that as breakfast is on each floor we were in one of the rooms near the breakfast room so could hear them setting it up. On the plus side they serve wine and cheese in the same place in the evening so we were closest to that ;-) But this is all about location, 30min walk to Fisherman's whalf, shopping at the front door, and a tram stop in stumbling distance.

Reviews.Title: “A calm oasis in wild and crazy SF...”
Reviews.Author: kac2000
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a wedding and wanted to stay someplace quiet - which can be hard to do in the vicinity of Union Square. But we found this tiny (TINY) little oasis and were mostly delighted with the experience. It was blissfully quiet - amazing since we were staying there on Halloween and the night after (and Halloween in SF can be pretty wild). Sadly, our room had zero view - but it was worth it for the peace. While there is nothing grand about the place, it's elegant and charming, and the staff is first-rate. Keep in mind it has a blink-and-you-miss-it entrance; we drove around for a while looking for a GREEN awning as it said on its website, when it was actually dark red! Some relatively small issues: I had reserved a King bed well in advance, but when we arrived, we were told that due to construction, our room was no longer available, so we were put in a Queen, which turned out okay (and the cost was reduced). Also, our phone blinked continuously, even though we had no messages. No one could figure out why. Finally - and this one REALLY irked me: We paid about $36/day for the valet service (a real deal in Union Square, amazingly) and as they brought the car around after we checked out, we jumped in....only to find the front passenger seat SOAKING WET. It had rained heavily that weekend and apparently no one had bothered to ensure the windows were closed. We were also under the impression that the car would be in a covered structure! I complained (though not formally) and hoped for a partial refund of the parking fee, but none was forthcoming. It was a bad way to end what was essentially a delightful stay. Some advice: Be sure to check your windows are CLOSED TIGHT when you hand over the keys to the valet!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Always_on_holidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Inn for 5 nights in early November and had a great stay. As mentioned in previous reviews this is great hotel and I agree with all the positive comments. It isn't a large 5 star property, but great value for money. The breakfast and drinks at night are great. All staff are extremely friendly and go out the way to help you. There was some confusion when making our booking so we were promptly upgraded at no charge. I would highly recommend if you are looking for value for money (and happy not to stay in a large hotel) in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here if you like impersonal large cavernous hotel chains”
Reviews.Author: creining
Reviews.Content: The Inn is definitely one of the smallest hotels I have stayed in within the US within recent memory. You know, that can be good or bad. If you want to be anonymous it might be bad. I was in San Francisco on business, attending a conference at the Marriott but chose to stay here based on the reviews. The Marriott was a half mile walk, by the way. And the Marriott is a Marriott is a Marriott. Switching it up can be good. Check in went fine. They did not have my hotel website reservation in their system. After asking me if I had I confirmation, I showed them the reservation I had printed out and brought along from home. Not sure where the disconnect was, but this was a Monday and there were probably less than 10 rooms occupied. I don't know what they would have done if it was the weekend (they said they were going to be completely booked). The hotel is small. The lobby is small. The hallways are small. The room is small. The bathroom is small. The elevator is small and slow. But, the room is nicely appointed, clean and had a very large and really comfortable bed. When I first saw the shower I said "what?!?, you're kidding" as it is tiny by most standards. But, it got the job done and the water pressure could clean an elephant. The TV, a Dell flat-screen was nice and it didn't have that whole hotel interface crap on it, it was just a TV with channels like you have at home. Turn down service with water and chocolates was great! The touches that I really appreciated and don't find often if ever at a hotel: You see the same people working there all the time. They all ask how you are, if you need anything at all, and are super polite (from the front desk to the maids). Did I mention super polite? The wonderful and bountiful breakfast spread in the morning on each floor. I could smell the coffee wafting into my room from down the hall in the mornings. The fact they give you a real newspaper in the morning and not USA Today. The wine and hors d'oeuvres in the evening. The call you get from the front desk the night before checkout asking if you need a wake-up call or taxi. The cute little fireplace in the sitting room on each floor. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: red1hot
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Inn for 2 nights in November. Our room was clean and decorated very tastefully. The bed and pillows were super comfortable. The breakfast and afternoon wine/cheese was delicious and really fun. The staff held our bags when we arrived early and sent them to our room when it was ready. We had the opportunity to chat with some of the cleaning staff and they are wonderful.. most have been working for the Inn for 20 years -- I think that is probably unheard of that line of service. Totally recommend staying here and when we go back to San Fran - this is the only hotel that we will think about staying in.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BCMck
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn @ Union Sq in late October 2008 as part of our honeymoon. As per alot of other reviews we found the hotel to be excellent. The whole place is small and friendly completely unlike a big chain hotel. We had an issue with our room when we first checked in and this was quickly rectified by the staff and we were able to move immediately. The location is excellent right in the heart of everything and the food was brilliant, extensive breakfast options and wine and cheese each evening. Would definitely stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great 4 night stay”
Reviews.Author: suwasaba
Reviews.Content: I will not repeat the information in the previous review. All that was written is true. I traveled by myself for a conference at the Moscone Center. My husband joined me for the last nights stay before going to Sonoma. As a single women traveler, I felt very safe at this hotel. My room on the 4th floor was very quiet. I could not hear anyone above or next to us. I needed to hire a taxi one night. the front desk staff member actually came out to the street to get me one. Unfortunately, that night I lost my room key card, credit card and driver's license. The staff front desk man wrote down the names and phone #s of 7 top taxis without me asking. At least this made me feel as though I had some control in the situation. Sadly, I did not get my cards back. Luckily I traveled with my passport for the flight home. I would go back to this hotel anytime I am in San Fran again

Reviews.Title: “Highly rated”
Reviews.Author: padarus
Reviews.Content: I liked this place. I checked in very early at 8.00 am and they had no room. They asked me to come back in two hours and when my room was still not available, I was upgraded to a suite - which was also not ready but at least I was able to have a shower etc after a might on plane. I love the breakfast scheme - a nice buffet with a tray back to you room. Flat screen TV's etc and well appointed rooms. Excellent location and great value for money by US big city standards. Highly recommmended.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn At Union Square a Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maxlutes
Reviews.Content: My 6 night stay was a pleasant experience, the rooms were very clean and comfortable. The morning breakfast foods were always fresh and good as well as the complimentary wine and cheeses in the evening. The staff was very warm and friendly and willing to help if I had any questions. The "public" areas are quite small so they were not conducive to groups but for a single or couple it is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Top Marks”
Reviews.Author: franrow
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square, San Francisco. We have just returned home (Australia) following a month long trip in Canada and the US. San Francisco has been a favourite destination on previous visits and this time was no exception. Adding to our enjoyment of this stay was the choice of hotel (guided by reviews in Trip Advisor!). The Inn is in a handy location and is run very efficiently by courteous staff. While the rooms are small they are well equipped and very clean. A highlight for us was the Happy Hour held each night on Floors 3 & 5. Wine and snacks were provided by the hotel and it was an excellent opportunity to meet travellers from around the world. We have no hesitation in endorsing previous recommendations for this hotel and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “We Stayed here for 2 weeks... and loved every minute!”
Reviews.Author: GeoMills
Reviews.Content: My (brand new) Husband and I picked this hotel for whilst we were getting married in San Francisco. We had a lot of family members coming with us and wanted something in a central location to all of their hotels. And boy did we get more than that. We had just dropped off some of my relatives at other hotels just near by, and my parents (who stayed at The Inn with us) were a bit put off by the entrance way (Blink and you'll miss it!). But as soon as we got our keys and got to our rooms we knew we had made the right choice! Once we had finished unpacking I found my folks sitting at the end of the LONG hall way enjoying a glass of wine, some cheese (all complimentary) and chatting with some other residents... We found out loads sitting at that table over the next few days... the places to go and not to go, the best ways to get around... and by the time we were about to leave we found ourselves passing the knowledge on to other holiday makers When we left this place was ranked No. 2 on trip advisor.... It's now No.1. This is in no doubt, thanks to the staff, the locality, the hospitality and the price..... if you want a huge lobby and get charged extra for walking through some grand entrance... go for it.... if you want to feel as though you could pick your hotel up and give it a hug... The Inn at Union Square is for you! The night of our wedding we returned to our room to find a bottle of Champagne, some Truffles and the most beautifully worded personal letter from the hotel, whishing us happiness in our marriage. Inn at Union Square ***High Five*** you totally deserve the No 1 Slot for hotels in San Francisco! We will be back! Georgina, Stewart and Lucie (room 306)

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable value”
Reviews.Author: pgwill
Reviews.Content: If you had a check list for a city centre hotel it would include (as essentials) a convenient location in a good part of town, comfort and a reasonably quiet room. The list might include ( as desirable) a decent breakfast and wine/snacks in the evening, all complimentary. You would expect to pay a high price for all af this. The Inn at Union Square deserves it's current number one rating on Trip Advisor because it delivers all these things at a price which is remarkable value for a major business and tourist city like San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great location.”
Reviews.Author: chimark
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely as advertised. pros: it's right in union square: right near BART, muni, the F line, the cable cars, major shopping is right in this area. the room was neat. They had all the original windows, a nice swivel TV, a nice sized bathroom, AVEDA products, shelving and counter space in the bathroom and main room, a ceiling fan and a comfortable bed down the hallway was a wine happy hour, and free breakfast in a quaint little setting. this place doesn't have 400 or 500 rooms, it has a much smaller amount and their attention to you as a customer paying for a service is apparent. great and easy check-in/out experience with the front desk personel. cons: the room was a bit small; however you won't find a lot of huge rooms when you're staying at boutique type places, especially in a downtown area like this. no vending machines, but walgreens is a short walk away and open late

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in SF”
Reviews.Author: oski99
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel. We stayed for a convention at Moscone Ctr - a very nice 3-4 bloc walk past the glitz and glam of Union Square. You catch the cable cars on the corner - either the Powell/Mason line or the Powell/Hyde line, and up the hill is the California line. We stayed with a 12 month baby - room was big enough for us, a crib, his stroller, a carseat, no sweat. The room backed up to a brick wall, so was easily pitch black with blackout curtains in the middle of the day - couldn't ask for better naptime. Breakfast, to include assorted pastries/bagels/croissants/cereal/yogurt/coffee/juice, every morning, and wine (chardonnay/merlot/cab sauv), cheese, grapes, dried fruit every night. Served at common areas on certain floors, was a great way to meet and talk with others on the floor. Reminded me of a small hotel in Paris in the 14th Ar. but in SF. Easily walkable to Powell BART to get to airport or elsewhere. A 7 day passport, $24, paid for itself with $5 cable car rides on nearly a daily basis. Tons of great restaurants within a 3 block radius. Would stay again in a heartbeat. Love the city, now have a great place to stay in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Cozy Spot - Ideal location for Sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: trouttrooper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a cozy intimate hotel with a central location for sightseeing. Both of us travel extensively for business and understood that this hotel would be less extravagant than many corporate hotel selections. The Inn delivered exactly what we'd expected and more. It is in a great location for walking, it is very small and definitely a historic “inn” like atmosphere versus the cookie cutter big hotel chains. The staff was helpful and most accommodating to all our requests. There was a young lady at the front desk with less experience during the day; however, she did here best to retrieve information when her experience limited her. The breakfast and wine & cheese are relatively simple but do the trick - we weren't expecting to get a lavish spread at the hotel based on the room rate. The breakfast is definitely enough to get you started for the day and the wine & cheese was a nice break before we headed out for a late dinner. You have the choice of sitting in a small reception area on each floor our their are trays to take your breakfast to your room. The rooms are relatively small and quaint - the cleanliness was very good, a little wear and tear on the carpets but the rest of the room was impeccable. We're both regular exercise fanatics and the hotel does provide vouchers for $15 at a near by health club that is excellent. Don't expect much information for running/walking; you'll need to figure it out on your own. Great Value, Great Spot, would highly recommend for couples - a little close quarters for kids I think.

Reviews.Title: “So wonderful hotel! What an incredible experience!”
Reviews.Author: majsis83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from Sweden and we made a roadtrip by the west coast the summer of 2008. Unfortunately the weather was not too good, but this hotel made our experience absolutely great!! It must be the best hotel we've ever stayed at! First of all the location is great. It is absolutely close to everything!! close to shopping, to restaurants, etc. The location couldn't be better! When we first arrived to the hotel we met an awesome guy in the reception, so relaxed and helpful. He upgraded our deluxeroom to a suite. And he asked if this was ok, ok?!! Of course it was ok, more than ok! Every morning we met this guy (unfort. we cannot recall his name) or another guy (who's name we don't remember either). They were really friendly!! The breakfest at the hotel was great, the best breakfeast we've ever tasted. The wine tastening in the afternoons were great!! And the chocolate and water bottles that were delivered to the room in the afternoon were superb! This hotel had all these extra small things that makes a stay so wonderful! It was a fantastic experience! Today I recommended the hotel to a college, who will be travelling to SF in may next year. I told her, she will not be dissapointed!! If I go back to SF, I will definitely stay at the Inn at Union Square again! Fabolous! Thanks guys for giving us some splendid days in one of the worlds nicest towns!

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything”
Reviews.Author: beatricepugzilla
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from a Tuesday to a Friday based on the reviews I read here. Usually stay in a Kimpton or the W and thought I would try a different route. Sure am glad I did - everything from the staff to the rooms was top notch. Walked everywhere I needed to go including my SF office about 3/4 mile away. Although the one time I did need a cab it was easy to flag. All the extras plus the staff make this place so great. How I missed that the hotel was not air conditioned - I have no idea - but I am glad I missed it since it would have kept me from staying. Now that I have been, I did not even miss the AC - an open window is all that was needed. Migh be a little warm during the summer though. Would I say here again? Without a doubt. i have also recommended the place to one of managers who will be moving from the W to this place!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: PainterGuy_8
Reviews.Content: We were part of our small law firm's "retreat" in San Francisco (spouses included) - about 12 people in our group. Before we got there I thought it may be a little pricey, however by the time we add in the extras provided (continental breakfast on each floor's lobby and afternoon wine and cheese again on each floor), the value truly begins to show. Oh - also chocolate chip cookies late at night on each floor as well. Much more touring and shopping time for us without having to go out to buy breakfast first. The rooms are smallish however very European in feel - and very luxurious - first class furnishings. The location couldn't be better either. All the Union Square attractions are within a five minute walk, the cable car line is only a half block away and we found the pleasant walk down Market Street to the Ferry Terminal only took about a half hour. Very excellent restaurants are everywhere near this hotel - one on either side as it happens. The staff at the hotel treated us very well - I felt completely pampered and secure. They also knew what was happening in town, where it was and how to get there. We had pre-booked all our dining engagements so didn't have an opportunity to test the staff but we're pretty sure they wouldn't have had any problems keeping us happy. I admit I'm a bit of a cheapskate when it comes to vacations but my wife and I would return here in a minute (and on my dime!) - huge bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: PeanutButter67
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our first trip to San Francisco and we enjoyed our time at the Inn at Union Square. We found the Inn from our research on TripAdvisor so we knew it would be a small hotel, but our room was still a bit smaller than we expected. It worked fine as a home base for our sightseeing though. Our room was at the end of the hall where the breakfast was served, but since we were coming from the east coast we were always awake before we heard them setting up around 7:00. The gathering area on our floor was a neat way to exchange experiences with other guests. It was fun to compare notes at the end of the day over a cup of hot tea or glass of wine. The lack of air conditioning led to one of our pleasant experiences while in the room. We would open the door on occasion to get the breeze from the hall to cool the room down. One evening a staff member passed by and commented on the nice, cool breeze with the windows open and then came back with several extra bottles of water for us. Omar always seemed to be at the front desk when we passed by and was always friendly and helpful. Overall - nice, clean hotel in a great location. Friendly staff that was happy to help out. I can't really compare to the other hotels in the area (although we did walk through the Fairmont, but if you are staying there you probably aren't worried about TripAdvisor). I would definitely recommend giving the Inn at Union Square a look if you are heading to San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: Samantha304
Reviews.Content: It's not hard to miss the little awning and doors to the Inn, my hubby and I did quite a few times! But the hotel itself is just gorgeous and comfortable. The staff are very helpful and wonderful. We had a few slight problems upon our arrival with our phone and safe, but they were promptly taken care of. David, one of the front desk folks, was super nice. He helped us get tickets to a nearby show, and gave us directions to the many things we places we had asked about. He even ran into me on the streets and asked how our show was and how we were doing. We had wine and cheese provided every evening, the breakfasts were wonderful. My husband and I both do not have a single bad thing to say of the Inn at Union Square. And I might note, a perfect location, so close to Union Square and all the city sites, everything we wanted to see (Fishermans Wharf, Chinatown, etc.) was all in walking distance, and amazingly quiet. I had worried, coming from a smaller city and country setting, that the city noise would keep me up, but it wasn't a bother at all. We totally recommend this hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Treasure”
Reviews.Author: RogJulie
Reviews.Content: With a parked truck blocking the way, I missed the very small entrance the first time around the block. The "lobby" was surprisingly small, compared to what I expected. But -- once inside the hotel, what a treat! The exceedingly kind staff at the front desk (one person on duty at a time) went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable, beginning with a complimentary upgrade to a suite. The rooms were spotless and ample in size. A jacuzzi, shower and place for me to shave was in an adjoining bathroom. Another powder room allowed my wife to make up separately without having the steam from my shower frizzle her hair. There was a TV in the bedroom and another in the sitting room, which also had a separate toilet. Complimentary continental breakfast each morning, plus complimentary wine, cheese and crackers each evening, served in a small "lobby" at the end of several of the 6 floors. I had not brought my laptop, so could not make use of the Internet connection in our room, but the hotel provided a private "business" room on the second floor which sported a PC with Internet connection plus a printer. The maids and other staff were also very friendly -- we truly want to return to this gem -- which is only a few steps from Union Square and just around the corner from where we turned in our rental car (having travelled from another city).

Reviews.Title: “Cool nights”
