Reviews.Author: TravelChicksChicago
Reviews.Content: Great location. Very convenient to China Town. Shopping is abundant and within easy walking distance. Locals will give great dining ops and some of the best in Chinba Town are not the fanciest. Rooms are a good size with comfy beds. Breakfast is a plus to start the day. Coffee is complimentary. Really did not need a car as location was good for walking and finding transportation as well as being so centrally located. I would stay here again and are planning a trip in the Fall. I was surprised how cool the nights were in June.Very chilly and I packed mostly summer type clothes. I imagine a Fall trip will require a coat. Love the area!

Reviews.Title: “Really, Really Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: DenverBookemDano
Reviews.Content: We could have gone anywhere in the world to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary and a second honeymoon, but we chose to stay at the Inn. This was also our second time staying here, and we are planning on a third. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Carmen, our maid called us by name when she saw us and all of the staff went of their way to make us feel comfortable and at home. Tony, the house man brought us chocolates and bottled water each night and was very courteous. We remembered him from our previous stay two years ago, and I think that says a lot when employees stick around. The location is great with fun bars in the neighborhood. We took the Bart in from the airport and walked up from Powell St. Station, which I would reccommend to anyone in halfway decent shape (as I am). Also its within walking distance to to China Town for inexpensive lunches and overall its just a very romantic place.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: LVBCapeTown
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 6 nights and were really delighted with the experience. The rooms were lovely, good size and quiet. The breakfast was good and well presented each morning (the coffee could be improved). We enjoyed the cheese and wine each evening, what a great idea and gets the guests talking to each other. The only things I would like to see an improvement on are the cleaning of the rooms, which wasn't bad but I've seen better and the coffee which wasn't very good. But everything else, including the complimentary bottled water and the chocolates every night was great. I would definitely stay here again, it's in a great area with easy access to transport and lots of good shops. You won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Syd2008
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location for convenience to shopping and San Fran sights. My room was a great size with a sitting area, large LCD and comfy bed. Room was clean too and great evening turn down service with chocs and water. Friendly helpful staff. Def recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DavidkW
Reviews.Content: What a find. A warm welcome to an extremely well located hotel just a minutes wald from the main shopping area at union square. We stayed here twice on our holiday, once for 3 nights of sightseeing and once for 1 night on the way back from Yosemite. Both times we were upgraded. The rooms were fantasic and individual. Very quiet. The breakfast was excellent and the evening wine and cheese was a treat. Also free internet and newspapers. The staff went out of their way to be helpful and meet all of our needs. Overall a very individual hotel that you should strongly consider. NB. Expedia seems to be doing a 3 nights for price of 2 offer!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Inn”
Reviews.Author: travellingProfsr
Reviews.Content: The big decision - Fishermans Wharf or Union Square - We choose Union Square and happy I did. First, the location is central to everything and the Inn was fantastic. The rooms were small but elegant (all windows face a brick wall though), There is a continental breakfast each morning and a wine/cheese reception each afternoon (5:30-7:00), the staff is knowledgable, helpful and San Francisco is a great city. Try to book shuttles to/from the Airport, taxis are expensive. Be sure to book in advance and early morning trip to Alcatraz, buy a munipass for unlimited cable, trolley and bus service since there are lots of hills in town, go to fishermans wharf: see the sea lions at pier 39, eat Ghiardellis ice cream at Ghiardellis Sq, take the #71 bus to Haight-Ashbury and on to the Pacific Ocean, Check out the Golden Gate Bridge, Chinatown and on. Coming from NY, the thing that struck me as most odd was the large number of street people millling about. They really didn't present a threat, just noticable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Inn”
Reviews.Author: davecap
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the hotel two years in a row now based on my parents' recommendations. The hotel location right on Union Square cannot be beat -you have plenty of nearby shops, for when you may have forgotten something, or just want to splurge in the fancier Union Square stores like Macy's. There are also plenty of restaurants, from little independent coffee shops, sandwich stores, to beautiful restaurants, Michael Mina and Postrio. Try Scala on Powell - moderately priced Italian, but very busy. We have stayed in the two-room suites, which for their price are very reasonable. The separate sitting-room is nice as one of us could stay up if the other wanted to rest. We travelled with our toddler whom we could put to bed early in the back bedroom. The room amenities are nice, but not overly done - nice marble and tile baths, not Four Seasons, but you're not paying for the Four Seasons either. The Inn offers a nice continental breakfast, which includes cold cereals, pastries, bagels, etc, and complimentary wine in the evening, white or red, and some cheese and crackers. This was a nice touch after walking around all day, and then you could head off to whatever restaurant you wanted. We are already talking about our trip next year, which will definitely include the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis in the busy city”
Reviews.Author: Corva_Aurelia
Reviews.Content: I thouroughly enjoyed my time spend at the Inn at Union Square. Despite being in the middle of it all -- and it *is* really in the middle of it all, it's a great location -- the hotel was never noisy, always quiet, always private. The hotel was very tastefully decorated as well as being extremely comfortable. I slept well the nights I spent here. It was very clean as well. I can't speak to the evening spreads because we were always out sightseeing, but the morning breakfasts were wonderful. Coffee, tea, oj, milk, granola, yogurt, hardboiled eggs, a variety of pastries, and more. The staff were very helpful. The interactions with them were always a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: resomannt
Reviews.Content: Inn at Union Square is simply excellent. All aspects well above average - staff, room, facitlies. The continental breakfast, newspaper, and the evening wine-tasting are really special touches that make a visit. The location is perfect - right on Union Square with access to the main shopping area and access to superb public transport to the rest of the city. Cannot recomend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Delight”
Reviews.Author: Munroe110
Reviews.Content: We were an extended family of 6 occupying 4 rooms at the Inn from Friday 25 to Monday 28 July. Everyone of us commented on how happy we were at the Inn. The location is absolutely supurb...step out the door and you are in Union Square, with the cable cars and taxi stand just around the corner, the sightseeing bus across the Square outside Macy's, and regular bus lines a block away. The real treat though was the level of care we received at the Inn. From check-in to check-out, every staff member was friendly, professional and unfailingly helpful. We really enjoyed the breakfasts and most particularly enjoyed the wine and cheese evenings, where we met some wonderful guests from throughout the USA and the world. This is not a hotel - it is much more personal than that - so do be aware that the halls are narrower than average, the elevator is on the slow side and there are a few minor maintenance issues that could be attended to, but for us this only added to the Inn's charm. Every need is catered for, from bathrobes to umbrellas! Without a doubt we will be recommending the Inn to all our friends and family and will be staying there again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic staff, great location, lovely room”
Reviews.Author: NatureLoverSheffield
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel as a place to stay, it has really friendly, welcoming and knowledgable staff, is situated in a lovely part of San Fransisco and the room we had was perfect - clean, large and very comfortable - I loved the bathrobes ! We arrived from the UK having been travelling for most of the day and it was great to get such a warm welcome from David at the front desk. Registration was carried out very efficiently and we were impressed with the spacious, clean and welcoming room we were given. We asked David for advice on where to eat and he gave us four recommendations, all of which we tried over the following couple of days - Max, Scampos (I think the name was) , Four Seas and Finos. The breakfast buffet was really good with a choice of cereal, croissants, bagels, pastries, yogurt, fruit etc. All of the staff were very friendly and more than willing to give us a hand with our luggage and order and hail taxi's for us The hotel is ideally situated in San Fransisco within walking distances of public transport and near some great shops. When we mentioned to one of the other staff that we were going to Macy's he gave us a 10% off voucher that proved very useful. If we ever come to San Fransisco again we would definately stay here and I have no problems recommending this hotel

Reviews.Title: “stay here and be happy--The INN”
Reviews.Author: captainlate
Reviews.Content: A gem. This wonderful hotel is tucked away near Union Square and is a stylish, friendly place. You don't need a huge entrance hall to have a great hotel. Friendly, helpful staff..from the front desk to the person who sets up the wine reception on the third and fifth floors; the breakfast on the same floors (continental), which is much better than any other big name hotel offering you a continental breakfast. The rooms are clean and well apportioned. Flat screen Dell tvs, and Aveda bath products. No view on this trip...well, it was an adjacent brick building, but that is to be expected in a big city, I think. We will return...we actually tried to get a room three days later but it was already sold out! Stay here if you can! Probably not a place for kids but great for business or a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further”
Reviews.Author: RowallanRd
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. After a first cramped, expensive night nearby we happened upon it by chance. Omar, at reception, was quick to show us a room, re-arrange some other rooms and we saved over $80 per night AND got breakfast, wine tasting with canapes, free internet (fast), newspapers AND a much bigger room for under $200 inclusive. Every morning there was a super selection to help yourself to for a continental breakfast and at night there was wine, cheese, soft drinks and fruit to enjoy while discussing your experiences of the day with other guests. The rooms were excellently appointed. There were robes, flat-screen tv and printing facilities available for those all-important flight ticket check-ins. Only 30 seconds from Union Square and the cable cars but miles away from the big, anonymous hotels that charge double. You will NOT be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique experience!!”
Reviews.Author: dkaplan38
Reviews.Content: Tucked away in the heart of San Francisco's Union Square is this fantastic inn. Everything from the bathrobes to the friendly service and the wine and cheese to the great breakfast. It was well worth the stay in this charming and cozy inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel & staff”
Reviews.Author: snickers1florida
Reviews.Content: Couldn"t ask for a nicer hotel to stay at. Besides being in a great location, the hotel itself was so much nicer than I expected.The staff catered to our every whim. There was an expanded continental breakfast, wine & cheese every night, even baked cookies at 8:30 in the evening. This small 30 room hotel has really outdid itself in personal service.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel...but...”
Reviews.Author: Edm.traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over the July 4th weekend. The hotel has a fabulous location, great staff and service. They offered wonderful features like an evening wine & cheese hour and a great continental breakfast. We booked our room using Expedia, which makes me wonder if this had any affect on the location of our room assignment. We were located right beside the breakfast reception area. The noise from staff setting up the breakfast each morning distrubed our sleep. We were woke up at 6:45 a.m. to the sounds of clanging dishes and other usual kitchen noises. We also heard other guests enjoying their breakfast all morning long, as we tried to catch a few more moments of sleep. We did request a room change, but the hotel was fully occupied. But all this said - we would stay at this hotel again. I would just request a room towards the back of the hotel, to ensure a quieter morning.

Reviews.Title: “A treasure in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: debc58
Reviews.Content: While traveling to Napa and Sonoma Valley we stayed on either end of our trip here. What a great little boutique hotel at Union Square. From the minute we arrived, the front desk was nothing but cordial and helpful. The rooms were nicely decorated, clean, quiet, and comfortable. The evening wine and cheese was fun because we had such great conversation with other guests including a couple from New Zealand. The late evening cookies and tea were a nice touch before we went to bed after dinner on the town. The morning breakfast of pastries, croissants, yogurts and various breads to toast was filling. The coffee was outstanding and kept us going for the morning. We highly recommend this little gem to all who are traveling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Inn at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: VarsandPete
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week in May and loved the place. We normally stay in the bigger, more anonymous type of hotels and were a bit sceptical about staying in such a small hotel but it was wonderful. Staff - Ken was fabulous and seemed to work a lot of hours - he was great in restaurant and bar recommendations and was really friendly and helpful with everything. The maids and room service staff were also really worthy of a mention. Each night the rooms were turned down, chocolates and bottles of water left for us too. Rooms - Modern, spacious rooms with very comfortable beds, nice seating area, desk and large LCD TV. Bathroom was quite small but the shower although looked quite old was a brilliant powerful shower. Loved the robes that were left for us, a nice touch that you normally only get if staying in superior class rooms in the bigger hotels. Only downside about the hotel was the lack of air conditioning in the rooms as it was over 100 degrees when we were there so it was a bit on the hot side. Extras - As you'll have seen mentioned numerous times, the wine & cheese put out each evening was brilliant - not just your cheap plonk either, quality wines with an assortment of soft and hard cheeses, crackers, grapes and soft drinks too. This together with the brilliant breakfasts and the cookies at bedtime were fantastic little extras. Also free wireless internet in the rooms was a bonus. Location - First class - 1 minutes walk from Union Square, 1 minutes walk from the tram line and about 5 mins walk from the modern shopping centre. Little recommendations - if you want to treat yourselves to a nice place for a drink, head down one block to the Clift Hotel. Amazing place for a couple of drinks and a nice relaxing evening. Best trip we did is the Fire Engine tour - go aboard an open top big red fire engine and cross the Golden Gate Bridge - it's brilliant fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: LaaaasVegas
Reviews.Content: I went to San Francisco in June on business and since I book short notice all the chain hotels were really expensive. I searched for boutique hotels and found The Inn at Union Square with a great rate less than half of the big guys. Being a little wary of unknown hotels I always rely on Trip Advisor to help me make decisions and this time was no exception. The reviews were all fantastic and for good reason. This is a really nice hotel with great staff. It's a little old but that adds to the charm especially in San Francisco. You can hear the cable car bells running down Powell Street which you are literally only steps from. I couldn't believe how close it is to Union Square. You are also only a few blocks from Nob Hill and China Town (five minute walk). Bed was comfortable, there is a business center, wine and cheese every evening and a decent continental breakfast with real pastries every morning (not the Courtyard buffet junk - if you are a frquent traveler you know what I mean). Turndown service is a nice touch too. The staff were all very friendly and David at the front desk was really helpful in helping me select a restaurant. Parking is a little step if you vallet but the Union Square garage is only a block away. They are located right next to the JW Marriot and across the street from the Westin St. Francis and I just smiled to myself that I was staying in this great little hotel, enjoying the same location and paying less than half the price of those guys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Incredible Amenities”
Reviews.Author: TravelbugMississippi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited San Fran for five nights in early June with my in-laws. I was appointed "hotel finder." After reading countless positive reviews and finding an outstanding rate for this hotel on their website, I confidently booked two rooms. Our stay was perfect in every way, and I won't go into all the details because the amenities are described in almost every review here, but please know that we all agreed this was one of our all time favorite places to stay. Right off the trolley line and union square, breakfast and snacks included, ROBES in the room, friendly & helpful staff, and extremely comfortable rooms. I read on a few reviews about the rooms being small, but I have to disagree with this. We stayed in a regular king, and there was more than enough room. A side table with two chairs on one side, and a desk/vanity on the other side. The bathroom is a good size, not massive, but I have stayed in places with much smaller. No AC, but had a ceiling fan and opened our window. Our view was a brick wall, but we didn't mind because our room was quiet as can be. I love staying at hotels, it is always a thrill for me, and I have stayed in a lot of hotels. This place goes on the top of my list, seriously. I'm sure you could stay at a very fancy/expensive hotel and love it, but why not spend the bulk of your money on meals, shows and shopping? This place has incredible value, without short changing you on amenities or comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Inn at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: cshenkenberg
Reviews.Content: We found the Inn at Union Square in San Francisco very charming, a small scale hotel with lots of service and suggestions from the very friendly front desk concierges. The rooms were small, but very comfortable and clean and provided well with a nice size flat screen TV and other usual expected hotel equipment. The only snag I experienced there was that my phone was not working initially and after being serviced, I never received the hand-set, but got by using speaker phone. Loved the extensive complementary breakfast set ups in the kitchen/sitting areas at the end of each floor, and the wine and cheese presentation from 5:30 p.m. until 7:00 p.m. was a nice way to get to know other hotel occupants and experience some good wine and snacks--a little briefing to what we experienced on the second leg of our trip, Napa and Sonoma Valley for wine tasting! Great suggestions from the front desk personnel on places to go, eat and see. The hotel is so centrally located, we were within walking distance to most attractions: Fisherman's Wharf, San Francisco Center Shopping Mall, Chinatown, and great restaurants with diverse ethnic cuisines. We walked around the corner from the hotel one night to take in some good blues at a club called Biscuits and Blues. The last night of our stay, we took a short walk to a lovely French restaurant called Cafe Claude. It was the favorite of our stay in San Francisco--cozy French ambiance with an especially informative wine educator, who gave a lengthy list of suggestions for our visit to Napa. My highest compliments go out to Inn at Union Square and I would enjoy another stay there unquestionably.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific - Inn at Union Sq. SF”
Reviews.Author: TrixieGirlBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: This is a great little inn with a fantastic wine & cheese hour and great continental breakfast. We stayed at the Westin St. Francis (right across the street) the next night and I wish we would have stayed at the Inn at Union Sq. both nights. Not only a much more charming experience, but also a better value. Great rooms and very comfortable beds.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful introduction to quintessential San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: TravelEcho
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with the Inn at Union Square. We arrived at midnight and were greeted by a very friendly front desk clerk. We went up to our room and were initially a little disappointed with our room. The view was of a brick wall and noisy from the adjoining hotel's outside air conditioning unit. Even though it was late, the front desk clerk upgraded us to a room that was quieter. We were especially impressed with the free charming continental breakfasts, and freshly baked chocolate chip cookies in the evening. Great location. Great value. We hope to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “small hotel but big on service”
Reviews.Author: katieseanmom
Reviews.Content: The moment we arrived we were made to feel welcomed by the friendly staff. The room was clean except for the carpet which had some staining. The bedding was luxurious and our suite had two flat screen tvs. In the afternoon we were treated to wine and cheese in a small sitting area right outside our room. The morning continental breakfast was wonderful and again served in the sitting room. The location was great for getting around San Francisco. We could hear the cable car bell clanging from our room. We opted for the self parking which was about a block away as the valet parking was $40 a day compared to the $25 fee for self parking. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone. It is small in size but big on service and friendliness.

Reviews.Title: “Little Extras Add Up To Big Value!”
Reviews.Author: GailfromABQ
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a long weekend at the Inn at Union Square. What a wonderful place! We booked a queen room, but got a small suite at the front of the hotel - the bed was a little smaller, but it had a separate sitting room with a sofa, chair and desk and a second plasma flat screen tv. But the great thing about this inn is the extras, which are offered free of charge. First, breakfast is served each morning until 10 or so on each floor on the third and fifth floors parlours. The quality is good, with fresh high quality pastries and coffee as well as cereal, boiled eggs, bagels, cheese, fruit, tea, etc. It is served on china and cloth napkins with nice breakfast trays to take back to your room and small tables to eat in the parlour. Also, there are fresh apples and cookies in each parlour all day long. At 5 or so, they set out multiple bottles of wine with really good cheese and fruit and stemware and napkins again and welcome you to a drink before you go out to dinner. There are also other cold drinks set out. All free of charge. There is wireless internet available free of charge, as well as a small business center. At night, the maid leaves bottled water and chocolate. At the end of the weekend, we had not a single incidental charge. The staff is young and enthusiastic and they are genuinely helpful. Be warned - this is an inn more than a hotel - it is narrow and the hallways are narrow as well. The elevator is small and there is no grand lobby, just a number of small parlours. But the rooms are tastefully done with good linens and the furniture and tvs are of good quality. There is no noise from room to room, and our room was right outside the parlour where folks on our floor had breakfast. There is some noise from the street - it is 500 feet off Powell and those streetcars do make noise, so if you really like it quiet, get a room in back. The rooms in front offer a nice view to compensate for the noise. In the last five years, we have stayed at the St. Francis (fancy, but not great service), the Fairmont (grand old gem, but so big), the Villa Forence (really nice boutique hotel), the Hotel Griffon (great location, unfriendly staff) and the Holiday Inn Gateway (utilitarian, no frills). This was by far my favorite. It is for those who like privacy and value. If you want a grand lobby, you will have to cross the street to the St. Francis. But they won't give you all the food and extras and they will charge you more.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: Mauibaby507
Reviews.Content: This is a good deal for the money. I have stayed here twice. The first time I booked the least expensive room. It was hard to even move around in it. This time I paid $25 per day more and I got a spacious room. The decor is a bit outdated but the rooms are nicely done. My only complaint about the room is the bathroom, which has no counter space at all. I had to leave my toiletries in the bedroom... but the amenities can't be beat. They have a seating area where they provide a continental breakfast in the morning with cereal, yogurt, fruit, bagels, cream cheese, muffins, coffee, etc. In the afternoon they serve wine with cheese, dried fruit, crackers and grapes. They also do an afternoon turn down service. All this and they are less than a block from Union Square!

Reviews.Title: “Union Square Grace”
Reviews.Author: Wren10
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square is a charming small hotel. The location is terrific and the service is friendly and efficient. The rooms are quiet, fresh, and well appointed. There's ample closet and drawer space. The beds are comfortable and the bathrooms are sparkling. An added bonus is the complimentary wine and cheese offered each evening in the small sitting areas (with fireplaces) by the big windows at the end of each floor. The complimentary breakfast buffet is excellent. There is a quiet grace and elegance about this hotel. We can't imagine staying anywhere else in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Getaway”
Reviews.Author: webwahine
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a small boutique hotel just a few stores down from Union Square. The location is ideal. It's a short walk to the BART and a half block from the cable car stop. The entrance and lobby are small but adequate. Most rooms do not have a 'view' of the main street but that keeps the rooms very quiet since there is no street noise. The rooms are small, cozy and well appointed. The flat panel in the room was large and new. The beds are comfortable and have multiple down pillows. Bottled water is complimentary in the room and the continental breakfast has a good selection of pastries, granola, yogurt, etc. The wine and cheese is also served on the landings of specific floors. It makes for a nice get together with other hotel guests. I've been to San Francisco many times and lived there and have to say that this is one of the best experiences I've had for a very reasonable price. The staff is very friendly, polite and helpful. They seem to really enjoy working with people. Note...Would try and request a room away from the elevators. They seem like they would be a bit quieter.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy hideaway in the heart of San Fran and a super great value!”
Reviews.Author: Memphisfamily
Reviews.Content: Our family of 2 parents and our 13-yr old stayed at this 7-story hotel for a few nights in early March 2008. A wonderful location, just steps away from everything including Union Square, theaters, the best restaurants, the trolley, and all the fun shops and stores. The hotel is early 1900's but has been renovated from top to bottom and is very charming and very clean. We were going on a driving trip, so we got our car at the airport and self-parked it a block away from the Inn during the time we were there and used the trolley everywhere. The parking lot is cheaper than the hotel's valet service by $20- they can tell you the exact location. If you use the valet service, it's about $41 or so with in and out service, but you have to wait. The rooms are very clean, our master bed was pretty good, not great (the rollaway our child slept on was lumpy and thin unfortunately). The linens were very good quality. Bathrooms small but what you'd expect for a downtown hotel. I really liked the complimentary toiletries - a rosemary and mint fragrance that is so San Francisco! The rooms are smallish for 3 but we made do without a problem - for 2 it would be perfect. The view is non-existent - looks out on another building nearby, but here's the nice part: sheers cover the window so you don't see the building and light comes in, and because it does not face the street, the room is extremely quiet and great for a good night's sleep. We opened the window, which I like more than those sealed up skyscraper hotels, and kept the ceiling fan on. We did not use the heat because we were comfortable with a cool room. There is no A/C so not sure what it would be like in the summer. If you want a bigger room that looks out on Post street below, get a suite. They have a pull-out sofa bed with queen bed and cost a little more. In the mornings, an elaborate continental breakfast is set out in the fireplace keeping room at the end of each floor's lobby. Everything from freshly boiled eggs to sourdough toast, cheeses, bagels & cream cheese, sweet rolls, fruit, fresh juices, fresh coffee and tea and more. In the evening, a lovely assortment of cheeses, crackers and wines await you after a day of sightseeing. It's all self-serve, very private and so much better quality than one would expect. The hotel reception was very friendly, although the lobby is small. We liked that about it and felt it was quaint. During our stay we needed a few things and the young men in reception took care of it promptly. We will definitely stay there again. This place is a little jewel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: mentorohio
Reviews.Content: Stayed March 5-9, 2008. This hotel was in a great location on Union Square. This is a Boutique hotel, with about 5 or 6 rooms on each floor. The lobby is functional, you wouldn't hang out there.I don't think you can get a room with a view. All rooms are on the same side of the hotel and overlook HVAC systems. No problem, just keep the sheers closed and you won't see it. We were in room 605 which had a bedroom with a king bed with a living room and woodburning fireplace(didn't need or have time for it). Bathroom had a whirlpool tub and separate shower(great water pressure). Bathrom was small, but didn't matter because there was a separate dressing room with a sink and long counter top so I could dry my hair and put on makeup with PLENTY of room. After 2 days, we realized there was another small powder room off the living area. The room had a fridge, and water was left each day. Bed was comfortable and the room was fine, maybe 3 1/2 stars. We went to the Top of the Mark, and the elevator stopped on one of the floors there--the halls were no nicer than the Inn at Union Square There is a continental breakfast from 7-10 with great croissants, cinnamon rolls, fruit, cereal and I think yogurt, as well as juice, milk, coffee and tea. Breakfast was on floor 3 and 5. No big deal that we had to go down a floor to get it--they had trays if you wanted to bring it to your room. Wine and cheese were available on the same floors from 5:30-7 I think, as well as various sodas. All was very nice. My only complaint was that the glasses weren't very clean--lipstick smudges were still on them. Had to hunt for one that was really clean. Same for the morning juice glasses. Close to many restaurants, and not far from the Powell/Market cable car. There is a Hertz car rental across the street which was very convenient for our rental to go up to Napa. I would stay again-it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis of Cozy Warmth in Winter...”
Reviews.Author: CutePumpkin
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in this cozy oasis!! It is our favorite place to stay in San Francisco. Comparing to the Nikko and Parc 55. It was hospitably and spiritually a pleasant place to stay with everything right outside the door. Those larger hotels where your name comes up on the display doesn't mean that the concierge can put a face to your name!!! We liked the smaller, friendlier, more personable luxury of this cozy inn. Everything was in walking distance: the square, financial district, chinatown, street cars, theatres, and a great little art gallery where we made some wonderful purchases to begin our collection of fine art... check out Gallery 444 next door. Rafal Olbinski, Nelli Panto and Max Pappart were our favoites pieces... wish we could own the entire collections! The fun thing about this inn was that the first night returning from our evening out, we walked right past it !! Like a magical door to Narnia or the Secret Garden... Imagine waking up in a peaceful and warm room, putting on your robe and slippers and strolling down the hallway to a delightfully pleasant continental buffet breakfast ... Reading the morning paper in front of the fireplace and sipping a cup of fresh brewed coffee while dining on a blueberry muffin w/ yogurt and fresh fruit, as the rain coming down outside pitter-patted against the window... We would come home in the afternoon, take a nap, get dressed for the evening and as we headed out, our first stop was to enjoy some wine, cheese, and chocolate and wonderful conversation with other guests in the cozy fireside room. Other evenings we brought the wine and treats back to our room while we enjoyed a movie... These are the memories I treasure from our experience at the Inn. Apparently we are not the only ones who enjoy this luxuriously cozy hotel, as we found it completely booked on the future visits we had planned :( Overall I would have to say that we would stay here every visit if there were rooms available!!! So, risking further "booked" notices... I say if you can get a reservation and like a smaller hotel, then this is your Oasis!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lippy18
Reviews.Content: Nice little hotel, right in the centre of San Fran with some neat touches such as free continental breakfast and free evening cheese and wine. Our room even had a separate living room, a deep bath with spa, and a real fire place. Only down points were the slowness of having our bags brought to our room, and one or two minor points with the bathroom but nothing that would stop us returning here again. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: ey0001
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best small hotels I have stayed in. The location was great, just 1/2 block of union square. I liked the fact that it was small. The room I had (406) seemed to be slightly larger than the others with a queen bed and a separate sitting area with a small couch and chair. There was a desk and the tv was a large flat screen. I think i got a special rate on orbitz of $135 + tax per night. They had a nice continental breakfast with bagels, croissants, danish, apples/bananas, hard boiled egg, and cereals. They have coffee/tea all the time. The evening wine reception was cheese, chocolate, and crackers with wine or soda. They also had late-night cookies. There was free wi-fi and free newspaper. I will definately return to this hotel, it was a great deal. The staff were always nice and friendly and helpful with providing directions and how to use the public transit.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly gem of a place”
Reviews.Author: Evaluna71
Reviews.Content: We were not expecting the sheer quality of the room decor for the bargain price we payed for this wonderfully located hotel. Okay so it didn't have a grand front entrance, but how much time do you want to spend in a hotel's front entrance?! The desk clerk was very friendly and helpful and as we had arrived late in the day on a Saturday he offered to book us a restaurant nearby, Kuleto's, which proved a very good choice. Our room looked recently refurbished, very plush and the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom perfectly clean and fresh looking. Our room did have a view of the wall, but that meant it was quiet, and considering the hustle and bustle of Union Square a stone's throw away this was a definate bonus. We took in the view of the street by eating our breakfast at the end of the corridor in the little kitchen area one morning, when there were no free tables in the breakfast room. The breakfast was excellent considering it was described as a continental breakfast, which can often only mean a cup of coffee and a muffin. There were many different pastries, cereals, yoghurts, toast and fruit, we couldn't fault it. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a reasonably priced yet very comfortable and friendly hotel just off Union Square. We stayed here for the first 2 nights of a California & Las Vegas touring trip and it couldn't have been a better start for us, we loved it. Jayne Kelly

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, personal, comfy and a great location”
Reviews.Author: johnmcga
Reviews.Content: We picked the Inn at Union Square after doing heaps of research, and chose it for its location, reviews on here - plus the deal they were offering on rooms. We stayed for three nights at the end of a two-week holiday and were really impressed. The room was a standard Queen and a decent size - even by US standards! The bed was comfy, bathroom clean and spacious with a good shower and Aveda toiletries - and there was plenty of room to chill out and watch telly on the 32"(ish) LCD TV. With cable. Nice decor too - I think the place was refurbished recently, and they've put some real thought into making sure everything works well together. Ok - so the view of a wall was a bit disappointing, but this was the only downside of the room. We stayed in 6 or 7 hotels all around the same price on our trip, and this was definitely the best. What made it really special was the service and attention to detail. The staff were really helpful and genuinely friendly. Breakfast was pretty good and - unlike some previous visitors - we liked the small dining room. It made the place friendly, and you could always take as much food as you liked back to your room if you wanted to eat elsewhere. Wine and cheese each evening was a lovely touch, as was the on-tap coffee, cookies and other unpredictable treats! All in all, definitely recommended. So much better than an amorphous chain, and probably cheaper as well. Oh, and it was thirty seconds from Union Square - did I mention that?

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: hollyfairy
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, I cannot agree with most of the other reviews, this was the less desirable stay of our whole trip and although I felt I had researched well via TA we were really disappointed and some of the other nearby hotels looked a lot better. Firstly, the entrance to the hotel seemed like a shop front and we almost walked past it. The reception area was nothing like the photo on the hotel website. It was very small and no library as shown. There was no restaurant and the dining room only had four small round tables - no good in a 30 room hotel. The breakfast was acceptable although I assume this was brought in from outside as the hotel had no kitchen. At least three of the five desk staff didn't have a clue where to direct us when we enquired about eating out. When I originally booked I asked for a Queen suite no higher than 4th floor as I do not use elevators. The elevator was very tiny too. When we arrived, the computer system was "down" and they put us in a bedroom on the 5th floor, but when we eventually got up there (the key cards didn't work) it was just a room with a king bed - no good for 3 adults. They offered to bring up a z-bed but fortunately, I had the e-mail with me saying we had a queen suite booked, so they honoured it but we ended up on the 6th floor! We had a blocked toilet in the early hours. I reported it at 6.30am and they said someone would be up at 7am, nobody attended until 8am (after my 2nd phone call). All in all - the hotel is in a good location, but there are others nearby which look much better and I would use them instead.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the midst of the City.”
Reviews.Author: JohnWB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem. Right in the middle of San Francisco convenient to everywhere. Excellent and attentive service, very comfortable rooms and particularly quiet given the proximity of the downtown. Breakfasts were very good. If a very slight quibble is warranted, the breakfast room was a bit limited in size and overwhelmed by a television. I can't really fault the hotel. It had character and charm. Very good value. It excelled in attention to detail (eg fruit and cookies coffee and tea served on the second floor, a wine reception each evening, free morning newspapers). Parking is a bit of an issue like all hotels in San Francisco and it is best to avoid using a car until you leave the city. Great for couples although it isn't really a hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GiGi77
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Inn on Union Square a couple of hours before check in - and we were happily surprised that our room was ready for us. We booked a King Suite which had 2 seperate rooms - 1 bedroom and 1 living room area. The living room area was quite small and had 2 chairs (no couch) to watch TV with - we never used this room. We found that we were so busy taking in the sights of the beautiful city that all we needed was the bedroom. The room was beautifully decorated and we must agree with all of the other reviews that the breakfast was a huge bonus (as well good). We joked about who would make breakfast for us in the mornings when we returned home. I loved the chocolate chip cookies at night - in fact when we were out for dinner I had no need to order dessert knowing that back at our gem of a hotel there was tea and cookies waiting. The staff were friendly and helpful and well it is true that we looked out a brick wall - we were also looking at beautiful plants that had planted along the ledge of the exterior wall. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Glad we picked the Inn at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: la_bella_fortuna
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's narrow and the rooms are on the tiny side (at least ours was!), but lovely and enjoyable nonetheless. Staff was friendly and helpful - I'm going to sound ancient here, but it was surprising given their ubiquitous youth in which one might expect indifference or surliness, but they were all uniformly polite and service-driven. Room decor was tasteful, the bed and chairs comfortable and upholstered/covered in nice fabrics, the TV extra nice. No A/C, but with the fan on and the window wide open it was just right. That our window faced onto a brick wall was actually a plus in leaving it open with the curtains pulled aside all night. Was pleasantly surprised that street noise did not bother us in the least for sleeping. Super-strong shower with plenty of immediate hot water. Hairdryer, iron, robes, Aveda toiletries, water and chocolates are provided. Breakfasts were just enough choice - fruit, cereal, pastries, hard-boiled eggs, juice and coffee. Was surprised how good the wine was during the afternoon wine and cheese. Overall a lovely experience!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Inn at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: Oregonian4th
Reviews.Content: We booked a Queen room, which was the least expensive available. When we arrived we happily found we had a king bed. The room was small but comfortable. There is no AC but a ceiling fan and the windows open. The view was of a brick wall, which I am sure all the rooms have because of the way it is set up, but it was quiet. We could hear the bell of the cable car and that was cool! Very San Francisco! The bathroom was small with a tiny stall shower (not for the extra large types) with occasional hot/cold blasts, but great water pressure. Great bed and linens with down comforter and pillows. Very clean and classy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Union Square Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crussell6481
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square was an excellent hotel for our recent vacation. Some of the best aspects included: -Free breakfast every morning (bagels, fruit, yogurt, juice, etc.) -Excellent location near Union Square, Theater District, Chinatown, etc. -Cable car stop less than 1 minute walk on the corner of Post and Powell -Evening turn down service (with chocolate and water) -Friendly, helpful staff -Free wireless internet -Recently remodeled The only negatives were that the rooms were a bit on the small size and that there was no microwave/refrigerator in the room but there was one in the main lobby of our floor that we could use. I would highly recommend The Inn at Union Square for anyone travelling to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: suznrandy
Reviews.Content: My husband & I don't get away very often so we wanted somewhere special to stay on our weekend away. We upgraded to the jr. suite and loved it. We have vowed to stay at the Inn every time we visit San Fran. The staff was WONDERFUL! They catered to our every need and even left some cookies in our room for us when they knew we would be out for a late night. Can't say enough about this truely special hotel. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Well run and well located hotel - good value”
Reviews.Author: Seascale
Reviews.Content: Smallish, well-run hotel just off Union Square. There are not many amenities and limited communal space but this isn't really an issue given the location. Our room had been recently refurbished and was well-sized - decent bed too. Very helpful staff. Warmly recommended for short breaks (business or pleasure) in the city.

Reviews.Title: “We found a jewel in the heart of Frisco”
Reviews.Author: KanaGirl
Reviews.Content: We decided to jet off to San Francisco with a two day advance notice to join friends who were staying in the Union Square area, so we wanted to stay close but not at a big chain hotel and found The Inn at Union Square. Boy did I choose wisely! They stayed at the Westin and The Inn was right across the street, perfect. After a day of sightseeing and shopping our group of 6 always choose to wind down at our hotel because as they said "it's more fun!" They have quaint sitting areas and serve wine and snacks, great for chit chat and meeting other guest. This is included in your stay. We stayed in a King suite and compared to the rooms at the Westin it was the Taj Mahal. The room was very well appointed with beautiful linen, two flat screen tvs, closet space galore and a lovely sitting room. The only thing this hotel lacks is a restaurant to make it a 5 star but the Farallon is 10 steps away. Our friends have never stayed at a smaller property in SF but after experiencing The Inn they are converted. You will also feel secure here- in order to use the elevator or stairs you have to slide your room key. As far as comfort the bed was wonderful with feather pillows and the room was pitch dark and very quiet- I slept like a baby. In the morning you only had to walk down the hallway to find coffee or tea you didn't have to go hunting for it or wait for room service, I love having coffee while I get ready for my day. The complimentary continental breakfast was fresh and had numerous choices; fruit, pastry, bagels, hard boiled eggs, cereals, juices and more. The staff from the room attendants to the front desk clerks were terrific. They always greeted you with a smile and "hello". I accidentally left my keys in my room safe, they fell out of my purse and the safe was on the top shelf of the closet so since I'm of average height I didn't realize they were there. We realized we didn't have them when we were on the terminal bus back to the parking area at the airport. We called The Inn and spoke to Mark and he was more than happy to check the room safe and called us back within a few minutes and said it would be no problem sending them to us-- we got them Fed Ex priority the next day---Now thats customer service!!!! For the value, the luxury, the amenities, the location, the service this is the place to stay. It may be small but bigger is not always better.

Reviews.Title: “Good dowtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denizen
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better Union Square hotels I've stayed at. My room seemed to have been recently renovated and was pleasingly large, with a separate sitting area and large LCD tv. The hotel distinguishes itself by the little touches: Aveda bath products, complimentary breakfast, bottled water and chocolates, tea and cookies, a wine hour, complimentary wifi (although during the five days I was there the network was having major problems), bathrobes and umbrellas in the rooms. I had a room at the back of the hotel that was totally quiet but didn't feel gloomy. The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: mari_yuriko
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed staying at The Inn. I have stayed there twice & each time was very exceptional service. The staff is friendly, helpful & professional. The hotel gave me a very warming and cozy feeling. The rooms are clean & updated. There's complimentary continental breakfast in the mornings, and snacks & wine in the evenings. It's great for those who just want to sit down and relax next to the fireplace and read the paper after a full day out in the city! The Inn is very convenient to tons of shopping & restaurants, also the cable car line, definitely a great location. Overall, The Inn is one of my overall favorites and I will return the next time I visit San Fran.

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the heart of SF”
Reviews.Author: sqwawk
Reviews.Content: We wanted a small, friendly, hotel in the heart of San Francisco, and that is exactly what you get with the Inn. The hotel itself is nothing to look at from the outside...in fact it is easy to miss with its tiny reception area! However, the hotel has a quaint feel about it, the rooms are well laid out and clean and all the staff we met were very friendly. The small touches such as the continental breakfasts and evening cheese and wine in the communal area at the end of each corridor and the tea and jar of fresh cookies in the eveninig raise this above the average. Throw in the location too....just off Union Square...and you have a lovely alternative to one of the big soulless chains. A word of warning to those who like their rooms big. Although we found the room plenty big enough for our needs, and on a par with similar hotels in Britain, some may find the room a bit small. Also, do not expect views from the window...most of the rooms face onto the blank brick wall of the neigbouring building about 5 feet away! For me, these points in no way took away from the overall sense that this was a great find in the heart of SF.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic Inn - personalized service”
Reviews.Author: TravelKate
Reviews.Content: After reading the review here for the Inn at Union Square I booked it for 2 nights following running in the Nike Women's Marathon. I was pleasantly surprised by the Inn. It was charming and the staff was excellent. We arrived a bit early and were not able to check in early, but the staff stored our bags and offered to call when the room was ready. We did not arrive back until late that evening and we commented that we had missed the wine and cheese reception. The staff overheard and brought a bottle of wine to our room. My only complaint is that the rooms can get a bit warm if you visit at a warm time - the hotel does not have air conditioning. If you're looking for a romantic, convenient spot - with great reommendations for places to visit, eat, etc. the Inn is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in the heart of Union Square”
Reviews.Author: carlacs
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation at the Warwick, but it was full so they sent us to the Inn at Union Square and paid the rate difference. What a wonderful surprise!!! Location was unbeatable if you want to be in the Union Square section of town. Rooms were cozy and loved the fact that they have a living room section where the TV is located and that the bedroom is separated from the living room section by a door (perfect if one person wants to watch TV but the other wants to sleep). Breakfast were very good, cheeses and dried fruits served with the wine were excellent and there was plenty of both!. The chocolate chip cookiest that are available at night are wonderful and definetely fresh. All these is complimentary. The staff is friendly and helpful. For example, we checked in early and since our room was not ready, we left the suitcases downstairs. When we came in a couple hours later, the suitcases were in our room waiting for us! Our room in the 6th floor was very quiet. All in all a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great find in the heart of San Fran”
Reviews.Author: BMKATL
Reviews.Content: I needed a hotel in Union Square and was lucky enough to find this gem. Before booking i read a few really negative reviews on TripAdvisor... which almost made me change my reservation. I ended up staying at the hotel and was VERY please I did. Here are some key attributes: 1. Location: Very good location in the city 2. Price: Great price... i got a great room for around $150/night when most other nicer hotels in the Union Sq area were double that. 3. Very comfortable rooms: while the room was small, it had a very comfortable bed, great lines, newly redone bathroom and Free Wi-fi throughout the hotel. 4. Character: I realize that the building is old, but that creates some of the character. I would prefer to stay in a hotel like this with some style than the standard, generic Hiltons/Marriotts in each city. 4. Nice staff: very professional and courteous staff The only small issue... Parking cost $40/day which is tough to swallow, but par for the course in San Fran. I travel a lot and have stayed in many hotels... this was as good as any (shy of the ritz or 4 seasons) and i would definitely stay at this or other Kimpton hotels again. Bryan, Atlanta

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Inn at Union Square”
Reviews.Author: birman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at Union Square for 3 nights(13th - 16th Sept 2006). We thoroughly enjoyed the hotel and all the service it offered including the wine and cheese in the evening prior to dinner and the hot coffee on our return in the evening. The rooms were small but beautiful no complaints whatsoever. The Alcatraz tour was brillant as was the city tour, we hired bikes from Blazing Saddles and biked across the Golden Gate Bridge into Sausolitio, that was amazing really worth doing. The food was brilliant, we had lunch at the Cheesecake Factory in Macys that was excellent, dinners: Chinatown at Brandy Hoes excellent, North Beach at the North Beach Cafe that was absolutely brilliant, and sorry to our last meal was awful, this was at the highly recommended Scala's (next to the Sir Francis Drake Hotel) I would certainly NOT recommend this establishment, food was awful, pasta so salty I could'nt eat it and my brother's steak was only fit to sole your shoes(and by the way it was not well done, but cooked just under medium).

Reviews.Title: “Charming, Friendly, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: marlenenh
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Union Square is a very charming hotel. The staff was so friendly...from the front desk staff to the people setting tending to the fireplace where the complimentary breakfast is served. Breakfast included yogurt, bagels, pastries, fruit, granola, hard boiled eggs, orange juice, coffee, and tea. Also included is wine and cheese in the evenings. We were never around at time so I cannot comment on that. The rooms were clean, pretty and comfortable. The location was perfect - right at Union Square and steps away from catching a trolley. The lobby is small but this was fine with us. We didnt spend alot of time in the lobby. I would definitely stay at the Inn at Union Square again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: tipps
Reviews.Content: After over 20 hours aircraft travel from Perth, Western Australia the Inn at Union Square was a welcomed and pleasant experience for my wife and myself. The staff were very friendly and helpful and we were pleasantly surprised with our suite which was very clean, comfortable and quiet. We were impressed with the warmth and homiliness of the hotel together with the inclusive continental breakfast, business centre with travel information and free internet access for guests and the evening happy hour. The hotel is perfectly positioned in the better part of San Francisco close to Union Square, shopping centres, restaurants and the famous Cable Cars that take you down to Fisherman's Wharf. Our three night's stay at the Inn at Union Square was most enjoyable and a great start for our USA and Canada holiday. I would have no hesitation in staying at this hotel again or recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Inn”
Reviews.Author: kanderson89
Reviews.Content: Like the previous post, we throughly enjoyed our stay at the Inn at Union Square but with a little more attention it could have been great. Then again, we only paid $149 which is a bargain given the location. We stayed for 10 days and booked an Internet special. Our room (5th floor) was fine and included a king-sized bed, two nightstands, arm chair and ottoman, armoir with TV, and desk and chair...all Georgian style. There are other updated rooms that have more modern features. Ours, however, were in good shape. Bathroom had tub/shower (great water pressure), toilet and sink with marble counter. It's on the small side for most American tourists, but we're used to traveling in Europe and found the size just fine...particularly for the small amount of time we spent there. A few quirks to be aware of: the hotel is extremely narrow, meaning our two windows overlooked some air exchange units to other buildings in the block. It could be quite loud, but it actually became like white noise, blocking out the various sirens and sounds of the city. We had our windows open the whole time, and the breeze was delightful. We lucked out and had sun and 65 degrees for our entire trip making for perfect sleeping weather. The location of the hotel can't be beat, and in fact, a few locals who were with us on the Supershuttle from the airport remarked such. The hotel is bordered by Farallon, an excellent seafood restaurant, and Morton's, a steakhouse. Borders is in the same block, as is a Walgreen's for those misc items you forgot. The cable car stops right in front of Borders, but you will have better luck walking the three/four blocks to the Powell station to catch them when they turn around. During the week was a minimal wait - weekends were nuts. The hotel also has great restaurants around it - Scala's Bistro, Postrio, Kuleto's are within a block or so. If you're a shopper, there are numerous high-end stores all around Union Square. The other perks of breakfast and evening treats have been mentioned in prior posts. Same was true for us: quite generous morning breakfast, though it seemed to be a slow time at the hotel, meaning we had to go down to the third floor to get it. There are small lounges at the end of each floor but depending on how full the hotel was, sometimes breakfast was served there, sometimes just on 3rd....no big deal. Each morning included coffee, freshly squeezed OJ, granola and raisin bran, various donuts or quick breads, bagels, hard boiled eggs, yogurt. You can either eat there or bring back a tray to your room. Sometimes there were folks who wanted to chat, and depending on our mood we either chatted or just got a tray. You can feel free to do either. The San Fran Chronicle was delivered to our door each day except for Sunday which you had to pay for at the front desk - just a buck, I think. Evening hors'doeuvres were three different cheeses (brie, blue, and swiss), crackers, dried fruit, chocolates, and either chardonnay or cab sauv. Although breakfast was quite generous, the evening snacks were a bit chintzy and you had to get there early to score any cheese. Again, we usually took a tray back to the room, though we did have a couple nice chats with some folks from Britain and Pittsburgh. The staff was quite pleasant, though their concierge services could be improved. We asked advice on car rental agencies and could have used a heartier endorsement, instead of the bland "any are fine" response. Housekeeping folks were incredibly helpful - more so than front office staff....though, again, all were pleasant and remembered you when you came back at the end of the day. All in all, this place is an incredible value, best for folks who appreciate the location and comfort and niceties. If you're expecting the Ritz-Carlton and will settle for nothing less, look somewhere else. If the things I describe appeal to you, you won't be disappointed. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “What a fun getaway”
Reviews.Author: TheMannClan
Reviews.Content: My husband had business in SF, so I joined him after his conference for a long weekend in the city. Since we were able to "ditch" all three of our preschoolers, we decided to stay at a smaller, more intimate hotel right in the heart of things. The Inn at Union Square was perfect for that. We stayed in a room that featured a fireplace, small sofa and coffee table. Our view was out over some garages and into the neighboring office-type buildings. Because I love the sounds of a bustling city, we slept with our windows open. The room was small, but perfectly adequate for two travelers. The bathroom was small...just a toilet & bathtub. I noticed some peeling wallpaper, but nothing horrendous. The vanity area outside of the bathroom had very little counter space, but no big deal. I have very little counter space at home! The linens were nice and the pillows devine. Once we got the correct cable, we were able to use the internet effortlessly. We particularly enjoyed the little wine and cheese gatherings in the early evening. We met different people every night, which, for us, is the wonderful part of traveling. The location couldn't have been any better....just a half a block off of Union Square. We didn't rent a car and were able to get everywhere we wanted mostly on foot, occassionally by public transportation and once by cab. For the price, we would definitely stay at the Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at The Inn at Union Square in late February 2006. Our stay was a very pleasant experience. Regarding the hotels location, you would not want to be staying anywhere else. Transport, shopping, restaurants, nightlife were only a block or two away. The rooms were quaint and adequate with old style decorating, which added to its ambience. Rooms were not overly big, but comfortable. No views out of the window, but no big deal. The afternoon wine and cheese sessions were a really good idea. It gave you an opportunity to mix with other guests if that is what you want. The staff were helpful. The boutique style of the hotel added to our overall excellent opinion of San Francisco and would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location!”
Reviews.Author: TheTravelingLady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at Union Square for three nights and found it to be a very pleasant experience. Like most older hotels, it had some quirks but that was part of the appeal. Traveling with a teen-ager, the only complaint we had about the petite suite was that the couch and pull-out bed left a bit to be desired. However, that said, everything else was great. The carpets were recently shampooed, the room was clean, the staff was excellent and responsive to our needs. We enjoyed the breakfasts and afternoon wine/cheese. Our room was located on the same floor, and we had no problems with noise, and certainly enjoyed the convenience. We would stay there again and recommend it to our friends!

Reviews.Title: “faded glory”
Reviews.Author: Swallowtail Sunset Gallery
Reviews.Content: Great Service, great location. Kinda grubby in the corners and along the baseboards. The finish on the bathtub was peeling off and quite a bit of mildew on the bath tiles in the tub. The bedding was worn and the pillows were terrible little tiny flat things that were goosedown about 5 years ago. Now they are just goose fragments. Good wine and cheese at happy hour for free. The internet was down for 3 days but they offered to repay us if we wanted to use dial-up. this was too much hassle for me so I just used their computer on the second floor which was very nice in a nicely decorated room. Would not stay there again, but not a bad place just not a great place either.
